Reviews.Title: “Its a Resort and a place initself . Not a Hotel please”
Reviews.Author: INDIAOUTSOURCES
Reviews.Content: I have a Long Flight to reach to Orlando , a. This is a resort located approx 20-25 minutes from the Airport and you can have Shared Cab from mears transportation.costing 35-40 USD return ,Seems ok b. Its a resort , so no Hotel Services , you would surely need your own vehicle for transportation . c. Check In was fairly simple . Teressa helped me quickly to get into . But issue was that with all Luggage if you need to walk another 120 meters it becomes difficult as they are apartments upto 3 floors spreaded in blocks . So if your floor is 3rd Floor you need to carry all your luggage . d. Fortunately my One BHK was downstairs . And I found Bed , room decent , but lighting was very dull color was dark blue which was little irritating . e. Good thing you had Microwave , fridge and lot of things kitchen Cutleries to prepare food. You can find things to prepare from Canteen at the Back side near pool f. You have flat TV in Both rooms , but of No Use , not much international Channels g. Wifi is useless , it doenst come at all in rooms though its complimentary , but works fine in Lobby . h. Celebrity Spa and Fitness Centre have decent collection of fitness equipment , Being Fitness freak I love to find these places. Since a lot of greenery around and artificial beach volley wall , natural place to sit around and spend a lot of time with nature. i . You would find mosquito outside incase you decide to do a workout in open or just a peaceful sitting k. Bathtub had hairs which was not cleaned and jacuzzi was for name sake l. Pool Side areas are good , they have DJ and COmplete family fun But I would not like to use this incase I have to go to Theme Parks , they are far off and without your own vehicle costly affair They charge Resort Fees .. Do not know why ? Booked it through Agoda.com All in all a nice experience with little adventure . Not for Business , only for family or couples

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Mark D
Reviews.Content: Nice quiet place to stay, off the beaten track, easy access to major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: yuispider
Reviews.Content: Stayed for my honeymoon in the 1 bedroom villa, it was gorgeous, beautifuly decorated, nice and quiet. The only down side is that on the fotos the pool looked much bigger than it actually is but other than that our stay there was fantastic, we plan on returning some day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort with Lots of Activities”
Reviews.Author: stbutler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March 2012 for Spring Break. We took the kids to Sea World and Busch Gardens. There were lots of activities at this resort that would keep you busy without leaving. The rooms were nice and laid out well. Only issue is the beds were not as comfortable as I would have liked.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, only minor issue”
Reviews.Author: cipollavin
Reviews.Content: Only issue we had was the setup of the rooms. Every 2 rooms have an adjoining foyer. So, to get to your room, your 1st have to unlock a door to get to the foyer that leads to the 2 hotel room doors. So, if you have an inconsiderate neighbor like we did, they would activate the deadbolt and leave the foyer door open. Also, if your neighbor left their hotel room door open, the noise would echo in the foyer. They have doorbells that on some rooms are mislabeled, like ours. So the inconsiderate guests will ring all the door bells as they walked down the hallway, this happened too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location. Nice big room/suites. Had a great family stay.”
Reviews.Author: CadillacCouple
Reviews.Content: Great place for a family vacation. Kids really enjoyed the pool. Nice health club- better than most hotels. Suite was very spacious and kitchen was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: Jay L
Reviews.Content: Completely lacks professionalism. Staff admitted that the ownership is responsible for not investing int he property. Apparently the owner is pretty frugal and lacks a good reputation. Stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value, beautiful location!”
Reviews.Author: Dullege
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two weeks in January and had an absolutely fantastic time! The resort is located within striking distance of almost every attraction in Orlando. The area is very well maintained and very peaceful. The staff are courteous and very helpful and gave us some good tips on times to see things and times to avoid huge crowds. The pool area is very nice and the little shops around them are delightful. The spa in the hotel area is phenomenal, although a bit pricey it was a nice luxury. There's free wi-fi and you just ask for a code from the front desk. The rooms are very nice and most of them have a patio with a table and some chairs where you can sit in the shade and look at the gardens and wildlife. Overall this was my family's third time staying here and we will continue to do so in the future, just an excellent location!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place with great accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Lynforde
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one week in a 3 bedroom(the third bedroom was a lockout with a pull out couch). The condo was very nice, clean and modern! Great balcony too! The resort is a little dated but still nice. Two pools, one hot tub, tennis, basketball, small driving range. We enjoyed our stay but we have stayed at better "resorts" in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort, needs to address a few issues.”
Reviews.Author: Mandy D
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in March, and for the most part were very happy with the resort. The grounds are beautiful and the room was spotless. There were 8 of us in a 2 bedroom suite, and we found it to be quite spacious. Our concerns were 1.the fire alarm went off at 1am our first night there, and we had trouble locating the stairs as there was no sign on the door and the exit sign was placed in such a way that we couldn't see it from down the hallway. 2. it was noted by 2 members of our group (who happen to bee electricians) that there were a number of unsafe issues with some of the outlets, lighting, etc. One other negative we encountered was getting sucked into a timeshare presentation. We were promised $100 and free breakfast for attending a 45 minute meeting to discuss changes to our Wyndham ownership. It turned into 1.5 hour argument with a very pushy salesman who continued to bother us throughout the week .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Facility Close to Disney”
Reviews.Author: ecseps
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week with the family and really liked all the facility had to offer. Great pools and pool bar with enough activities to keep everyone interested. The resort has a tennis academy located there so you will run into your fair share of collage kids doing collage kid things when not playing tennis...but they were fun!

Reviews.Title: “Lock-out or no lock-out, that is the question”
Reviews.Author: howieeg
Reviews.Content: At this Star island Resort and Club, there is the matter of a huge facility involving two different time-share companies -- with mine being the Wyndham Resort/RCI group. To top it all off, the timeshare units here are also sold on a nightly basis by the resort itself as well as other discount websites. Added to that, some units have been updated several years ago, some a few years ago and some last year. Some units (seen from photos) seem like a 1990s Tuscan brothel, while the later ones are nicely updated with sort of a retro-early 1960s Floridian style. The Wynham upgrades are not nearly as nice as the other upgraded units. Some overzealous decorator decided to overreach and remove the mirrors and columns, while keeping the tacky wannabe classical prints intact. The result is rather plane and incomplete. The upgraded interiors for the non-Wyndham units nicely incorporate the columns and mirrors into a more unique modern decor. Also some of the master-bedroom jacuzzi tubs have a built-in step, appallingly lacking in other suites. The absence of any steps in other suites, including the guest-bath jacuzzi, should be considered a safety violation. I got scrapes and bumps trying to use the thing, and our guests using the other bather just gave up altogether and used the shower in the master suite. So the point is, you never really know what your getting until you got it. Well, there is one thing for sure: If your look down the reviews on this site, invariably, the negative comments come from people staying the lock-out unit, while the positive comments come from he guests staying at the full one- and two-bedroom units. It amazes me that people will grab the units in the cheapest category and then start complaining as if they thought they were entitled to the penthouse at Trump Tower or something. Even the cheapest units, which I’ve seen advertised between $80 and $90, would be considered a genuine suite in a standard hotel -- with a wet-bar style kitchen, two flat-screen TVs and a fold-out couch in the living room in addition to a small bedroom. By the way, a “ lock-out unit,” a term we timeshare owners are supposed know (except I just found out), means a smaller part of a double-unit that can be expanded or closed off for separate rentals. It should be no surprise their proximity to their bigger counterpart units would be “susceptible to the decibel” -- hence, all the previous comments about “paper-thin walls.” Our closed-off two-bedroom unit -- with balcony, full kitchen, a great second bedroom and jacuzzi guest bathroom -- were pretty much sound proof, and I don’t think anyone outside could even hear the screams and moans from us scraping our knees and shins on those infernal jacuzzi tubs. But I must say, it’s hard to do better -- using timeshare points or paying fare like a hotel -- than this resort -- immaculate, expansive grounds, full work-out room, a small lake and water sports, a small beach, tons of tennis courts, a genuine spa (with great deals) two true resort-style pools with special water features, great pool-side bar service, a wonderful gift-shop and grill and nightly entertainment at the open-air bar above the main building. The staff was friendly and efficient, quickly complying for requests for extra towels, pillows and coffee. Being technically a time-share resort, maid service is not included, not even the complimentary mid-week clean-up that comes with virtually all Wyndham/RCI weeklong stays. There is separate Wyndham/RCI desk — not for checking in, but to arrange timeshare sales. We took our maid-service complaint to the staff, but they, alas, are not there for existing clients but for future clients. Well, they were charming, so we took up their time-share sales offer (just to hear their pitch, not to buy) in order to get their promised reward of a $125 American Express card. Lo and behold, the time-share sales pitch went smoothly (with a gracious, lovely femle agent), with limited sales pressure, and it was well within the promised 90-minute time allotment. We used our “prize” money on a budget spruce-up service ($22), which included making up the beds and replacing towels, and, later, $40 total room-clean up, which brought the unit back to its pristine first impression.

Reviews.Title: “Nice grounds and plenty of activities to choose from”
Reviews.Author: KevandKaren
Reviews.Content: My ratings start with 4 stars and go up or down from there. For a 5th star it has to have something that really sets itself apart. My experience: We booked a 1BR at the Star Island Resort through Interval International a few months before our visit to Orlando and Spring Break. We came for the Universal Studios and Disneyland type of trip with our 9-yr old daughter. The confirmation came for our unit (2144 A) and described the unit as only having a bar sized microwave and fridge with no kitchen. We were prepared for the smaller size as it was our only available choice. When we arrived we were surprised to find a full-size fridge, dishwasher, 2-burner stove, utensils and a microwave that doubles as an oven. We realized that the description was for the lockout side of 2144 (B). So lesson here is to understand if you are really on the lockout side of the unit or not, and call if you have to in order to verify the amenities. I would have cancelled based on the description, but since I had no other choice, I was ready. Check-in was fast and friendly. The grounds were beautiful. The unit was not oversized but just right for a 1BR. Yes, some of the units had a walkway in front of the living room (as did ours), but privacy was not an issue as the shades would not allow a view into your room anyway. The resort had 2 full size pools which were well used and a hot-tub. The on-site / poolside gift shop also doubles as a short order kitchen and has just about everything you may have forgotten. My only regret is that we only used the resort to stage our Theme Park vacation and did not allow a day to just relax at the resort. Pros: Friendly staff and activities every day for both the kids (Pizza night) and adults (Drink specials). Close to the Theme Parks (15 minutes) Numerous restaurants close by Nice pools and Tennis courts Game room for the kids Cons Pricey - 2 Margaritas were $18 at the pool bar. Walls are noticeably thin so expect to hear your neighbors and be heard. Internet is extremely spotty and often dropped which required you to re-enter your authorizations code. This happened so many times everyone in the family had the code memorized. Very frustrating.

Reviews.Title: “Can not wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: pkbehappy
Reviews.Content: Wonderful resort, clean room, large, newer furnishing. Washer/dryer, dishwasher. Two Pools....Close to Disney, Arabian Knights and Midevil Times.

Reviews.Title: “Small but nice.....”
Reviews.Author: BCalla8035
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Star Island last week to visit friends. We had a timeshare that was listed as a (1) bedroom, but we got an "efficiency unit" as is known to the regulars there. Not sure what happened there but I didn't push it, it was only my husband and I. It was very small, holiday inn size with separate bedroom, kitchenette that included a dorm size fridge, 2 stove top burners (only one worked), coffe pot with no supplies and a toaster. No oven. The kitchenette is part of the small living room. The bathroom had a pedestal (???) sink, very! limited counter and storage space. But it was very clean. We were originally assigned a ground floor room in an older building, but because we arrived early (10 a.m., check-in is at 4), we were able to switch to a newer renovated top floor corner room. And thank God because you can hear all conversations, not even yelling, but regular conversations! though the walls. I brought ear plugs in case and used them so I got some sleep. The bedroom had 2 twin beds, fairly comfortable, but again very clean. The staff were all very nice, but they absolutely! refuse to do any room change requests over the phone.....I tried several times before we got there to no avail. So I called when I landed and I must say they were very nice about early check-in which was great once we got to the resort. There is only one pool for the entire complex, and it gets very crowded. Need to grab a chair early. They have many tennis courts, but they were usually being used by a local school or club, saw only one court that renters could use at most times. The complex itself is small in comparison to other resorts I have stayed at, the "lake" is very small with no swimming, the gym gets filled but has decent equipment. I did like seeing the same people at the pool day after day, it was easy to make friends and converse. Overall it was a good experience, I would stay here again, but I think the location of the room has alot to do with whether or not you enjoy your experience based on noise, size, and amenities. The location cannot be beat, near everything including a Publix nearly right across the street (two lane double road, difficult to cross safely), main boulevard street with lots of stores including Dunkin' Donuts (yea!), but you still need a car to access most safely.

Reviews.Title: “Good overall. We'd stay again.”
Reviews.Author: zipporah8
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at Star Island Resort in late February/early March of 2011. We were happy with the resort overall, although we didn't participate in any of the on-site activities. We thought that the pool area was very nice and the grounds appeared to be very well kept. The unit was nice, but perhaps not what I would expect from a gold rated resort since there was obvious staining (including something a little clumpy like candle wax) on the carpet and the appliances were on the older side. We were in what they label a 3-bedroom, which was actually both sides of a lockoff unit, and the third bedroom was really a den with a sleeper sofa, so that might be unfortunate for some if they were expecting 3 standard bedrooms. Fortunately, we knew this ahead of time since their site indicates it. We did like that there was a washer and dryer in the unit. For people going to the theme parks, this resort was very well situated. Our drive time from resort to parking area was nearly the same for both Disney and Universal, and both were only about 15 or 20 minutes. Not bad at all. Two other big things that I liked about this resort. 1. They didn't pressure us to attend their timeshare presentation - I only had to say no thanks once and that was the end of it. 2. Fast maintenance - our smoke detector battery started going bad and beeping. We called it in and they had someone there in just a few minutes to replace the battery. Bottom line: we'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Recent vacation disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Matt H
Reviews.Content: The check in staff at this resort was very courteous, but they definitely were the only ones. Rooms were small. Not worth the money. This was booked for me through a time share ownership and thank goodness this is not our home time share. Don't forget anything in your room either since that will be at your expense to have it returned too. Pool was freezing cold, not heated. I found car keys on the grounds and called the front desk to inform them. It was 11:30 at night and they actually made me walk the keys to the front desk in the DARK GROUNDS. This is not a well lit property at night. As a woman I did not feel safe. NO courteous coffee or tea in the room. I could have received more for my money elsewhere. I will not be back to this resort after the bad experience I had. Maybe if I wasn't already an owner the staff would have treated me differently, but buyer beware and visitors were not treated any better. Next time I would rather spend a couple of nights at the Holiday Inn up the street. Staff there were nice, friendly, and made me feel very welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation”
Reviews.Author: Paul Z
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week's family vacation at the Star Island Resort the end of February. We were in Building 25 on the 6th floor, a corner unit. It was a large 3 bedroom, 2 bath unit which included a full kitchen.The master bedroom had a large whirlpool bath. The 2nd bedroom had two full beds, and the 3rd bedroom had a sofa bed. The sofa in the living room also made into a bed if needed. The beds were all comfortable. We were provided with microwave popcorn, coffee filters, a small bottle of dish soap, and dishwasher soap. Our unit had a washer and dryer, with clothing soap provided. Our towels were picked up and washed during the middle of the week, and returned promptly. The resort is older, but everything inside the unit was clean, and updated within the last year. The walls were a soft lime green. We did not have any problems with the unit. It was very quiet, and we could only hear the karaoke at night if we went out on the deck. There was plenty to do at the resort, from dinners, tennis, golf,and swimming. We were too busy at the parks to spend much time at the resort. We did take in the karaoke several nights, and the pool, a couple of afternoons. We felt safe, it was close to many grocery stores, and there were unlimited places to eat. We would recommend this resort. We would love to return! The only thing that we would change in the unit is the entry to the whirlpool bath in the master bedroom. It is difficult to get in and out of, needs some steps.

Reviews.Title: “Inconsistent”
Reviews.Author: Gneiss1
Reviews.Content: We only stayed 1night. Since we weren't time share owners, we got the 1 bedroom mini suite. We were in building 14 on the first floor. It was a dungeon. You couldn't open the shades, due to privacy and looking at a/c units, which you heard running all night long. There aren't enough lights to make the place bright. The furniture, carpeting, beds and sofa are in desperate need of updating. Our friends traded their timeshare for a larger suite. Big difference. Top floor. Quiet. Full kitchen. Living room. I didn't get to use the extras the resort offers. They do seem to have quiet a list. The pay area for kids looked like it would be a lot of fun for little children. I don't think I would go back here.

Reviews.Title: “A big disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: finesew
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Star Island as part of a bonus Wyndham vacation. We had a 1 bedroom suite with a small kitchen/livingroom. It had 2 small double beds, a saggy couch in the livingroom, a microwave that didn't work very well, small fridge, 2 burner hot plate, a makeshift kitchen counter unit. We had 2 windows but had to keep the blinds closed at all times as they faced out to the well used walkway that everyone used to access the elevators. The bathroom fan was incredibly noisy. The walls were paper thin. We could hear everything our neighbours said including their dryer which they ran until midnight when the cycle finished with a buzzer. We smelled everything they cooked. There was no coffee table in the livingroom so we fashioned one out of a shelf and the luggage rack. There really wasn't anything to do other than look at the four walls and TV. We spent all of our days outside of the unit. We tried to upgrade to a unit with a larger bed and balcony and were told that the resort was fully booked although we saw several dark units at night and unused balconies during the day. At one time the resort may have been nice but it is definitely tired. It may be ok for families trying to save money on food. We left and ended up spending 3 days of our vacation at a nice spot I found on Pompano Beach. We only returned to the unit to sleep the last night before our flight out of Orlando. The area is surrounded by chain restaurants where you can get a lot of cheap food quickly. The resort staff were not helpful with the upgrade. We checked in late at night and the attendant was quite grumpy as the booking had been doubled (not by us!) and for some reason we had 2 units booked. Our unit was in bldg. 21 on the 5 floor at the end of the complex away from the pool, bar and noisy karaoke. The complex is huge and a car is a must. It is not a classy resort by any means. A C+ rating given by another review would be accurate. Perhaps a larger unit with a balcony would be better. We were told that we had to come down and register with Wyndham so that they knew everyone staying at the resort. A ploy to get you to their 90 minute time share talk. On the promise of a $100 AMEX card and Wyndham 3/2 vacation we booked the Sun.10am talk but were told when we showed up that was for owners and we would have to return at 11:30. We didn't bother wasting anymore of our day and instead decided to leave the resort for something better. I would never consider purchasing a time share at this resort and will never return again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifull!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sweetgrape
Reviews.Content: The best room in the area. The room was very clean. I love the valentine package was so romantic, fresh rose petals on jacucci with a bottle of champange and strawberrys chocolate covered and a heart shape in top of the bed. We enjoy every moment in the resort. We just want to stay there for ever. I recomended.

Reviews.Title: “Large resort with questionable customer service”
Reviews.Author: schleichs89
Reviews.Content: Many employee's that all have different levels of training who need to get on the same page! Dirty towels were left outside the room for 2 days in a plastic bag after being told to put them there and they would be picked up. Very little kitchen utensils; no pizza cutter, coffee maker-no filters etc.... Requested a room away from the music upon check-in and the request was basically denied, the secretary stated, "all of our rooms are equal." The resort was not busy, have no idea why this request was not granted.

Reviews.Title: “Nice vacation spot”
Reviews.Author: Sadie303
Reviews.Content: Number one - the room was very clean. Staff friendly, pools great with lots of chairs, well stocked gift/confectionary/grocery shop. Lots to do including a great Spa. Would go back! Close to disney if thats in the cards for you.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: Nursejudy3
Reviews.Content: We traded into this property and almost cancelled the reservation because of past reviews. That would have been a mistake! The grounds are well maintained and very pretty. Staff was both professional and friendly. Our villa was on the 6th floor of building 22...very quiet with a beautiful view and well appointed. When we arrived, we did have some maintainence issues but reported them and they were fixed VERY quickly. Saw 1 cockroach (but it IS central Florida) and reported it. We checked in on a Saturday night and the facility staff came immediately. Received a phone call that the villa had been put on the list to be visited by the professional exterminator ...was that ok while we occupied the unit? I was concerned about chemicals...so were they...but they used traps that were discreetly placed. No more insect sightings! The location of the property is in an area with a variety of restaurants and convenient to Disney parks. We did not find the area at all threatening...it was just like the rest of the Orlando/Kissimmee areas...touristy and multinational. They tried very hard to have a variety of activities daily and on Super Bowl Sunday, had a great party with well priced food. All in all, we enjoyed our stay here much more than we'd anticipated.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for Disney!”
Reviews.Author: islandlovers1008
Reviews.Content: We traded in our timeshare and received the A,B and C unit in building 24 on the third floor. It had the master bedroom with huge bath, 2 double beds in one room and another bedroom with double. It was clean, upgraded with flat screens, and kitchen was well stocked. I enjoyed having the washer/dryer combo as well so we came home with no dirty clothes which is nice bonus. The kids loved the bouncy house and playground area near pool. This was the perfect location to Disney, Publix supermarket is 2 minutes away and restaurants are everywhere on main highway. We packed lunch for Disney everyday with extra drinks and saved a bundle as my kids would have ordered PBJ sandwiches anyway. My husband enjoyed having a driving range right there too! Definitely would return!!

Reviews.Title: “Run Down place with minimal service”
Reviews.Author: Desi_traveler_77
Reviews.Content: I was unfortunately placed at this resort as part of a time share with a company. We were given a 1bdrm 1 bath. The registration was simple and there was no additional selling of any type. On arrival to our garden style codo unit 13, our door was full of cobwebs. The room itself was very run down, made up of a room with 2 full size beds and a family room with a mini fridge, 2 burner stove, sink, microwave, and dishwasher. The bedroom has a tiny window that faces another wall so there is minimal sunlight. There is large LCD tv about 42". The beds were relatively comfortable. The other room has a sofa bed that is basically a row of springs with a thin mattress on top, NOT comfortable at all. The stove is a flat surface deal that is a pain to cook on. They also give you three pans to cook with, and some dishes, plates, and silverware. Sadly they don't give you anything to wash the dishes with, or detergent for the dishwasher. The bathroom is a normal size, but when using the shower the water all spills out. Also if you try to shower at any busy time there is no hot water. Even when there is hot water it is only luke warm. Also they give you 4 towels for the whole week. You can have the towels exchanged once during your one week stay for free, but otherwise if you want more towels you have to pay for them or steal them from the pool. The pools are nice, with one heated pool, and another pool that is sometimes heated. There is a bar, and hot dog place pool side. There is also a convenience store next to the pool that sells most groceries, house hold items, sandwiches and touristy stuff. There is also a great bounce house for the kids in addition to multiple tennis courts. Overall, the One bedroom units are like a dungeon, with very little sunlight and no balcony. From the pictures, the two bedroom units look much more spacious and well lit.

Reviews.Title: “Prison Cell w/ Bright Colors”
Reviews.Author: riverboat_capt
Reviews.Content: After the very nice fountain and fish pond at the entrance, it was all downhill. After registration you are directed to Customer Services to pickup your parking pass. Once there, you need to fill out more paper work, including income level, so they can try to sell you time share space. First room was 1212B, first floor, entrance was next to the vending machine under the stairs. We requested a different room. 2413B first floor on the "Newer Side", was across from the elevator, windows that looked directly on to the side walk that ran against the building. The blinds had to be drawn at all times as people walking by looked directly in to both the bed room and kichen/sitting area. The rooms have brightly painted block walls and decor that looks like a design on a dime episode gone very wrong. We had booked for (7) days - left in 14 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Chanel L
Reviews.Content: A real must stay! Stay in a "new" 3 bedroom and it was so nice! My friends and I will stay again! AMAZING!

Reviews.Title: “Cannot recommend highly enough!”
Reviews.Author: Lawyer13
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon in November and fell in love with it. The apartment was clean and spacious. We had a huge bed and hot tub in the master bedroom and an amazing view from the balcony. The staff were helpful and even found us a kettle. The pool was amazing and the cocktails even better. Close to Disney and Universal, with a TGI Fridays in walking distance which delivered to the pool. I just can't stop gushing about this place. I'd move there if I could!

Reviews.Title: “Great location / Great relaxation”
Reviews.Author: Stephen W
Reviews.Content: Superb proximity to Disney, Seaworld, Old Town Kissimmee, shopping, dining, many other attractions. Great for couples or families. Very nice digs, lovely grounds. Great place to come home to after day of fun. Cocoa beach is about an hour away, but if you get a nice ride, like a convertible Camaro, it's a blast. Great pool area, super fun bar/outdoor lounge, very helpful staff. Excellent relaxation services, i.e., massage, etc...very good call among the many choices available.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for a Disney vacation”
Reviews.Author: MotorcycleTraveler42
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at Star Island Resort. And will definitely go again. Four of us stayed in a 3 bedroom villa that had a large jacuzzi in the master bedroom and a regular size jacuzzi tub in one of the 3 bathrooms. The Resort personnel were helpful and very polite. There was ample parking. Two heated outdoor pools and a whirlpool. Inside there's a well equipped exercise room and a locker room with sauna, whirlpool and showers. They have a cute little hot dog cart for a quick lunch snack and the small market also doubles as an ice-cream shop. There are several different activities going on at various times of the day and there is a day spa on the property that offers massages to die for. (extra charge- but reasonable!) But besides all this the BEST part was that Disney World was only 4 miles away and the traffic was virtually non-existent! Once we made it to the Disney Parking lot at the end of the fireworks display, it was a very easy 10-15 minute ride back to the resort (and into the jacuzzi). It may not be like staying on the Disney property, but for the price you can't beat it. Love it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value family resort”
Reviews.Author: Brit_In_FL
Reviews.Content: Stayed many places in the area, on this trip was only over night and chose a mini suite here. It was excellent for our short stay. Clean and tidy, friendly staff, lovely grounds and pool area. Would go back again for a longer stay in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Disney World”
Reviews.Author: CDEW
Reviews.Content: Usually stay on property when we go to Disney World but stayed here last minute from Christmas till New Years Day. Very spacious rooms with nice layout. Close to Disney and other local attractions. Did not get a chance to use in house pool or other amenities but all looked well kept and new. Very clean and secure complex.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort with ultra convenient location in Central Fl”
Reviews.Author: Vegdash
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd stay here as an exchange. The resort is efficient (quick & courteous) with check in/out, clean, nice gym and pool. They have daily activities and a concierge desk to assist with area attractions. Maintenance responded quickly & efficiently to any of our concerns and the front desk (Sobiesky Toro) was EXTREMELY helpful in resolving our issues with a disabled guest in our party. W

Reviews.Title: “Honestly Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: delta12345
Reviews.Content: This place is really nice clean. There are a whole bunch of buildings through out the resort...its big! We had the A and B units. It was nice to have a kitchen, fridge and all the other things you need to have a meal at your hotel saved $$$. The pool area is nice as well as the other things to do in the resort (Which there are many).The only issue is that there's NO restaurant on site. There is a gift shop though that sells food and other things. There are many places to get food outside the resort like a Fridays, Bob Evans and a whole bunch of others. There are some things that do need to be fixed at this resort like the Internet connection...there is a whole page about this in your guest directory which i found confusing. Long story short the internet is not reliable it requires a log in code that can be optained at the front desk...but when you do get connected if it is even in range of your computer which some times its not depending on where you are...it will work sometimes SLOWLY or it will work quickly and kick you off every 20 mins which is annoying...also i noticed that the TVs would randomly cut out to static and then go back to the channel you were watching...this happened very often...one more thing is that when night time hits....you will have trouble sometimes finding a parking spot close to your unit...one night i had to park my car very far away which was crappy. Not to mention the loads of people who like to hang out in the parking lot all night and talk..... BUT if you can look past that you will really like this resort...just check your bill and make sure there isn't any hidden fees.

Reviews.Title: “not consistent”
Reviews.Author: traci t
Reviews.Content: We did this as a trade for our timeshare. We got one of the mini suites which has a separate one bedroom and kitchenette. What we found out after changing rooms twice is that the rooms are not consistent. The first one had only 1 double bed in the bedroom, but had a small oven and small (NY size) fridge and a W/D in the foyer of the unit. The second had 2 double beds and no w/d anywhere near the building. The third and final place had a w/d in the foyer, 2 double beds, but a weird kitchenette that had a microwave and d/w (really loud and unnecessary for a kitchenette set-up) with the mini fridge in the living room area with the silverware. The bathroom was tiny with only a small shelf over the sink to put your stuff on. After staying at Marriott timeshares the last two years, I was really unimpressed and would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Star Island was the worst experience!”
Reviews.Author: salesfish
Reviews.Content: We were supposed to stay for 3 nights we ran to a different hotel after 1. The place had ants in our room. It seamed like everyone was screaming and you can hear everything the walls and ceilings were so thin. I heard the people above us fighting. You share a hallway with a neighbor . They had the dryer on all night, and cooked ethnic food. It was so strong the smell came through the walls. Our eyes were tearing. The area just didnt seem safe, I was concerned about my car getting broken into.I called to the front desk to complain, we were on hold for 20 minutes. I spoke to the manager Mr Kelly, he knocked off $25.00? The place is a joke.I felt like i was stuck in the 80's. Never made it to the pool or the gym.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation Location”
Reviews.Author: Nicole A
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Wyndham Star Island in Building 19. The Condo was absolutely amazing!! I loved it. The Staff was very friendly and i will surely return.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value for Your Money!”
Reviews.Author: Pandie1212
Reviews.Content: This was the first time we stayed here. The room was great. There was a separate living room, bathroom, and bedroom. There is no way you feel cooped up like the normal hotel rooms! I enjoyed everything. The staff was excellent and very friendly. For the amount of money we spent on this condo, it was cheaper than a small hotel room with no privacy. I highly recommend this place and will continue to return here.

Reviews.Title: “Great family vacation resort”
Reviews.Author: Brooks W
Reviews.Content: It was the perfect place for our budget-conscious family. Great location - Wal-Mart nearby along with many affordable fast food and Cici's pizza. The room layout worked great with the parents sleeping in the pull-out bed in the living room (privacy door included) and kids in their own room. We stayed there eight nights and had all we need in the kitchen for many in-house breakfasts and suppers. The only issue was sound. You could hear the neighbor room residents through the adjoining-door easily. There were a number of programs planned for the kids but we had our own itinerary. Adequate playground for our 5,7 and 8 year olds. Great pool access and kids can actually use the outdoor whirlpool (we went in the slow time of December). The have indoor adult-only if you need. Easy access to Disney. Exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: kim k
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Star Island several times during the past several years. And we have always had an amazing star. Great prices, great service and comfortable large suites! The hot tub in the master bedroom is great and so are the activities for the kids that run all day long. Plus only $100 deposit required at check in and no pre-payment required for your stay when you book online through star-island.com

Reviews.Title: “Family Vacation - The great and the not so great!”
Reviews.Author: car_and_scott
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week long vacation over Thanksgiving. There were 11 people in our group (ranging from ages 23-60) and we had 4 units. My parents have owned at Star Island (a 3-bedroom and a 1-bedroom) since 1999 and we exchanged the other units through Interval. Some things about this resort are OUTSTANDING and I want to highlight those first: -The activities by the pool are awesome for families and there is happy hour every single day. At the upstairs bar, there is Bingo each day at 4pm - our group walked away with quite a bit of cash! There was live music and karaoke each night and the bartenders (especially George) were fantastic. -The pool is beautiful and was never too crowded that you couldn't get a chair. -There is a cool outdoor gym facility with a small "track" and a bunch of exercise equipment. This was new since the last time we were there. -Wifi was free and worked everywhere, but it does kick you off and you need a different password for each device. -Every unit we had was extremely clean and updated with granite, flat panel TVs and new furniture. -There is a store on the property that has tons of items if you need anything in a pinch. This resort is in a great location - Publix at the next corner and minutes from the parks. Now, for the disappointing aspects of our trip. -The unit we stayed in was advertised on the Interval site as a 2-bedroom that slept 6. Upon entering, we walked into a dark, small space with a teeny-tiny kitchen area. This would be something I would think is a "limited kitchen" and nothing like what we have had anywhere else. (We are timeshare people - rarely ever staying in anything but since we enjoy the larger spaces and kitchens.) There were 2 bedrooms and 2 baths, but no king sized bed in either and hardly any closet space. There were 3 of us in this unit and it was the most depressing and dark place - no balcony, windows looking out to another wall. My dad spent over an hour on the phone with Interval trying to change rooms but no such luck. The problem is that we were on the "Star Island" side of the resort and not the part owned by Wyndham. The front desk was not helpful at all for this reason. The issue is that Star Island needs to communicate with Interval their floor plans so people know what to expect. There wasn't even enough seating in the living area for 6 people - we hardly had enough room with 3 of us. Thank goodness the place was updated otherwise it would have been really awful. We spent very little time in our room - it was building 24 and we got units A and C - the B area is the larger unit with the big kitchen and king sized bed and jacuzzi tub along with a balcony. The entrance and laundry are shared so we had neighbors right there. So my word of advice is if you exchange, make sure you are not getting this type of unit!!! Beware!!! -One of our units on the second floor had many palmetto bugs that were giant - not a friendly surprise when they are in your shower or shoe! No good! -WARNING: Do not do the sales pitch!!!!! My parents were told that it would take 45 minutes and you would get a $125 amex card. Nice, right? WRONG! They were there for - you won't believe it - 4 HOURS! 4! We also were going to do the pitch that would take 90 minutes for non-owners - we cancelled since who knows how long we would be there! -Like another reviewer said, the kitchens have bare essentials. We managed to cook a full Thanksgiving dinner but combined items from all our units. There are other things that are just basic - our unit had not a single hook to hang wet clothes on, and only a shelf in the bathroom to put toiletries. Overall, we had the best trip. The biggest problem was that 2-bedroom unit that was misrepresented through Interval. We will return, but will be sure to double check what we are getting first!

Reviews.Title: “Ten Reasons Not to Stay at Star Island Resort”
Reviews.Author: meltsine
Reviews.Content: 1. Poor service - the staff doesn't seem to care about their guests, they don't give you any information about the activities at the reports or in the area, they lied to us and ruined pout vacation. 2. Everything closes at 11pm - the pool, the bar, there's NO entertainment! 3. Screwed up reservations - we spent half our vacation either moving from room to room or talking to the front desk trying to fix our reservation. They locked us out of half our suite the last night saying it was already scheduled for new arrivals so we couldn't pay for it for one more night, but no one ever showed up. The lack of organization and all the confusion completely ruined our vacation! 4. Terrible tv reception - fuzzy on most channels and the tvs had a high pitch buzz the whole time. 5. Wi-Fi - terribly slow and kept kicking us off. 6. Don't accommodate the guests - no extra towels, blankets, or pillows for the entire stay. 7. Bed bugs? - almost all of us woke up with itchy bumps on our legs each morning. The ones on the couch, however, were fine. 8. Pool area - the pool closes at 11pm even though there is never a lifeguard. The spa was out of order the entire week and there is nothing hot about the hot tub! Lukewarm water and there was only one got tub ib the whole resort. 9. The rooms - not only was the decor tacky, but the rooms were unclean. Cobwebs and stains seem to be everywhere. 10. Parking lot - the set up was crappy and you had to spend 15 minutes driving around just to find a place to park. My stay at Star Island Resort was far from my expectations. Their poor organization and staff ruined mine and my family's vacation. Who really wants to move rooms every night, especially when it was the fault of the staff? Not worth our money and never coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Our first visit to this resort. Will return!”
Reviews.Author: Jess S
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 days here, 7 of which were in the larger B unit. While the A units are small, it was sufficient for 1 night although we probably would not like a full week in one. When we moved from the B to the A unit, a member of the housekeeping staff came to help us make the move, although we had not requested help. We found the B unit very sufficient of our needs; plenty of room, clean, with everything we needed to live like at home for a week. Lots of activities for the entire family throughout the week also. I'm sure we will visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Star Island - not a star”
Reviews.Author: sunshine441
Reviews.Content: We are staying at Star Island now. Having read all the excellent and terrible reviews we certainly were aware of its mixed reviews. Some of the negative issues are not apparent ie there are plenty of paper towels, there is no odd smell and the front desk staff were all very pleasant, A/C works fine. However, we decided to take both the A and B side (although we are just 1 couple) and that helps a lot. The walls are paper thin but we are protected from that having both sides of the unit. The A side is very cramped and dark. Don't take the limited kitchen unless you absolutely have to. In asking for the full kitchen you get the B side which is larger and brighter. The facility is very dated and needs major upgrading. There are so many buildings we can't imagine what the pool area would be like in summer season. Now it is just OK and the resort is at the best half full. The pool towels are a joke - like a dishcloth in thickness and small. We take 6 for the 2 of us and that helps somewhat. My wife says the kitchen is poorly equipped - bare essentials - not even a rubber spatula. BBQs are charcoal only. Who travels with charcoal anymore? The property looks very nice on entry but is just average in our opinion - at best a C+. We haven't noticed any bugs and the unit was very clean on entry. The WIFI is a pain - it kicks out very quickly - just not appropriate for today's world. The air conditioners are right outside the bedroom window making sleeping difficult. Would we ever come back - probably not. What really set us off was the language of some of the clientele around the public areas - swearing - vulgar -from many adults. We are not some fuddy-duddy couple - it was just very inappropriate and low class. As well, the tap water is terrible - even a bad odour to it - not drinkable at all so we have gone through a couple of cases of water.

Reviews.Title: “Always a wonderful time at Star Island”
Reviews.Author: SoulVegTallahassee
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at star island for at least 7 years and it is my number one choice for resorts...prices are very reasonable and staff is friendly...and of course the rooms and proprty are wonderful...definitely recommend star island for vacation A.D. Martin

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Resort”
Reviews.Author: Marie P
Reviews.Content: My family just spent a week in a 3 bedroom condo at Star Island. It was a timeshare exchange for us. What a beautiful property! The condo unit was very spacious and there was a washer and dryer in the unit. That was a bonus since we had our 6 month old granddaughter with us. Our unit was well decorated and very well maintained. The property is beautiful. There are BBQs on the grounds but you need to take your own charcoal. Their customer service is excellent and they are were very responsive to our requests.If you are looking for a lovely resort with lots to do for all ages, I highly recommend Star Island.

Reviews.Title: “Home From Home”
Reviews.Author: Jane_k214
Reviews.Content: Love this Place!! We come over every year from London and its just like a home from home. Getting excited just thinking about this place. For us its perfect in everyway. The apartments have everything you need and more. They are always clean and theres nothing you can fault. The staff are friendly and always willing to help. The location is perfect and the complex is safe. Myself and my family can not rate this place enough. We heading over again in the next few weeks and none of us can wait. I would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice surprise!”
Reviews.Author: peppermintblood
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Star Island Resort in Kissimmee for two nights as a part of our yearly vacation while we visited Disney World. This was a very pleasant surprise for us because we booked this a few months before after doing research just to ensure it was a safe hotel and a good location with high reviews but didn't really know anything about the resort or our rooms. When we arrived we were excited just by pulling in the entrance to the resort, it's beautiful and secluded, almost like it's out in the country instead of in the middle of a busy town. The resort is gated and guarded by security guards, of whom we saw all over the resort the entire duration of our stay, which is always very reassuring to see. The lobby was very nice and the staff helpful, and the area around the lobby is very beautiful with a big fountain out front. We were assigned to a room in the fourth building down from the office, and when we got in the room we were absolutely floored by the room! It's actually a one bedroom condo with a kitchenette, a large dining room table, a sectional couch with console and large flat screen TV in the living room, and a large master-suite with a huge jetted tub a few feet down from the king sized bed and a TV console/dresser with another large flat screen TV. There is also another separate bath area with a vanity, toilet, and large shower built in the wall. The tub was fabulous, we used it both nights we were here :) There was also a patio off the bedroom and the living room, but we never used it. The bed was very comfortable, I think they may use euro-top mattresses which are always very nice if not too soft. The pool complex is large and the pools heated. I didn't see a hot tub, so not sure if they have one or not but we only used the pools once in the morning for a few minutes before we left. They also have a pool side bar and a large tennis complex too, although we didn't use either while we were here. The complex was very quiet and had a private feel to it, something that is often missing in resort destinations, even the Disney hotels. I really can't think of one complaint that I had for either day of our stay here. We absolutely loved every aspect of our stay at Star Island Resort and will be coming back again very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: cwberg
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here with a few friends. The property could best be described as "tired". Our condo was on the first floor, and impossible to use the patio because the ducks are quite aggressive I would recommend staying above the first floor. The condo was nice and had everything you need, however the second bathtub was so tall you could hardly get in it. We had the three bedroom unit where you could lock off the second bedroom and den. We never had to use the den, but it had a small, outdated kitchen in it as opposed to regular kitchen which was fine. There is no restaurant on the property, but they bring in a local restaurant every night with a meal priced very reasonably, but if you don't eat that sort of thing you're out of luck. They say TGI Fridays delivers, but not if you get in at 10 pm, apparently. When we went to ask questions at the front desk, all three of the girls at the Wyndham desk were eating Burger King meals which was really unprofessional and unwelcoming. Not exactly a class act.

Reviews.Title: “more knowledge...”
Reviews.Author: horsecrazyjlc
Reviews.Content: Everyone was very nice and polite but when asked if they had a DVD player in the room they said no we have VHS...when we got to the room....no VHS, but a DVD player....when we asked if they has movies we could order they said yes...info is in the room...false...they have to movies to order...we wanted to go to the gift shop which they said is open to 10PM, nope they close at 9 PM. even though it was a little frustrating being given the wrong answers to the questions i asked the front desk/guest services...it had beautiful grounds, very nice pool, clean rooms, and overall i would stay there again :)

Reviews.Title: “Williams Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Denise765
Reviews.Content: This place was amazing. This was my family first vacation in sum time and my 3 year old very first trip to Disney and we stayed here.. from beginnning to end this hotel was perfect. From the hotel guest services to the parking and special events going on truly was the best. Playgrounds for the children, large pools, and live band it was just great, and the room omg!! I loved it one thing we women do care most about is our room from the pillows to the mattress and sheets and tub style , oh we care about these things and they had everything just right! My husband and I said we would recommend this place to our friends and family. When we want a short mini vacation this place will be the very first place we look! Relaxing and Beautiful please please check this place out for you family, it's not one bad thing I can say about!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for all”
Reviews.Author: Ocdgwg
Reviews.Content: I just love this place, been coming down every year since 95 and will be there again this year. It's a must stay at for families and couples. The service is great as well as the staff who got out the way to make you feel like a celebrity. Your out of the way on what seems like a secluded island. If family fun time is what you want or just quite time with someone special you can have it.

Reviews.Title: “I'm A BELIEVER!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingJaneKoch
Reviews.Content: My husband had a business trip and I tagged along the original hotel we planned to stay in was booked so we came here as a last resort. Honestly it was wonderful from beginning to end we stayed for a week and we brought along four of our grandchildren (14, 12, 9, and 5). Shockingly they ALL had fun and didn't want to leave. Every day/night the resort had different activities. My favorite was the Mexican night(it was free!). My granddaughter won the hula hoop contest and we all found something to do. This is definitely a family friendly environment as well as a great honeymoon spot. It's like paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: GAGIRL83
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed and mini suite. Room looked just like the pictures. Room was very clean and did not smell at all. Only wished the bed was queen instead of double. Staff was friendly. We drove around the Resort just to see it all because It rained the whole weekend. Did not get a change to get to pool or bar. Locaton of Star Island is not that good, but you can get to Disney or International drive in no time.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable family vacation”
Reviews.Author: NateS-DC
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one week in late July to brave the crowds at Disney World. We have traveled to Orlando/Kissimmee over 10 times and have stayed in over 7 different timeshare condominiums, and our 3-bedroom at Star Island was a very good experience. Not the best we've had, but very good. The unit: we had the 3-bedroom, which had a unique set-up. The side with the master bedroom had two full bathrooms, but only one bedroom (the master). I guess if anyone was staying on the sofa in the living room the other bathroom would be for them. On the other side of the lock-off had one bedroom with two double beds, a full bathroom, and a den-type area with a small kitchen (fridge, dishwasher, stovetop, utensils) and a pull-out sofa. So this side was essentially a one-bedroom with a closed-off den. Since we have 3 kids, I'm not sure if I would book here with only the 2-bedroom, for there's no real master bedroom on the 2-bedroom side we had. However, everything in the units was very clean. In fact, they had just shampooed the carpets before our arrival. The thermostat was very temperamental, and was difficult to peg at a single temperature. Also, we were in the "old" building, and did not have a washer/dryer in the unit. With 3 kids, this was an inconvenience. There was free use of washers/dryers on the 1st level, but this kind of stuck you in the laundromat world where you had to "hang around" to wait for your clothes to be washed. Not appealing when you're on vacation. The resort: We really enjoyed the pool area. And while the resort was full, the pools were never overcrowded. There was a lot of activity, organized events, and music throughout the day, and the Chili Hillie's bar had some nice deals throughout the day. It was a good way to endure the mid-summer heat. Everything in the common areas was impeccably kept, and very convenient to most units. We didn't have a chance to take advantage of the free bucket of golf range balls at 8:30am every morning, but this is a nice treat for those just looking for a quick activity. The location: We were a bit further west on Highway 192 than we traditionally prefer to stay, but since the resort is tucked back from the highway, it feels a world apart from the congestion of that road. Obviously, if you're out in this area, you need a rental car. Then, you need a good local map that shows you how to get to Osceola Parkway. I believe a GPS system would likely guide you to Disney World via highway 192. Depending on the time of day, this would be a huge mistake. Just make sure you've got a couple dollars of change and small bills for the tolls, and you can be on Disney property in less than 10 minutes. Far better than dropping 30+ minutes in traffic. I live in D.C., so I'll pay $2 to save a lot of time in traffic; you may feel different. Once you know the roads, it's easy to get around. Just as a note, when you exit the resort you can only go East on highway 192. To go toward Disney you have to make a u-turn. Also, just about 1/4 to 1/2 mile East on 192 is a Super Target, where you can pretty much stock up on food and supplies for your vacation. All in all, we enjoyed Star Island, and would visit again if we could book another 3-bedroom unit. It's a good place, in a good location (if you know where you're going), and it has a lot of amenities for the size.

Reviews.Title: “Not clean- you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: dinake
Reviews.Content: I'm staying here now. We got a special pre paid rate. We walked into our suite and it smelled musty. There was a large stain on the sofa. The special didn't mention they only have full size beds. No queen or kings. We went to the front desk and asked to move rooms. They agreed. The next room smelled worse of mildew. There was hair in the bathtub. I would never stay here again. We much prefer the Sheraton down the road.

Reviews.Title: “Star Island Resort”
Reviews.Author: wendy p
Reviews.Content: We went to Star Island Resort and club over the weekend and was in the 1 bed room villa. The place was wonderful!!! The room was just like the pics on the website and very clean. The grounds were GREAT and the bar by the pool area had great drinks and staff was very nice and helpful. So much to do at the resort you dont even need to leave. We will be back for a longer stay and will bring the kids and friends when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: JulieMCCoy
Reviews.Content: Nice condo community but if you don't have a car, you will spend an average of $25 each way to wherever you go - by taxi. No restaurant on site and very limited choices in the 'gift shop/convenience store'. Many other choices to stay that would be nicer, more convenient to parks with food on property. TGIFridays delivers to the resort. Overall, it was nice but not great.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Getaway Okay”
Reviews.Author: Baysinger
Reviews.Content: We were going to Disney for the weekend; found this resort for a "deal." The drive to the parks is still a good drive. The room was small, but it suprisingly had a mid-sized fridge w/ freezer and a small stove top and dishwasher. The bed was fine. The property was large. We enjoyed the pool but is was crowded during the day. The nightly entertainment was laughable. My expectiations were not blown away, but I wasn't disappointed either. It was just okay... vanilla. There are other resorts, this one doesn't really stand out. My wife and I aren't golfers but evidently people who enjoy that sort of thing might like this resort more than we did.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Tito76
Reviews.Content: My family of four stayed at this property as part of an RCI points program. We stayed a a 1 bedroom villa which had a king size bed and pull out couch. There was a jacuzzi tub in our bedroom. Overall, we had an outstanding time. The facilities have 2 large pools, tennis courts, basketball courts, lake (although it was full of weeds and we couldn't fish in the month of August), golf range, among many others. The resort offered free bucket of balls in the morning. We probably hit balls 2 times out of the week as it was too warm to even attempt to do this in the morning in August. The driving range does not have a roof, so you are exposed directly to the sun. The villa has a DJ by the pool during the day. The drinks and food are a bit expensive for our taste but we were close enough to many supermarkets and bought food and drinks in advance. I even saw people using the nearby grills and having a picnic close enough to the pool area. The villas are located very close to Old Town on I-192, about 5-6 minutes from Disney and Sea World. It is very conveniently located in the center of everything. The facilities are very well kept and the villa was very clean. My only complaint was that we had to share the washer and dryer with the adjacent villa. There are some activities for kids during the day and in the evening. They offered many of the activities mentioned on their website but most of them you have to pay. In addition, we hardly ever participated in any of the nightly activities because we came in late from the parks. The pool closed at around 10 PM. Overall, we loved our stay at Star Island and look forward to coming back. My last suggestion to anyone who visits is STAY AWAY FROM THE TIMESHARE PEOPLE. Unless you want to spend 1/2 of your day there, do not do it. We made the mistake of taking the offer and spent from 9AM to almost 12:30 in the process (between seeing the time share, presentation and collecting what they offered).

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon suite was a letdown :(”
Reviews.Author: Samkriegs
Reviews.Content: Purchased the honeymoon package, which included champagne, strawberries and an in room massage- well our room overlooked check in so there was no privacy even on balcany at night. The in room massage was not- we had to go to spa in the middle of the day bx they were overbooked. And to top it off, our room had pubic hair in the bathroom corner when we checked in. They said they would send housekeeping, which they did... Not only did they not clean the pubic hair only fresh linens, they stole our giftcard off our dresser. Alk in all, nit happy. And a romantic getaway. No good!

Reviews.Title: “Great family-friendly resort”
Reviews.Author: Stephiraye629
Reviews.Content: PROS: My family of four and another family of four stayed in the 3 bedroom villa with PLENTY of room to spare! The resort is very family-friendly with plenty of fun stuff for the little ones and big ones alike! My children definitely enjoyed the splash pad area most, but we also took advantage of the two pools (one of the pools is 0 ft entry, so you can sit at the edge and splash - this worked great for my 7 month old), ping-pong tables, BOUNCE HOUSE (my 4 yr old daughter loved this, it also has a slide!), they even have arts and crafts hour from 11am - 12pm each day. One day my daughter decorated a backpack and the next day she painted a (pre-assembled) birdhouse. Great keepsakes for her to remember her trip! The bar above the pool is fun, karaoke some nights and dj dancing other nights, reasonably priced drinks... Oh! Go to their website and print out the events brochure. It has coupons for two-for-one drinks! We printed multiple copies and they never said we couldn't use any more!! Overall, a great time! CONS: The pools are soooo cold!!! Even for the hot Floridian temperatures! But there's a hot tub if you get too cold. Also, the bar closes at 11pm each night. Just something to keep in mind if you're the fashionably late kind of people. You won't have much time to play if you wait until 10 to get to the bar! Jet ski rental is outrageous, so we did not partake. I think it was a hundred bucks per hour - no thanks! That's about it tho, none of these cons negatively affected our trip at all!

Reviews.Title: “We had a good time but, watch out with your credit card charges”
Reviews.Author: Peggy9399
Reviews.Content: We had a good time at the resort, The #3 bedroom were very spacious and clean. The only down side to this resort was they charged my credit card twice for the stayed! Now I have to wait five to seven days to see the money back in my account. Would not go back just for this reason.... I don't need anybody playing with my money like that!

Reviews.Title: “Nightclub or resort???”
Reviews.Author: Ceteinch
Reviews.Content: After trading in our home resort for years, we recently stayed there for the first time this year. We were pleasantly surprised with the accommodations after all the bad reviews on this site. Room was very clean, nice new flat screens and furniture, and the grounds were nice. What I wasn't pleased with was the outdoor nightclub they provide for guest 'entertainment'. Our unit is across the lake an we could here the music clear as day over our TV. It goes on until midnight or later. Stay clear if you are thinking of bringing a family or just like to sleep. If your looking for spring break with a bunch of 40+ year olds in September- this is your place!

Reviews.Title: “Tired facility, trying hard to keep up. Not bad but not good enough.”
Reviews.Author: SteveMorley
Reviews.Content: The rooms we had were ok. But there is no cleaning service during a week long stay. Towels are exchanged once on request. People are friendly and helpful, but the property is old and needs updating. Has a low rent feel. Pool suffers from dirt from the trees, which is never cleaned out. There are much better places to stay in this area. Bar area is depressing. No resturant. Lots of moskito's bitting in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “why bad reviews great place”
Reviews.Author: jill b
Reviews.Content: I read all the bad reviews and got worried about staying here. Myself and 18 members of our family stayed for two weeks for a once in a lifetime holiday in florida. The apartment was clean, extremly spacious, well presented and exceeded our expectations. Loved the jacquzzi bath(swimming pool) in our master room, washer dryer dishwasher were a bonus. All the staff were lovely, especially ashley ra in the spa, get her to give you a pedicure its amazing. If your booked here you will have q great time, wish we were still there.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME OR MONEY ON STAR ISLAND”
Reviews.Author: TStrickland
Reviews.Content: My family has a timeshare with Wyndham but it is at Bonnet Creek Resort and we always stay there, but this time we had to work around the kids school schedule, so we went with Star Island Resort. Bad mistake...Even though the rooms were very spacious...we had Roaches bad, and I don't mean small like beetles, I mean Huge like June Bugs. We did call the office and went down to the office and noone seemed to be the least concerned, I guess because they weren't the ones staying there. I did not unpack my luggage as I was scared one of those bugs would want to come home with me. Nobody ever did anything about the bug situation. Also the elevators were so slow, I guess it was because of the SNAKE that was lying there when my Grandchildren opened up the door. Also again nobody bothered to attempt to correct that situation either, after being told several times by many people. I was afraid to get in the elevators, you had to jump up and down to make it work. The shower and larger tub was nice, except you need steps to get in and out of it. This could be very dangerous. The pool area was a long way from our room, and very over crowded and not very clean at all. We did not go there often, They need more pools or quit overbooking. The kids were very disappointed in that area as they are water freaks.. The bar and karoke area really needs to be updated, with also someone that is a bit more friendly than the one that did it. You guys need to go over to Bonnet Creek and see how they do things. This place is outdated and really nothing to do there. I was very disappointed in the whole adventure of Star Island. I say don't waste your money or time, when there are other places close to Disney that can make your Disney experience one to remember.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Jewel”
Reviews.Author: mastertraveler73
Reviews.Content: We were a little hesitant after reading some of the reviews on site, but I am pleased to say that those fears quickly disappated as soon as we saw our room. There was of course the obligatory "Would you like to take a 90-minute tour of one of our properties?" at check-in but a simple "no" and you were on your way. Our room was on the fourth floor of building 22. The room was immaculate and the furnishings were modern. The only thing that seemed out of sorts were the grecian columns which flanked the jacuzzi tub in the master bedroom. We had a nice porch complete with its own ceiling fan which is very necessary in the state of Florida. The grounds of the resort were well-maintained for a property that is nearly 20 years old. Only two minor disappointments. The advertised fishing as my husband put it "sucked" as the lake was filled with grasses. And the advertised "Live Entertainment" at the main bar during the evening was a bit of a letdown. (You can only hear the Macarena and the Cha-Cha song so many times and we heard them three times in two hours). I know the point was to get people out and dance but we cut our evening short and headed back to our room for cocktails. All in all, minor issues. If you are looking for a clean, spacious, well maintained stay, close to everything touristy in Orlando (four miles from Disney) Star Island is the place to be!

Reviews.Title: “We will for sure return”
Reviews.Author: MekaBlue
Reviews.Content: I had a three bedroom villa. It was so spacious and clean. The kids loved it because they always had something going on at the resort, because of this we did not spend as much money as we thought. We went outside the resort 3 days out of the 6 days we stayed. The only complaint that I have is that there is no on-site restuarant and to be a resort there should be one. TGI Fridays, Cici's Pizza, Taco Bell, Arbys is all in walking distance of the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Would have been very disappointed if it hadn't been free.”
Reviews.Author: OurKidsRule
Reviews.Content: We (parents + 2 children) stayed at the STAR Island Resort as a guest of a family member that owns a Wyndham timeshare. They let us check in early (nice) and it was reasonably close to Disney (10-15 minutes). The lobby of the hotel was nice. I suppose part of my disappointment comes from not being accustomed to staying in a timeshare. We were given 4 towels for the 4 of us to use for 5 days. If we wanted more towels we had to call and request them for a fee. There was no maid service, trash removal, etc. Our shower floor was filthy after a few days of walking all over Disney property and stayed that way. We had a kitchenette which was nice. We ate breakfast in our room daily before heading off to Disney which saved us money. The hotel is very old and outdated. Decor in the room was poor and the room was very dark (not much lamp light and if we opened the blinds everyone could look in at us as they walked by). Old fashioned TVs - no flat screens. Beds were small and uncomfortable. Air in the bedroom was good (cool) but the front room would get warm. The walls were extremely thin as evident by the obnoxiously loud family that yelled and made noises at 11pm. The water pressure was poor and the toilet didn't flush well - luckily they leave you a plunger in the bathroom (yuck!). The shower itself was difficult to get in and out of (jacuzzi style - very deep) for a 42 year old in fairly good health. I'm not sure how anyone with physical limitations would get clean. The pool was so far from our room in the back of the complex that we never went so I can't speak to it. They want you to attend a timeshare presentation but I didn't go. I can't imagine why they think anyone would want to buy a Wyndham timeshare after staying at this location. However - it was free to me and I appreciate the gift my family gave me. I would not stay there again - I would rather pay for a hotel on Disney property and feel like I got my money's worth.

Reviews.Title: “Plusses and Minuses with Star Island”
Reviews.Author: PA_Traveler_7
Reviews.Content: My family of six stayed here for a week in mid-July. Overall, we had a good time. We definitely did not experience some of the negatives others have reported. Our suite was very large, in good shape, and very clean...nice view on balcony overlooking tennis courts. We enjoyed the pool and some of the activities. The resort is quite handy to Disney World, outlet and food shopping, Wal Mart Supercenter, and pretty much every restaurant you could want. The personnel were friendly and tried to help us with any questions or issues we had. The comments I have that are a bit on the minus side are the fact that this resort looks like its heyday was about 20-25 years ago...some portions look a bit tired or dated...not necessarily in bad repair, just a bit worn out. The also need to update their picture wall in the lobby with some of the famous folks that have either stayed or owned there..it is mostly sports personalities from the 70s and 80s that young folks would barely know today. I believe they are trying hard to update the facility, it just isn't there yet. Overall, though, if I was going back to Orlando in the next few years, I would give them another try.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: sd102392
Reviews.Content: My family and friends stayed at this "Resort". Needless to say we will not be back. The first night was ok. We had both suite A and B was very roomy....too roomy we had more guests than expected. Roaches. I was sitting in the bed with my wife, when out of the corner of my eye.. there it was crawling by our heads across the bed. We had a 12 month old sleeping in her pack and play close to the floor. I wanted out right away, however I decided to wait til morning. Well that changed when I heard a scream from the other Suite. I ran in and saw a roach you could've strapped a saddle to. I called the manager who did not seem concerned at all. A new room( Not Updated) was provided, and unfortunately had to switch at 1:30 in the morning. It took 3 HRS to switch with no help being offered by the resort at all. That morning they had me Sched for a time share tour which I canceled and relayed do not bother me the rest of my trip. I spoke with manager in the A.M. and they gave me 2 25 dollar vouchers to use at heir facility. Whoopdee doo that is 4 drinks. I also noticed that my child was crawling on the floor and her Legs and tops of her feet looked like they were rubbed with charcoal, that is how black they were. I guess they haven't cleaned the carpet in the 30yrs they've been there. Will never stay again. Only positive I had was the location.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Cindy0763
Reviews.Content: This is a large facility. I did an exchange through my timeshare for a one bedroom condo with a pull-out sofa bed, kitchen, two bathrooms and a patio. All was in order and very nice and clean. Spa on site as well as patio bar with activities going throughout the day if you wish to participate. Concierge set us up with a car rental at a great price for the week. We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Bengalgrl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in the Wyndham side of the resort and absolutely loved the place. We had a two bedroom which was huge for the 4 of us staying there. We were having a girls week in Orlando. The bar closes early but you can easily walk down the drive to the TGI Fridays on the corner if you wish to stay up later. Surprisingly you can just about fit 4 girls in the tub in the main room. I had my wallet stolen at one of the theme parks and the staff were very helpful when having money and passport shipped to me there. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “NASTY NASTY PLACE...RUNNNNN..STAY ONLY ONE NIGHT..I COULD NOT STAY ANOTHER NIGHT.”
Reviews.Author: carolivar
Reviews.Content: Yesterday I came back from Orlando..My fiance and I were supposed stay for two nights, but we could not stay another night..The room's small was really bad. From the time we opened the room door the odor was terrible..It was late we we arrived to the hotel, so we could not do anything about it...I believe that the smell was mildew or mold..The AC vents were dirty..The bathroom shower was nasty nasty...I almost could not take a shower...Mildew was growing in the bathrooms..The beds were nasty..One of the sheets were dirty...The kitchen countertop had a big stain..The walls were so thin that you could hear everthing from the other room..People had loud latin music...The location of the hotel is baddddd...I could not do that...I lost my money...but I happy that I decided to return home...PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY LIKE THAT...IF YOU REALLY WANT TO ENJOY YOUR VACATIONS DO NOT STAY ON THAT HOTEL... ANOTHER COMENT..THE ROOMS ARE NASTY...THE COLORS OF THE ROOMS ARE UGLY..

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: jdktravel
