Reviews.Content: I was very happy with my stay at Star island. Most important for me is that the room was very clean. I have 3 kids and the 1 bedroom was great and very big. I would recommend getting 1st floor if you have alot of bags because there are no elevators in the building I stayed in. The pool was great and the karaoke at night was very entertaining. Overall, I loved my stay and will return again. Overall, I loved it and will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs!”
Reviews.Author: tampa114
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights in late June, 2011. There are two owners in this facility ... Wyndham and Star Island Resort and Club. Very odd. I had friends with Wyndham points who were staying for a week. I don't have Wyndham points so I stayed in the Star Island Resort and Club portion of this facility. I did visit two Wyndham units, and while they were not up to what I would expect from Wyndham properties, they were more than adequate. My lock out suite was with Star Island Resort and Club. I had read previous reviews about the paper thin walls. Let me say the walls are definitely PAPER THIN. In the room next to me were several small kids who ripped and romped until 2:30 every morning ... plus what must have been a small baby. It was absolutely a miserable sleeping situation. There is very, very little handicapped parking ... a few in front of one of the Wyndham buildings ... none to be found in front of my building. The kitchen is very sparsely furnished. This was the only 'suite' I've ever stayed in that did not provide paper towels. I found this odd since the room rate would suggest basic furnishings included. And the little refrigerator ... my milk froze the first night, and no matter how much I backed off the cold setting, it never thawed. Same with canned cokes ... one of which burst and spewed all over the place, which is when I realized just how much I missed having paper towels in the room! If this place charged $70 a night or so I would say you get what you pay for. But their charge is almost twice that for the basic accommodation. It is definitely not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I Expected”
Reviews.Author: surfsidedawn
Reviews.Content: Was worried when I read reviews, but got there and checked in and went up to our 1 bedroom, full kitchen. It was huge for a one bedroom and very clean. Plenty to do there. The kids went swimming and played tennis and Took a canoe out on the lake. At night there was live music or karoke which we found fun. The only downside was after you checked in and had to talk to someone else to get your parking pass so they could try to get you to do Timeshare. Very rude when you say you are not interested. Other than that everyone was friendly and helpful. I would definately stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: dealer73
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a three bedroom villa. Lots of room. Plenty to do on resort. Very clean. Staff helpful. Poolside entertainent good., but paddle boats need refurbishing. Parking poor at night. Must pay for room service. Has everything needed to self survive with a family, ie. dishes, washer/dryer. Great master bedroom. Would/ will stay again..

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Pools and plenty to do on/off property for families and couples!”
Reviews.Author: MOJO2FLOW
Reviews.Content: I have been to Star Island several times, first with family, second with my friends, and third for my Four Year anniversary. I went during the quiet or value months and it was simply wonderful, very enjoyable atmosphere for me, as I spend most of my time poolside or in the Jacuuzi during the cooler months. There is plenty to do on site without needing to go anywhere. All of Orlandos major attractions are within 5-10 minutes, and roads are not difficult to travel. There is a discount ticket shop down the road heading east. All of your dinner shows are located east on the same road as well. Plenty of eateries. Lets see... If you want to enjoy yourselves as a couple dont go during summer, this is the high season for family time at the pool and is not enjoyable. However if you are going to spend time with family then by all means go right ahead, summer is best for children and parents. I especially liked going during janurary and relaxing in the hot tubs, there is one indoor and one outdoor. Getting onto the rooms, THEY ARE SPECTACULAR! I always stayed in a one bedroom with full kitchenette and balcony. it comes equipped with a huge sofa that is also a sleeper bed. PLENTY of room for my family of 4-5, being two adults and three teenagers! There is Wifi. LAUNDRY inside the unit was brilliant! They werer stackables, and took awhile to dry, but nonetheless we werent time pressed! I am a wydham vacation owner and this is one of my favorite places to stay! Helpful tip: no housekeeping! ASK for extra dish soap and laundry soap at checkin desk if you plan on using thise amenities. ALSO ask for extra shampoo, soap, cond. if you plan on using there Bath & body works brand toilatrees.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort!!!!”
Reviews.Author: pyro2702
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in the 3 bedroom villa for 8 days. The resort and room was very nice and I would go back again. It's cheaper to get the room online rather than calling. My only complaint was the staff at the front desk were not very bright.

Reviews.Title: “The water smells like sewage. Find somewhere else to stay.”
Reviews.Author: dand78
Reviews.Content: To get your parking pass you are asked to go to a time share breakfast which I hate being bothered with. The rooms are big and spacious, but the horrid smell of the water overpowers everything else. It is also a very loud place. At night everyone partied on their balconies and my wife did not sleep at all. This is not a place for families with young children. Our elevator broke and we waited 20 minutes to take our luggage to the 4th floor. The resort did nothing when I told them about this. There are also fees for everything. Internet is $9.95 a day. Resort fees per day. Plus cleaning fees every day.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!! Amazing stay! Amazing Price”
Reviews.Author: ccptas
Reviews.Content: This was an amazing resort! It is perfect for families, couple, couple, and solo get aways. The best deals are on the website but walk ins produce great prices too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay when visiting Disney”
Reviews.Author: mayan2012
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed there in May of 2010. We had a 3 bedroom villa with all amenities. The resort was clean and the staff was excellent. Always smiles greeted you. The rooms were furnished in new modern décor and were very well kept. We stayed on the 3rd floor and our room faced a wooded area. It is very close to Disney, shopping and restaurants. The grounds were basic however did have areas that made a nice stroll. We did not eat on the resort so I can not comment on the food. This was a time share exchange and we were very pleased. We booked an extra night and the staff was very helpful in letting us keep the same room.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden treasure in Kissimmee”
Reviews.Author: diva1959
Reviews.Content: My husband And I recently visited Kissimmee and we stayed at the Star Island Resort Club and it was simply wonderful!! We traded into this resort for a week from our home timeshare and was quite pleased. The property is tucked away off the beaten path which made it very private. Each high rise unit was well appointed and equipped with all of the comforts from home. We had the B side which was a king-one bedroom which was more than enough for two people (there was a queen sofa sleeper). The spa, gym, suana & whirlpool areas were always cleaned and not over crowded, however the lockers were not properly functional. Otherwise, loved it and will highly recommend it!!

Reviews.Title: “Rudest Staff i have ever met”
Reviews.Author: cawnee
Reviews.Content: I own a timeshare with wydham and went to their annual conference and decided to stay at this resort since i had visited it before. Upon my arrival i was greeted by the most hateful person imaginable, she treated me like dirt. after resolving a deposit issue in which i come to find out that they have my checking information that i use to reserve with on file (keep that in mind). the following days i was suppose to have packet info for the conference and every person i ran into at the desk was a freakin idiot. i went to the rep and she kept saying it was with them but they put no effort or interest in what was going on. i also had to go to the city walk and all i got out of them was we don't shuttle there. I have to mention that when i got to my room which was on the top - no elevators the entry way was covered in spiders. i had to call maintenance to clean them away and then little critters kept waltzing in every time i went in or out. the laundry facilities was 6 bldgs away which i think was a good 1/2 mile. The bathroom was dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic getaway”
Reviews.Author: AnaRushing
Reviews.Content: I surprised my fiance with a weekend trip to Orlando for his 30th birthday, and after hours of searching for the perfect hotel I found Star Island. From the moment we pulled in, we were both impressed. They asked for our names at the gate, which made us feel important and safe. The land is beautiful, and the room was wonderful. Much more modern than the pictures show. We stayed in a one bedroom villa, and it was huge. Massive living space, full kitchen, entry way, two bathrooms, a jacuzzi tub and huge bed. It was very quiet in the rooms, and yet the pool area was always lively and fun. I would absolutely stay here again, and am already planning my next stay! If you're planning on going to Disney, it's within 5 minutes and avoids all major traffic. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “My First Time At Star Island was Great!!!”
Reviews.Author: nasrich
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Star Island and I must say our trip was great. The property had so much than we expected, like pots, pans, utensils, etc. Our 1 bedroom studio had the amenities listed, and everything worked except for the iron. After trying to use the iron for about 30 mins. I called the front desk, and they responded in a timely manner by brining us another iron to use. I must say the new iron, was just a little better than the first, in that it was warm to the touch instead of being cool. This is a great place for families with kids, or for weekend get-a-aways and I will definately be back soon!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort!”
Reviews.Author: thisismeme
Reviews.Content: This place was really amazing from the time that my husband and i pulled up! The stuff was very friendly and helpful!. The villas are very clean as is the rest of the resort!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place - can't wait to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: mhart0123
Reviews.Content: The resort was beyond our expectations!! Our room was absolutely beautiful and we were amazed by how spacious it was (we had a one-bedroom suite with king-sized bed and jacuzzi) and all the amenities that were in the kitchen - we even had a mixer and a blender!! The pool was immaculate, and there were more than enough lounge chairs to accomodate everyone (one of our biggest complaints at other resorts we've stayed at in the past), and the happy hour specials and activities were great. Our ONLY complaint was our last night there the room above us decided to use their jacuzzi at 11pm and we could hear the water running and jets going. Next time we'll just ask for a room on the top floor.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit to Star Island and already wanting to go back”
Reviews.Author: Brent_C_613
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Star Island 3 years ago on our first trip to Orlando with our girls 3 and 6 at the time. And thought the resort was nice, clean good pools for the kids and great activities everyday. Since then we have visited 2 other resorts in the Orlando area but this year we decided for our week we would go back to Star Island because we only planed to spend one day at Disney and wanted a fun safe comfortable place to spend our days. When we told the girls now 6 and 9 they instantly remembered the Ice Cream Social every afternoon and the Karaoke at night. We stayed in room 2347 B an end unit with an OK view of the Tennis courts and some of the grounds but it was a short 2 minute walk to the pools yet far enough away that we didn't hear any sounds. The rooms was lean and well maintained, the carpets had just been steam cleaned so there was a nice fresh smell. Modern appliances, full size fridge, stove and microwave and everything you would need to cook in the unit. The daily activities were perfect for our girls and they quickly knew the timetable of what the Hula-Hoop competition was or the Limbo. For Mom and Dad we just enjoyed floating on our loungers listening to the DJ/Entertainment. tip- If you are a beer drinker buy the $7 take home beer glass, the refills are $4 at both bars and you get much more then their standard beer cup. We are already thinking that we might have to plan a trip back this November.

Reviews.Title: “It was GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: ABHonestreviewer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Star Island in May 2011 ,and found it to be a wonderful experience. In order to provide us with a two-bedroom, I actually had two units, a one-bedroom that was a large unit with full kitchen, nice-sized living area, a large master bedroom, w/d, and a balcony looking out on a lovely pond. To provide the second bedroom, I was given an adjoining, very nice, small one bedroom unit, with a mini kitchen, living area, and a bedroom with twin beds. The units were both very nice, the staff was helpful and pleasant, and the resort, though set back in a beautiful wooded area, is in the midst of almost any restaurant you can think of.

Reviews.Title: “AN AWESOME RESORT FOR THE ENTIRE FAMILY”
Reviews.Author: 34495Denise
Reviews.Content: Check in and check out were very quick; less than a minute. The suites were exactly as pictured on the website. The pool area and bounce house were great for the children. The hotel has poolside activities planned throughout the day. The suites were furnished with everything; flat screens, pots and pans, utensils, washer & dryer and jacuzzi. I would definitely recommend this resort to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: copp417m
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly & accomodating. The only criticisms I have is that our patio area needed "sprucing" up, ie: railing paint was peeling, the corners & ceiling area had not been cleaned & there were bug larvae stuck to it. The beds could be more comfortable & need to be upgraded to fit in with the luxury atmosphere. I enjoyed our deluxe 1 bedroom unit a lot if was definitely a great value for the dollar. The spa tub does seem to take forever to fill past the jets & tend to run out of hot water before it is filled. The hot water was not hot enough for me, but I understand most likely set at that temperature for safety concerns. Just minor criticisms, nothing to keep me from staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: reviewer33360805
Reviews.Content: Booked this resort while traveling to Orlando for a volleyball tournament. There was so much to do on the resort and especially at the pool area, that we did not want to leave to watch the tournament! Plenty of activities to keep the family entertained, and the pool area is beautiful with lots of room to swim, even with a crowd. Hoping to book another trip here this summer!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and familly friendly”
Reviews.Author: Delaware2011
Reviews.Content: Star Island is a large resort which has been taken over by Wyndham. We went there on an exchange thru RCI. When we first arrived we checked and in and the desk clerk was very friendly. She advised us that we would have to go to desk next to the elevators to get our parking pass and we just did that. However, this is where they get you to sign up for their 90 min TIME SHARE presentation for the next day. Basically, the lady, which her initials were LW, was like just meet at the lobby where the front desk is and you will have a 90 minute presentation you will have to attend and you will receive $85 and 3day/2night stay on us. So I was like its only 90 minutes it can't hurt. WRONG!!! Our presentation was over 4 hours long and they take you away from your resort to a actually Wyndham resort so they can show you "how special it is". I am filing a formal complaint with Wyndham because of the circumstances and how we asked them to take us back to our resort at the 90 min mark and they did not. Needless to say they sent us to another building down the road to collect on the $85. The 3/2 deal the hotels are not even around where we live and the closes one is approx 4 hours away. Would I do this again. ABSOLUTELY NOT! The Resort itself was nice. The unit was very big for 2 people. It had a full kitchen, except bring trash bags because they only give you two for the whole week. The decor was ok it could probably be updated a little bit. I did notice our t.v. was not flat screen and other units on the property had flat screens and were updated a little bit better. But who watches tv on vacation?? The bathroom space had a jacuzzi, which was very nice and a shower as well. It did have a double vanity for his/hers! The towel service is not great at all. If you are there a week you get 1 change of towels in the middle of the week and if you need more towels they charge you. The good thing is that you do have a washer/dryer combo to wash towels if needed as we did to save some $$$. The resort has 2 pools and a hot tub. The pools are pretty nice sizes. The DJ at the pool side during the day isn't that great. He mainly played older music and every once in a while played new. There is a pool bar as well. The gym is good, which is located near the game room in the main lobby. They do have basketball and tennis courts at the location. They also have water activities like paddle boats and they have their own little beach where people can fish. We didn't use the beach area, but from what we show it was a little small but ok for the guests I suppose. There is a play ground too for smaller kids. I wish there was more activities for younger adults tho. The only thing for younger adults to do at night is there is a outside bar on the second floor of the main building where they either have a DJ or karaoke going on. This is nicer then the pool bar during the day. The only issue we had while we stayed at Star Island was that our air conditioning stopped working one night and it got 81 degrees in our unit. We couldn't sleep at all this night. I called the front desk at 2am to ask them if they could send someone out to fix the problem. They advised that the maintenance people wouldn't be in til 7:30 the next morning (this was a lie because I was told correctly they don't come in til 8:30a.m.) and basically THEY COULDN'T HELP US. I called back at 8am to tell the front desk that it came on but for them to send someone so they could look at it. We left for the day and when we returned they left a message stating the air conditioning unit was set to go off at a certain time and then to come back on but they had fixed the problem. I would suggest having maintenance on 24/7 because of issues like this because what if it was in the middle of the summer?? Overall the stay at Star Island was good besides the few incidents we had. I would recommend this resort to Family's that have children because there are more activities for children to do than younger adults. There are nice restaurants (Bahama Breeze, etc.) about a 10 min ride from Star Island. Disney/Universal/Sea World are like 10-15 mins away for families that plan on going to them. The place was very relaxing and it was a nice getaway for me and my wife but we won't be going back.

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely stay here again!!!”
Reviews.Author: lnaiou1
Reviews.Content: The resort had lots of fun things to do for children and adults. The pools were great. I had a mini suite which was perfect. I was worried it might be to small, but we were very comfortable. The room was very clean and modern. The staff were very friendly. Great experience!!!

Reviews.Title: “Embarassing and Musty experience”
Reviews.Author: barigenou
Reviews.Content: The room had cobwebs draping across the bed, so that when I climbed into the bed I hadf cobwebs in my face. Dust was heavy on the light fixtures The tub wouldn't stopper so that we could take a bath, I had to call maintenance. There were no garbage bags, and we didn't realize this until after we took the garbage out. So we had to use grocery story bags. The mattresses were lumpy and sagging. The tvs timed out every 20 minutes. The list goes on and on. We were so unimpressed.

Reviews.Title: “Our unit's decor was like Vegas in the 1970's! Not like the photos on line.”
Reviews.Author: nancydNC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for 5 days recently. Our unit was a one bedroom with full kitchen which was very adequate. The walls are thin and we could hear our neighbors at times, but most of the time it was ok. The problem comes in with the decor of the unit. The online photos make it look like a very modern lovely apartment. But just wait--if you get one which has not been remodeled, you will have a surprise. The kitchen had the original stove from the 70's I am guessing.It is in good shape since vacationers don't usually cook, but a blast from the past none the less. But the real action is when you enter the bedroom--the decor is green marbled laminate furniture! Yes, that is right--furniture as well as the bathroom vanity cabinet.In addition to being extremely tacky, the doors in the lovely plastic beside tables didn't open which limited storage. The faux Italian style(faux finished columns,oversized dining table and light fixture which cannot be described!) is really too much and extremely dated. On the good side, the pool is nice and well staffed with a bar and hot dog stand.There is a nice workout room too.Staff was fairly unattentive at the desk however. One visit we had to wait awhile while the attendant completed a personal phone call.Later we tried to get boarding passes printed at the desk(as advised when we called the front desk) and the person couldn't figure out how to do it. He suggested that we do it ourselves at the business center which we would have done first had we been told about it earlier.

Reviews.Title: “A little hidden - but worth the find!”
Reviews.Author: Ili_from_Miami
Reviews.Content: We arrived a little late because the traffic was horrible and then we had a very hard time finding the Resort. Star Island is located on Mile Marker 11. The Star Island sign also advertises Fridays and located right behind Fridays. Across the street there is an Olive Garden. Can you tell we had a hard time finding it? The staff at the Registration desk was very nice and was prompt to register us. The same happened at checkout. This was basically my interaction with the reception area, since we had NO problems during our stay. There were activities at night close to the Registration Area, I can't comment because I didn't go to any of the activities, it sounded fun! The room was very spacious, very clean and well maintained. There was a fully equipped kitchen. The dining room had a table with 6 very comfortable chairs. We had wi-fi in the room and the speed was descent. The living room as very comfortable had a flat panel TV and a smaller one in the bedroom. The bedroom was very spacious with a king size bed and had a Jacuzzi inside. The bathroom was very comfortable and a separate closed section for the toilet. The shower was very comfortable My favorite part of the apartment was the washer & dryer. Imagine coming home after vacation with clean clothes. It as great! What I liked the best was the cleanliness, spaciousness and the ability to feel comfortable away from home. There were places to eat all around, it was centrally located, although not that close Downtown Disney (we got lost getting there). What I liked the least was the parking. Although there appears to be a lot of parking in front of the buildings, we had a difficult time finding a parking space close to our building. We were in Building 18 and also the sliding door on the living room of the apartment was dull, although we did have a small patio with a table and chairs, it would have been nice to have the room's view to the pool or to a nice garden. But back to the parking, what made the parking situation worse was that the carts used by the maintenance staff would take up parking spaces close to the building instead of parking in the parking zones that would not eliminate parking spaces close to the building. I would definitely ask about the occupancy and how full your building is. Building 18 appeared to be pretty full and the building in front of ours also seemed pretty full which didn't help the parking situation. Another thing I didn't care for was that we had to drive like 10 minutes to get to Disney (not too far but has a lot of traffic). Nevertheless, the distance would not impede us from staying there again. Although I would definitely ask for a different building with a nicer view.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort in good location”
Reviews.Author: Oma43
Reviews.Content: Star Island is a large resort which has been taken over by Wyndham. We went there on an exchange thru RCI. It seems to be well run, as I have found at all Wyndham resorts. Buildings seemed to range from 2 stories to 6. The tall buildings had at least one elevator. We had a nice one bedroom unit in building 18. Here the larger units are the "B" side. It looks just like the pictures on their website. It was roomy & great for a couple. It even has a stacked washer/dryer & 2 small boxes of soap powder. The smaller "A" side (which I didn't see) probably doesn't have a balcony. The unit was well equipped with nice furnishings. It had 2 wall mounted flat screen TV's-one in living room & the other in the bedroom. Unfortunately, the only bathroom is located in the master bedroom. Not a problem when you are only a couple but a big problem if someone is on the sleeper sofa (other than one's own small children maybe). The toilet is in its own little closet (which helps the privacy issue) next to the double sink area. There is a large standup shower and a large whirlpool tub (you can see it in the pictures surrounded by columns). Inside the unit we had no problem with noise from other units-maybe we were just lucky. The balcony is quite small-perhaps 7'x8'-with a dining table & 4 chairs. It is very close to the neighbor balcony-no privacy, plus the ones directly below/above you are easy to see & hear. We had a lot of noise from loud talking cell phone users & just plain loudmouthed talkers. Smoking is excluded from the units, so it is done on the balconies. That means that the neighbors’ smoke comes right to your balcony. A solid privacy wall would help--at least with the next door unit which is very close (as in “reach out and touch” close). I think parking is a problem. I doubt that they have enough spaces for one car per unit, much less 2 per unit. If you come in late, prepare to park well away from your building's entry area. The location is good, with several chain restaurants nearby and a supermarket within about a mile. We didn’t take part in any of the activities that the resort offered but they seemed to have a lot going on. The pool area was lovely and didn’t seem crowded. There were many tennis courts with lessons ongoing. The check-in was simple but they need to do something about the process to obtain a parking pass. You have to go to a small area (with a low ceiling) that has 4-5 agents who want you to sign up for the welcome breakfast/activities info meeting. They have to communicate with 8-10 new patrons and it ends up being horribly loud and one can’t hear anything. They really need to find a new place for this part of check-in. All in all, this is a nice resort. It is convenient to all of the major tourist attractions but the location is off the main road & therefore quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Star Island was great for us!”
Reviews.Author: DTSAlabama
Reviews.Content: My husband arranged for our 2 daughters and their families with young children and us to have 3 separate 2 bedroom units through timeshare exchanges for a week in March, 2011 at Star Island. Although we spent most of our time at Disney World, we found Star Island to be a nce refuge when we were not there. The pool area was great and the kids loved it. There were some nice looking playgrounds available too but we weren't there enough to use them. The tennis courts were great but we did not get to play tennis because there was a college tennis tournament going on the whole time we were there. There were other activities that we could have participated in but we were so busy with children and Disney that we didn't do any of them. We did have family pictures made by a photographer that offered his services on the location and we found him very nice and reasonable and the pictures were good too. The only negative aspect was sometimes the music from the main building was a little loud but it usually ended by 11PM. Parking was plentiful and the staff was very helpful..

Reviews.Title: “SCHOCKED”
Reviews.Author: millstone
Reviews.Content: My husband and I exchanged a 4 star time share for Star Island. The villa we stayed at was beautiful clean and comfortable. . How ever the pool was something else. coming from the North we expected to swim in the pool. How ever The pool was in the low 70's. The day time temps were high bu the night time temp. being March were low. I went to the front desk to inquire why the pool was cold. People come from the northern states and expect a heated pool. I expressed my dissatisfaction and got a dumb answer from the girl at the front desk.. II said well I would never have stayed her if I knew the pool wasn't heated. She said that is fine. I then asked to speak with the manager. He was to my surprise, standing right next to her. I asked him if that is how employees speak with a guests.. He said no,but never said a word about her rudeness. Don't stay at the resort is you want to use the pool in March.I can only imagine how cold it is Jan. and

Reviews.Title: “GOOD DEAL FOR THE DOLLAR”
Reviews.Author: TIMMY3434
Reviews.Content: One reason for booking here was the great tennis courts... Was not happy to find they were rented out during the day to a tennis club.. this made them unavailable to the guests... Wish I knew this before hand... All and all good value for the dollar...

Reviews.Title: “Fine for families, nothing great but certainly not terrible!”
Reviews.Author: HamTraveler
Reviews.Content: We found ourselves with a need to blow some Wyndam timeshare time or lose it. We had just come back from a Panama Canal cruise. It was a Spring Break week so choices were very limited and we had to head toward Orlando to find space. The resort is about 15 years old. They have tried to keep it up, but it still feels a bit out of date. Don't look for flat screen HDTVs here, you're not going fo find them. We had a smaller one bedroom unit with a kitchenette. They do provide pots, pans and most essentionals. Since we were not there to do the theme park thing, we used the opportunity to explore Florida. Since we are retired, it was a central location to explore from the Pacific to the Atlantic coasts. We checked out the real estate market with the possibility of becoming snowbirds. We finished off our stay by revisiting the Kennedy Space Center. The last time there was 1995 and it sure has changed. All in all -- not a bad stay -- If you don't mind an abundance of kids in the pool, this may be the place for you!!

Reviews.Title: “Best resort for activities”
Reviews.Author: sandra_latter
Reviews.Content: We have been going to this resort for about 6 years,We have always had an amazing time especially due to the staff. Scott who is the Activity guy @ the pool everyday he gets everyone involved and makes everyone feel like friends.He plays great music .And is an amazing guy. Dustin who is the D J in the evenings is a great entertainer also gets everyone involed especially Karaoke.He also is a graet guy. because of these 2 guys we keep going back to Star Island we love the resort and the kids have an amazing Time,

Reviews.Title: “Worth exactly what I paid...”
Reviews.Author: BigFredG
Reviews.Content: I normally don't take the time to write reviews. However, sine the reviews of Star Island are very inconsistent, I thought I would add my 2 cents. I booked the resort through Interval since I own a time share at another resort. The weekly cost was very reasonable given that the resort has nice amenities. When I arrived, check-in was efficient and the staff was very friendly. Since my son and I were going to Disney every day, we realized we would need a rental. The concierge was a little preoccupied on the phone with a personal matter but did secure a good value rental car for us. The location is very convenient to all the Disney parks. Parking at Star Island is also convenient and abundant. Entertainment at the resort was actually really good quality and drink specials ($4.00 mixed drink options) made for reasonable bar tabs. Also, the staff was very helpful when my lock off ended up next to a very noisy family... I was moved within the hour to another room. Now the downside. Walls in the resort are very thin. You hear everything. Rooms are "aged". Linens are old, door hinges slightly rusted, air conditioning keeps up (but bairly). All of this, while not a big deal to me and my 11 year old son, would not be ok with many folks used to staying at first quality time shares. So, in a nutshell, know yourself before booking here. If you want a good deal, good staff and nice location, I would recommend. If you are sensitive to the negatives I listed, look elsewhere. I would book again because the overall value is hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Not as Special as It Advertises”
Reviews.Author: BrooklynGuy13
Reviews.Content: If you lower your expectations, you won't be disappointed. This is a perfectly fine converted condo resort turned hotel. It's location to the parks and attractions is its best asset. Rent a car to get around quickly and easily. The hotel seems to have great amenities and assets, but you pay for every extra. Absolutely everything. If you've traveled frequently, you know there are better deals out there. Also, the WiFi is sketchy and that matters a great deal if you need Internet. The staff is surprisingly not as accommodating to WiFi needs as you would imagine, and they took my total lack of internet connection as an inconvenience to them, not me. The rooms are spacious and clean, and people around the pool area seemed to have a good time. There are better values out there. If you stay, buy a few items in a local grocery store or restaurant and have some meals in the room or on the terrace to save some money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: ADTK
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our short vacation in Fla. This was an exchange done with Interval and we were very pleased with our 1 bedroom unit. The place is beautiful! Any complaints would be there is not daily service to change towels or tidy up. We had 4 towels to start with on Sunday and we each used our towel twice before switching to a fresh one. Not what I was used to, but it worked for us. Also the comments about the noise from units next door is right on. Our bedroom wall was our neighbors kitchen I think because at 7am I would here the breakfast being prepared or a conversation like it was next to me. Overall we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Valentines Day Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Dan78541
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend took me here for our Valentines day get away, and it was AMAZING!!! We had gotten the romance package which was definitely worth every penny! We had no problem finding our room, or parking because there was plenty. The biggest confusion was the extra door in our room we were concerned that anyone staying in that room could just walk right into our room, but they couldn't. It was basically quiet besides the karaoke we could here coming from the pool bar, which we enjoyed from our back porch. The room was overall BEAUTIFUL! Everything was clean and comfortable. We will definitely be going returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for exploring this area of Florida”
Reviews.Author: ejohnsonc62
Reviews.Content: We found Star Island to be very well maintained - recently updated. Grounds are pretty - fountains, birds nesting on edge of lake, gated. Our room was exactly as the website pictures looked! We were in the B side of the two bedroom lockoff unit - very comfortable bed. There are many activities on site including a beautiful pool area, tennis courts, spa, gym room, water activities, evening activities many including food. (We did not take advantage of these but noted them.) In warmer weather one could spend several days there and not have to leave the resort. Resort is only a few minutes from Disney attractions (could hear and partially see fireworks at night), International Drive (lots of action there including Universal), many places to eat and a grocery near by (Publix). We did have two issues while we were there. One was the slow speed of the internet - especially depending on the time of the day. The other was parking. We were in building 18. As we discovered, when buildings 18 and 19 were built, enough parking spaces were not built. So if you came in as late as 8:00 pm or later parking near your building was a challenge.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay if you aren't expecting way too much.”
Reviews.Author: Teeta926
Reviews.Content: I am on online student and I needed access to the internet and the wi-fi connection is poor at best. There was no using cell phones whatsoever. Not sure what it is about the building but the connection to the outside was nonexistent with the exception of the television. The rooms were nice and the beds were very soft-good for me but my husband didn't like the bed so soft. There is no laundry in suite. If you want to get away from it all, it is a nice place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Stay way from the A & B Single Units”
Reviews.Author: southpugetsound
Reviews.Content: Me: Current Wyndham Owner Pros: Grounds are nice, pool/pool bar was great, great activities, free parking, close to grocery shopping, felt secure, nice fitness center, friendly staff. When I requested items, someone came over from maintenance/house keeping usually within ten minutes. Improvements: I stayed in a one bedroom A-unit and was very disappointed. Fortunately, I only stayed in the unit at night as I did stuff outside during my seven-day stay. The room smelled moldy (purchased two cans of Frebreeze to help combat the smell) and the walls/door separating my neighbor's room (the B unit) was so thin I thought they were in my room. I didn't bother asking for a new room as it was New Years week and the resort was somewhat sold out. The TV was an older tube TV that actually broke on my last day. I could also hear "everything" going on in the other bedroom adjacent to my bedroom. Other people I met at the resort had the same feeling about the A & B solo units but were too busy (like me) enjoying the sunny weather by the pool. I did hear good things about the larger units so perhaps they're in the process of renovating? The mornings were very loud as once it hit 7AM, you could hear the house keeping staff yelling/talking amongst each other in Spanish through the hallways along with leaf blowers, neighbors cars in the parking lot, etc. Wireless Internet was also very slow at times. There were 30 different buildings in this resort so perhaps not every building is as loud/bad as the one I stayed in? I did hear good things about some of the water front larger units but for the most part, stay away from the single units and check yourself into one of the other hotels along the street. Most people by the pool shared the same feelings as I did when you compare this resort to others in terms of privacy/amenities in the room. The pool bar was great and the DJ by the pool played good tunes!

Reviews.Title: “Best Weekend Ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lugoh20water
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Star Island Resort and Spa so much, we booked another stay in March 2011. From the time we arrived the staff was eager to assist us with our needs. The staff was very friendly and proffessional. We rented a Villa on the first floor faceing the front of the main entrance building 14. It was one of the best villas I have stayed in at this resort. Our family and friends met up with us at the resort over this weekend and had a blast!. We loved the karaoke on friday and took over. The weather on Sat. was not in our favor so we were able to enjoy the resort indoors. We have visited star Island for many years. this one was the iceing on the cake! I will be recommending it to all my friends and family. Thank you all, The Lugo Family.

Reviews.Title: “Amenities and Spa Highlight”
Reviews.Author: NatnlParkFan
Reviews.Content: Travelled with friends, and all were impressed with the quick and friendly check-in service as well as comfortable accommodations. We stayed at a two-bedroom lock-off suite for the weekend to visit Disneyworld. Very clean and felt at home especially after long day traveling. Included full equipped kitchen, laundry, and jacuzzi. Had a den with a sofa bed, but it was too cold and drafty for someone to sleep there. So be warned! Elevator also broke down during our stay so it was an arduous and noisy trek lugging our luggage down stairs. Staff that were there did not offer any help. One of my friends actually felt sick one day, but we knew she would be comfortable and safe. We were able to buy food from the onsite restaurant/cafe for her. They had decent fast food type selections. She felt better after good night's rest. We also took advantage of the outdoor jacuzzi and pool. Clean and relaxing. Tennis courts were located nearby. Another plus was the spa. Luckily, was able to reserve appointment same day and experience was simply heaven. They served you champagne or water before and after. Definitely worth it! Since I'm a Wyndham owner, my friend and I were wrangled into a 3 hour sales pitch. These representatives are aggressive and very rude! I felt embarrassed for my friend who felt angry, irritated, and annoyed after the sales experience. If you don't get conned into attending one of these, you'll surely enjoy your stay at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “once is enough”
Reviews.Author: laser4992
Reviews.Content: This is a time share and I am a time share owner, but not this property, (yes we went for the sales pitch), I knew I was getting what they call a three bedroom but actually is two suites so I got 2 bedrooms and and a couch that opened to a bed. The doors seperating the two suites needed a door stop to keep the doors open but they can't supply you with one since they say it a fire hazzard. We went to the dollar atore and purchased our own. The water is not filtered so we purchased our own bottled water for coffee and drinking. The pillows were hard but the beds were comfortable. we did not have an assigned parking place to our room so when we were out late we had to park in a different parking area, enven though its a gated community I wasn't happy about this. There is a fee to use the internet even in the (business area) but you can print you return flight tickets for free, with the clerk looking over your sholder. The young girl who was there to assist you had no idea that she was in Florida and couldn't tell you haw to cross the street without clip notes. The rooms were clean, but the view from the deck were all dead plants and trees. I was only 80% happy with this resort next time I will try one different, there were "too many sorry we don't offer that" for my money.

Reviews.Title: “Room was terrible, Wifi was nearly useless”
Reviews.Author: mauriciopichardo
Reviews.Content: We originanly looked at Star Island as a cheap way to split a room with a business collegue. It was not worth it, the internet was as slow as an old dial up modem even with the provided bridges. The room smelled like mold and everything in the bathroom flooded. Outside the grounds and exteriors are well kept however the interiors need serious updating, the wall/door seperating the next room didn't keep any noise out we kept thinking people were in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: rfuchs0917
Reviews.Content: I booked a "mini suite" are Star Island for New Year's weekend to celebrate my 9yr old son's birthday. We checked in without much issue, but when we got to the room we were NOT HAPPY. We booked a suite, but what we got was the guest bedrooms of what was originally a three bedroom condo. So, our "living room" or TV viewing area was a 10X8 bedroom with ONE couch, a dinette and a small kitchen showed into it. There was NO WAY three people could relax in there and watch TV....unless we were all sitting erect and at attention! The bedroom was equally as small and the bathroom was in the hallway - pretty bizarre for a "suite." I have seen better, bigger STANDARD rooms at a motel 6! I was not happy with the "suite" for $160!! So, we went back to the front desk and I let the lady at the front desk know that the "suite" would NOT work for us. They said ALL of the "mini-suites" were thay EXACT SAME floorplan. They have a KING SUITE for $200 a night. I was hostage at this point so we took a KING suite. The King suite was MUCH nicer. It is the original entry, half bath, kitchen, living room,dining room, master bedroom and master shower....of the original 3 bedroom condo. I think the way they have butchered the original 3 bedroom condo and are calling them "suites" is gross. We are VERY DISAPPOINTED - this is NOT the experience they sell on their website!

Reviews.Title: “Good for what we needed”
Reviews.Author: KatiedlC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Star Island Resort for a week while visiting the parks. There were two families sharing both suites. First I would say that the rooms had been recently remodeled and were very, very nice, especially the suite with the king bed and jacuzzi tub. The 'B' side - which they list as the 'mini-suite' - was just adequate for my sister and her husband and teenager. They would have been cramped it they didn't have our side to come over and hang out in. Although our rooms looked nice, they seemed to be poor shape. The washing machine knob was broken (took me 15 minutes to figure out a way to make it turn without it), the sheets for the pullout couched were the wrong size. When we called housekeeping to get them exchanged it took them until the next day! The pullouts were so uncomfortable anyway that the boys just slept on top of the couch. Our coffee maker was broken, drawers would not shut once pulled out and the units were understocked with things like toilet paper. I understand that a vacation rental isn't supposed to supply you with much, but some windex for the glass table would have been nice. Okay, essential. The resort itself was just okay. I understand that Windham had taken it over and started refurbishing. It looks like a resort that started off nice, went into disrepair and they then slapped a coat of paint on it. For a four-star hotel it seemed like it was trying but not quite making the mark. I've been to other resorts in this class and it doesn't measure up. My family went to the $7/person barbeque and it was just a pulled pork sandwich. Hardly something to put on your flyer as an event. The boys used the pools and they were nice. Being December it was good that they were heated. The fitness center was large and clean and wished we could have used it more than once. The vacation center personnel were very nice and pushed us to go to a timeshare presentation. When we canceled they were fine with it. Bottom line: I would have rated it higher if it weren't supposed to be a 4-star resort. It is great if you have a family and need the room. I would probably stay again if I got a great deal and not used up the valuable points. It IS a nice but more of a 3 star resort. I wanted to give it 3.5 but had to choose. It's also just a little too far from Disney. Not too bad, but far enough away that we couldn't get back to take an afternoon break and go back easily. It was good to have the two suites. We used my parents Marriott trade in (they have the best plan available) and this was nowhere near as nice the other places we've stayed for a trade in. They called it a three bedroom and it's NOT. It's two bedrooms with some pullout couches. That's fine if it's for the kids but no way an adult could sleep on one of those. Even my 14 yo nephew was too big. The one bedroom suite was much, much better and the jacuzzi tub was a nice bonus. Don't be frightened of staying there, just be aware of what it is and isn't.

Reviews.Title: “It was truley the most fantastic 2 days I have had in the last 10 years!”
Reviews.Author: Largonians
Reviews.Content: Starting with the people at the guard house to the crew cleaning and primping the grounds and everyone in between---polite was the word of the day. Everyone greeted you whenever you passed them as if they were neighbors. You could stay there for days and never leave the grounds, so much to do. EVERYTHING was immaculate. I have decided I will call here first each and every time I visit the Orlando area. Once you try it you will feel the same. I am already planning another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Better than before!”
Reviews.Author: JGSWOMAN
Reviews.Content: Our family was celebrating my sister's birthday and Star Island had a great deal on the 3 bedroom. The reservation was under my name and i couldnt arrive till late that night, so i called ahead and they allowed my family to come and get the keys since they got there early. I have stayed at this place before and i wasnt impressed. We stayed in the mini suite. We left after one day and went to the Calypso Cay. So when i made the 3 bedroom reservation for my family i was a little weary about it. When i arrived, i saw that the mini suite building i stayed in last time was condemned. The bedroom was nice and the family enjoyed the weekend. We didnt get a chance to enjoy any of the amenities but the previous stay, the pool was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, comfortable resort”
Reviews.Author: TinyWanderer
Reviews.Content: Like other users I was hesitant when I booked a weekend long stay here in the first week of December. I'm so glad we stayed here because it was great! We used the timeshare exchange and the room looked just like the pictures. We had a fully stocked kitchen with granite countertops, a beautiful glass dining table and comfortable living area. The master suite was huge, with a very comfortable king size bed, a huge jacuzzi tub and double sinks. Since we were staying as timeshare guests, wifi was free and there was a free towel exchange on Wednesday (since we stayed 7 days). Everything was clean and the resort was quiet. We didn't rent a car for the first few days and there was a public grocery store within walking distance. The closest restaurant was TGI Fridays. The resort was a little farther away from the other resorts, but only about 5 miles so if you rented a car the Premium outlets, universal and disney were only 10-15 min away. We ate at Smoky Bones and Girbaldis Mexican and really loved both restaurants (definitely recommend renting a car if you stay here). It was a little chilly (around 40-55 degrees) so we didn't get to enjoy the pool, golf, volleyball court, or other amenities they offer. However, the fitness center was well stocked with lots of equipment and weights (although a little outdated it still did the job) and we used it every day. The locker room also had a full hot tub, steam room, and sauna which was really nice. Unfortunately my spouse and I had to use separate locker rooms so we couldn't enjoy them together. Overall we really enjoyed our stay and our only complaint was that they had karaoke 3 nights a week, which was kind of irritating to hear people sing off key until 11 pm. Other than that though the resort was beautiful and we loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: lors61
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Star Island resort to use up a friend's timeshare points that he was unable to use before the year's end. I was somewhat concerned having read the negative reviews. Our one bedroom suite in Bldg 19 was perfect: newly refurbished, very spacious, the jet tub was a huge plus, and we used the stocked kitchen. Seriously, this room looked better than their promo pix online. Everything was very clean and the resort was quiet. We were just wanting a few days away (no kids) and this worked so well. We were approached by phone on the first day for the "condo meeting" sales pitch, but they accepted my husband's decline and that was it. Smooth check-in and check-out, well-cared for grounds, no beefs here. If you want towels exchanged I believe there's a $9 fee. They gave us so many towels this was unnecessary for us. You're close to all the Orlando/Kissimmee tourist attractions (we avoid these) but still close driving distance to Daytona, St Augustine, Melbourne Beaches, ect. There are entertainment options daily at the resort. I would happily return. I was left feeling that the negative reviewers must have been at a different facility.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NLF5
Reviews.Content: We always check out trip advisor before we book any hotel and we read the reviews on this one as well. The rooms were very large, plenty of space for the five of us. We had a three bedroom. The amenities were great with a beautiful pool. I definitely see why you wouldn't want to have a room near the pool. Very noisy at night. Our room backed up to the woods and felt very private. I was surprised to see how close the balcony was to the units on either side. There wasn't anyone in either room but it was very close so if you went out in the morning to drink your coffee in your jammies you better check to see if anyone else is sitting outside as well. The resort is so close to everything and stores are very conveniently located.

Reviews.Title: “The resort maintenance doesn't appear know their equipment.”
Reviews.Author: rtgibson
Reviews.Content: I contaer contacted the hotel manager after we had several issues. The microwave on the B side wouldn't work, the air/heat on both the A/B side wouldn't he controll, the hot tub on the A side would not hold water, the range on the B side would not work and the comode on the A side would not flush properly. The air conditioning repair man came to the room torepair the unit. He said the damper wasn't closing so he put a pair of pliers on the damper and forced it closed. He said it was fixed and left. The next nght I had to turn the unit to heat. I called for the repairman again but he didn't show up. The next day I called again for the repair man. The repairman and the the engineer showed up to work on the unit. Their answer was to move our rooms instead of repairing the unit. Hotair for the internet does not work . The office refures you to the Tech Support Line that doesn't answer the phone.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location and Great Value”
Reviews.Author: jayw2001
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose the Star Island Resort as a compromise between price and location to the Orlando attractions. As it turned out, the resort was terrific and the location as nearly ideal, located between Disney and Universal. Ten minutes and you were in either place. The resort had a very nice pool and the suite had a jacuzzi tub in the bedroom, along with a nice sized living room, a terrace that overlooked the pool, and flat-screen TVs everywhere. The two bedroom + living room suite can easily sleep six in max comfort. If a continental breakfast was included, it would have been perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable and many stains”
Reviews.Author: MG33333333
Reviews.Content: We had a one bedroom suite with the most uncomfortable bed we have ever slept in. The sofa had many stains so we sat on towels. This place looks so nice on pictures, buit we were disappointed once we were there. Not worth the money at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Griv16
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our anniversary. It was clean and roomy and had a nice jacuzzi tub in the bedroom. The parking was free, which is very nice. The check in and check out was quick and easy. The only problem I could see is for people who are staying there for several days, you have to pay $9 or so per day to get clean towels. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “get it all at Star Island”
Reviews.Author: sunriseinnh
Reviews.Content: This resort is 10 mins from Walt Disney World and has great amenities. Our three bedroom unit gives us plenty of room for 8 people.

Reviews.Title: “We wont be back.”
Reviews.Author: Disgeek101
Reviews.Content: I'll start by saying that I have stayed at this resort in the past, with only minor issues. This trip was tarnished by the rude staff, who flat out refused to help with anything. The pictures on the website show off the newly refurbished units, but chances are you will get one of the older, more dated units instead. We were on the 5th floor, and could easily here the jacuzzi party going on above us, and the cockroach in the kitchen was a little surprise. When we complained and asked to move units, we were basically told where to go. In the end we switched resorts. Rude staff, maniac drivers on property and general low standards have ruined what was once our paradise getaway. We wont be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!!”
Reviews.Author: ARMY_MOM_ONE
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for 4 days and three nights. My husband and I shared an one bedroom villa with our two young children. I did visit this website before booking the resort and read many negative reviews..however I went with my gut feeling and decided to book it anyway. I actually found out about condo direct from a review on this website where I booked the total stay for $160 - such a deal. As far as my stay, I was beyond impressed! I called about a week before arriving to request a renovated room as well as to be as far away from the pool and bar area as possible. There was no problem with my request and the woman was very pleasant. When my family showed up to the resort after passing many mediocre hotels, we were relieved to pull into the drive of STAR ISLAND. It is absolutely stunning. When we checked in there was a deposit of $100 that we had to leave for incidentals because we paid in advance. However, the desk agent was beyond nice gave us access for free wireless and gave us information on all the resort activities. Our rooms was immaculately clean huge plasmas and modern furniture. I LOVED IT!! There was plenty of room for the four of us in the queen bed, but we also had a queen sized convertible couch. The view from the balcony was great and I never saw a bus. There was no need for housekeeping because they have free laundry rooms and even provide the laundry detergent. The pool was great; there was an end for children and a deeper side for adults. At the pool, there is also a poolside bar and hotdog stand. Within the same area is a conveinent store, spa, and an upstairs bar/club. Transportation to Disney was not free, but for two dollars per adult you could catch the city bus all the way to Disney and back. It saved money on parking and was great even with kids and a stroller. There are many gift shops and restaurants within walking distant so there is really not a major need a rental car if you fly to Orlando. My family did enjoy this vacation and we are definitely ready to go back next year!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: DSCAshburn
Reviews.Content: We arrived July 23rd for a weeks stay through Interval International. I arrived early hoping we could have an early check in so that my very pregnant daughter that lives in Orlando could enjoy a day at the resort before having her baby the following day. Natasha at the front desk was wonderful! Natasha contacted the housekeeping supervisor and arranged for our early check in.(We arrived at noon and check in was at 4pm) I found everyone at the resort very nice and helpful. The room was exactly how the pictures on the website had shown. (no surprises) The resort was very clean and provided many amenities. I look forward to a return trip so that I can enjoy all that Star Island Resort has to offer. By the way, I have a beautiful grandson, born July 25th, 7lbs 15oz.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon ruined”
Reviews.Author: cercis621
Reviews.Content: We booked a honeymoon package at Star Island back in January for a trip in June 2010. We were staying for 10 days, so we asked if we could book two honeymoon packages. The reservations clerk said she could do that, and then she would book the rest of the time at a reduced rate. Because of that, she gave us two confirmation numbers and then quoted a price. A week before our wedding, we called to make sure everything was ok, and the weekend clerk couldn't find our 2nd confirmation number. We had to wait until Monday to call back, and that clerk confirmed our numbers and made a note in the record. On arrival at the resort after our wedding, the clerk said there were no notes in our record and could not find our second confirmation number. She had us checking out after 3 days. We argued with them about 10 minutes, then they suddenly found the 2nd confirmation, but had us changing rooms. We argued some more until she finally agreed to keep us in the honeymoon suite, and said she would put a note in the record. We had 4 suitcases with us, and found out our room was on the 3rd floor, with no elevator. We went back to ask if we could have someone help us with our luggage. We waited 20 minutes and no one ever showed up. By that time,it had started to rain. We had to haul our luggage up 3 flights of open stairs in the rain. (Anyone who has seen Florida rains knows that when it rains, it pours). That was Sunday night. That Tuesday, I decided to go down to the desk to make sure everything was ok. The clerk asked if we were checking out. I told her no, we had booked for 10 days. The clerk said no one had put any notes on the reservations. She had to issue us new card keys to get us back in the room. She also had the price different than what was quoted us, so I got to argue about that some more. That afternoon we went to use the safe in the room, and it was locked. We had to have someone from security to come open it for us. Wednesday, we expected to receive our second honeymoon package, which included a TGIF gift card. When it didn't come, I went back down to the desk, and the woman again said there were no notes in our record about that. I asked for the manager, and only the assistant manager was present. While he apologized for the error, all he would give us was $25 room credit. I asked for the managers name and number, which was supplied, but was told it was her day off. I had also inquired about the free internet service in the room, which was listed in the AAA book, but was told I would have to pay for it. Only after I complained did the assistant manager say he would give it to me. Thursday, while we were at Disney World, another manager called,and I told him we expected a day free for not getting our second honeymoon package and all the trouble we went through. He agreed to that. Friday, I went to the front desk, and found that the manager had given us credit for the cheapest day we had stayed. I told the clerk we expected one-tenth off our 10 day stay. We ended up having to call another manager in order to have that done. Tuesday night, we rented a dvd from Blockbuster to watch in the room. The dvd player wouldn't play it. We called maintenance, and the guy told us that sometimes these players wouldn't play dvds from Blockbuster or Walmart, but the newer players in some of the rooms would. He couldn't/wouldn't get us one of those players. So we paid for a rental we didn't even get to see. We had problems almost everyday we were there, and it basically ruined any chance we had to relax. We couldn't wait to check out and get back home. The only good time we had was the massages we got with the first package, and swimming in the pool. I would not recommend this resort to anyone. We had actually signed up for one of their timeshares. They lured us with a free continental breakfast, which consisted of packaged pastries. The juice machine didn't even work, so they had to go find juice for us to drink with our 'breakfast'. By the end of our stay we were so disgusted with the place that we cancelled our agreement when we got home. No one seems to be able to do their job at that resort, and if you don't complain, you end up paying for it. In the first four days we were there, we heard two other people complaining about the service, and that was just while WE were at the desk.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL PROPERTY -- GREAT VALUE -- LOVED IT!!”
Reviews.Author: pgh16063
Reviews.Content: We booked a trip to WDW for 5 of us including our daughter, son-in-law and 3 yr. old grandson. Because of jobs, we can only travel during peak times so we wanted to be close to the park so. WDW properties were a consideration but we wanted to all stay together and 2 rooms were VERY expensive. We looked at houses off property and they had an appeal but we wanted a resort with some activities for our grandson. After HOURS of agonizing over where to stay we chose Star Island. We were a little worried because of some of the reviews but our room was fabulous. We booked the 3 bedroom villa and it was exactly like the pictures. The units can be rented separately so maybe that is where people are saying they can hear through the walls. We never heard anyone else in the building. The master bedroom unit has a full kitchen, laundry, patio and looks just like the picture! Attached to the master unit is almost like a separate living quarters! There is a bedroom with 2 double (or maybe queen) beds, a bath in the hall and a separate living area with pull-out sleep sofa and kitchenette. This entire side can be closed off by a door or kept open to the master unit. There were flat screen tv's in every bedroom and living room! DVD players in the living room and room with the pull-out sofa. We were there 4 days and did not order cleaning or towel service. There were plenty of towels in the bathroom and towels at the pool. The grounds were very well kept. The pools were great and a snack bar/bar area right by the pool. Our internet service worked fine. At times was a little slow but usually no problem. The hotel allows you to print out boarding passes for free on their computers. When booking, I did request an updated room. They say almost all rooms are updated anyway. I would not request a room right by the pool since they have nightlife going on there until 11:00 p.m. or so. The noise from pool is the onlly reason I gave 4 stars to sleep quality. The beds were great. Bottom line -- we loved our stay and would stay there again! Great resort!

Reviews.Title: “Great place unless you need to be connectd”
Reviews.Author: Disneyresident
Reviews.Content: We had a three bedroom suite for a little more than a week. The room was great; very spacious, clean and well furnished. The staff was pleasant and the conceirge service was able to ably handle the few incidentals that we needed help with. I would highly recommend this resort, EXCEPT If you need access to the internet, which I frequently do to keep in touch with my office, even on vacation, the headaches here are enormous and unending. The wireless provider at this property (Hot Air) does not have sufficient bandwitdh to support stable connections from the guest rooms. The technical support from the vendor is tried to be helpful at first, trying to reconfigure Internet Explorer, etc., but eventually gave up, saying that their service was for "casual users." The technical support staff never called back to assist with problems, despite promises to so so. By the fifth or sixth call the technical support staff became rude and confrontational, insisting that it was a problem with my computer rather than their service. On the few occasions when I was able to establish a connection from my room, the speeds were slower than dial-up and the connection would frequently drop unexpectedly. The front desk will refer to you to the "business center;" a desk outside the video game room (which is loud and is not deparated from the "business center" by a door. The connection at the "business center" works well, but is incredibly inconvenient due to the noise, foot traffic and distance from the comforts of the guest rooms (it is located in a building that was a considerable distance from our room in this large complex). I met a number of other guests at the "business center" who also reported significant problems with maintaining a stable connection through this service in their rooms. As a result, I will use caution in returning to this resort and would never do so if there were to be a remote possiblity of needing to connect to my office or otherwise needing the internet. However, if you never need or want to use the net, this resort delivers exceptional value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Not all the pictures make it appear to be”
Reviews.Author: time-out-for-us
Reviews.Content: I was excited when booking at this resort as it was my families first vacation all year and fairly close to home. The photos made it appear absolutely gorgeous. The reality was that the rooms inside where nice and the resort entry/check in was nice. The service was not the best, never received housekeeping any of the 5 days we were there, several things were broken down and non-functional. Grounds were not maintained as well as the entry grounds, elevators were not AC'd but felt heated instead. Security at entry good but none through out resort thus problems with others being rude into the early hours. Walls were thin and we could here everything in the room beside us including them running their bath water. We had to search for a cart to get our belongings from the car to the room and ended up having to get one from another building on the resort. All and all the rooms were nice but that really is it. The pool was beautiful but seemed more like a babysitter for parents who did not want to watch their children. The hot tub was nice even though it had viewable repair needs. The resort for my family was not a relaxing place. There is a trailer park in the back just past the resort fence (not the best scenary). Beds were comfortable, very comfortable. We spent most time staying in our rooms or going to local attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful staff, clean rooms, nice pool area, great spa!”
Reviews.Author: clanceykc
Reviews.Content: Overall, our stay was awesome! My family saved a ton of money by going to the Walmart down the street to buy snacks, drinks and food to prepare in our suite. The flatscreen T.V.'s in every room were really nice, my 8 year old son could watch what he wanted and when the adults didn't want the T.V. on, he went into our room to watch it. The location of the resort was extremely conveinent to Walt Disney World and several Outlet Malls. The pool was fun for the whole family. Especially the 2 for 1 beer special they had one day! The spa was very nice and relaxing, fairly priced as well. The conceirge desk was most helpful in recommending a nice restaurant and giving us directions to it, although I think for the price I wouldn't go back to Johnnie's Hideout again. The front desk was also helpful and gave me extra detergent for the washing machine at no cost. I really enjoyed having a washer/dryer in the suite, very conveinent. I was a little disappointed in the lake where my brother and son went jet skiing ($55 for 30 mins) There wasn't a whole lot of lake to explore and they had just dropped a chemical in to kill the hydra that was overtaking the lake. Although I will say that the guy at the rental shack was super helpful and nice. Overall, great resort, great experience, conveinent to everything, even Cocoa Beach was only 50 miles away. Helpful and pleasant staff. Great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Dont be fooled!!”
Reviews.Author: newfietease
Reviews.Content: At first this seems like a really nice place...however the pics u seen on their site, dont expect to get a room like that. We had two rooms, the first was nice however we were moved after we had a uninvited guest in the bedroom...a huge poisionous spider the size of my hand on the wall just over the master bed!!!!! Security came and tried to spay it, but it got away!! I have never seen a spider so big in all my life!! Security guy was just as terrified of it as we were! So we asked to be moved...they moved up to a less than nice room in another building. It was soooo outdated and and uncared for, needless to say we were very disapointed. So we dealt with it, after all we didnt go on vacation to stay inside. But what really blows my mind...Star Island allows a guy to set up display in their lobby, selling fake jewlery!!!! He swore up and down it was all real, he even went on to say "Do u think Star Island would let me set up here if I wasnt selling top quality gold jewlery?" So $460 later my boyfriend had a new gold chain, it "was" beautiful. 6 months after we got home, it started to tarnish and turned his neck green!!! I called the number on the card the seller gave us.the woman who answered the phone just said "hello" like it was a home number, not a buisness!! I was on hold for 40minutes then she tried to explain that its "bonded gold" and he can ship his chain back to them to be re-dipped in gold and he had to pay!!! What a dissapointment!!! What a rip off!! Needless to say we wont be back to Star Island!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: koi0305
Reviews.Content: okay,let me just start off by saying,i was a little skeptic at first about this hotel...i almost didnt book it due to all the horriable reviews....but i took a chance.i was going for my birthday,my boyfriend was treating me to a 3 day get away being that we've been working like slaves lol,well,for the price i figured "eh cant be THAT bad" so we just did it...to everyone thats been leaving bad reviews heres my reply to you- "quite your B****ing".ive stayed in some PRETTY expensive hotels in orlando(mainly around the disney parks,such as the swan,animal kingdom lodge,the contemporary, etc.just to name a few) this hotel was by far the best hotel ive stayed at.HANDS DOWN. i simply loved our room. IT WAS EVERYTHING LIKE IN THERE WEBSITE. YES. i was veryyyyy nervous i was gonna get some out dated room.BUT! just to ease my nerves i called the hotel BEFORE i checked in and asked if we can get an upgraded room,because ive seen the out dated pictures blah blah there reply? "OF COURSE! HALF OF OUR HOTEL IS 80% PERCENT COMPLETE,DONT WORRY" super super nice.... honestly,it was everything i could ever want in a room.cant compare to any of those "5 star" hotels or the MOTELS lol . the bed was JUST AS comfortable as our king size bed or if better. the service was "disney status" I L O V E D I T . literally 15 min away from disney,and in the center of it all! were planning to come back some time in october.we stayed 6/9-6/11 so it was recent. so,here are my final reviews. KID FRIENDLY TENN FRIENDLY ADULT FRIENDLY SENIOR FRIENDLY GREAT LOCATION GREAT SERIVICE BEAUTIFUL ROOMS. i would recommand this to a friend,but not an enemy,i dont want them to know about this jem! oh! on a negative note,i just wish it was pet friendly,but not really. and the mosqitos,but they cant controll that lol

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: msht1234
Reviews.Content: When we checked in it was a beautiful lobby and very clean. But the room was a diffrent story all together. It was horrible!!!! The instant we walked in the room there was a very distinct musty smell and a cleaning chemical that gave you an instant head ache. We turned around and went to the check in desk. Their first response was we can send someone to look into the smell. I said no we need another room or to be moved to their other property. Well needless to say they moved us to a newly renovated room. Even it was newly renovated it still was just ok. With being a wyndam owner we expected a nicer resort. When checking out another owner was telling the front desk staff their experience was horrible also. They compared it to "slumming it" . The only bright side of the stay was the wonderful staff at the wyndam desk and leaving. If you want a nice time share check out their other property Bonnet Creek that is where we will be staying from now on.

Reviews.Title: “They were great!”
Reviews.Author: irmawoodward
Reviews.Content: The condo direct (found on Travelzoo) folks were worthless but the hotel was terrific!

Reviews.Title: “Have to Agree that Pictures are Deceiving”
Reviews.Author: Babysvt
Reviews.Content: Took a trip with my Mom to Orlando and decided to give Star Island a try because I had gone there and looked at the model room, which is shown on the website. I own at Fantasyworld and seeing that the price was the same for both places I decided to go with Star Island. We stayed in a two bedroom unit. When we got there and got to the room I was extremely disappointed. We were at the building farthest away from the entrance and the room was not at all like what I had seen. The kitchen was not a full kitchen but more of a kitchenette. The kitchen is a big deal for me because I like to be able to cook my meals in the room. The sink was so small that it was nearly impossible to wash anything in it. We had to actually go and buy some cooking utensils because the room did not come with them. The living room area was also small with a very small TV. The rooms were very noisy and my room faced the walkway outside and was directly across from the elevator. It is a good thing I always travel with earplugs and a face mask for sleeping. The second bathroom had a jacuzzi tub but in order to get into it you had to step over a 2 foot wall to get in. Not very convienient for my handicapped Mom. Although the resort is very nice and everything is clean, I would not stay here again but will stay at my home resort just because of the advantage of the full kitchen, easy access jacuzzi tub, 42" plasma TV, two bedrooms and three bathrooms. In the future I will call ahead and make sure of what I am getting because this was not at all what I expected and they don't advertise this unit on the website.

Reviews.Title: “It's Always A Pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: Jami_Arcadia
Reviews.Content: I go every year with my family as a vacation. We're a huge group: adults, young children, and teens. Everyone always enjoy themselves. The kids go to the pool, the adults enjoy the bar, and everyone else goes to the game-room or the gift shop. The rooms are spacious, the beds are comfy, and the resort is in a GREAT location. Absolutely awesome. I love you Star Island.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and clean, would definitely go again!”
