Reviews.Author: tink9602
Reviews.Content: My friends and I were there for a 2 day seminar and only spent one night. We took the 3 bedroom suite/2 baths. Very roomy and clean, the 3rd bedroom was a little small with only a pull out sofa but not bad for kids. Plenty of things to do for the kids and would definitely come back to enjoy them. We were gone all day and only used their amenities that evening. Highly recommend for price as well as room.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING, ABSOLUTELY FABULOUS”
Reviews.Author: jeman0705
Reviews.Content: We recently took our 18 month old daughter to Disney for the first time and stayed at the Star Island Resort. We LOVED it!!!!! The resort is amazing, the rooms are fabulous, it's like actually having a vacation home with EVERYTHING that you need. I would absolutely recommend this place over and over again. We actually loved the resort so much, that we were debating if to go to the parks at all or just stay all day at the resort day!!!! We will defintely be back again SOON!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “great experience !! new and clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: rushme2u
Reviews.Content: this place is awesome, and so convenient from all major disney parks. When they say 'full' kitchen they mean it ! i had to cook for my little one and i felt at home. All in all a great place to vacation with kids. The spa was excellent too. The only thing is the sound proofing in the rooms - you can hear your neighbours very clearly, and surely they can too..

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE!! THE KIDS AND ADULTS WOULD COME AGAIN!”
Reviews.Author: buddy2425
Reviews.Content: We loved this resort, and we have been to 4 other resorts in this area in the past 6 years. It was very clean, comfortable and priced right! We loved the fact that the resort was smaller and we could walk everywhere, and not have to worry about out teenager's wondering to far! They even had security sending them home after 11pm, the kids are 14, 13, & 12. The entertainment day and night was great, something for everyone! We really enjoyed being able to Kareoke with our kids; at home they only offer that in bars. Our daughter loved hearing her daddy sing! Even a four year old girl had sang, awww too cute! The staff was great!! We checked out on Saturday, but we didnt want to leave until the sun went down, they had a beautiful area with showers, mirrors, towels, and plugs; so we were able to get clean and fresh for our 19 hour road trip back to Michigan. We had multiple family's with us and every adult and child said they want to come back here next year!! I would recommend the 3 bedroom because that has a full kitchen, 1 king bedroom, 1 bedroom with 2 double beds, and 2 additional pull out's. The 2 bedroom will have 1 king bedroom and only a pull out in the living room. Not much difference in price to get the 3 bedroom!

Reviews.Title: “Great, Safe, Friendly Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: austinshmaustin
Reviews.Content: We own timeshare through Wyndham & thus booked through them. Had a 2 bedroom lock-off. Layout was a little strange, (would not want to stay here if only using 1 side,) but since booked both sides, once we got used to it - it was fine. From what I was told/understand, there are suites that are still owned by Star Island, and some are owned by Wyndham. The ones owned by Star Island have a more modern decor. The ones owned by Wyndham have older, 80's/90's tropical decor. (Now this is what I was told when I asked why our room had the later decor, & didn't look modern like the pics on the website. This is not meant to be a derogatory statement, nor an insult.) The pool area was our favorite spot - when I ran to the room to get $ for snacks, my 14 yr old son accidently busted his nose. The security guard & manager had gotten him some ice & stayed with him until I returned. They were very caring. All the staff, the entire stay, was very nice & polite (even well before the busted nose.) I would stay here again in a heart-beat, and am even thinking of sending my sister & her family here. Side note: the free internet didn't work in our room, but we were on vacation & didn't really need it!

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy pool and bar area can be heard...”
Reviews.Author: wavynavy
Reviews.Content: Very noisy pool and bar area can be heard from the rooms. Kareoke every night is very loud. Operations managers and the night front desk manager do not listen to complaints. All resort activities are provided by a completely separate business from the resort owned by the brother-in-law of the owner, so they refuse to quiet down at night. Not a good choice for young families or early birds!!

Reviews.Title: “Not really 3 bedrooms as expected”
Reviews.Author: jjjjjjMass
Reviews.Content: Hello, at first I thought Interval International had come through for us by allowing us to change the date of our getaway due to the passing of my wife's mother. That seemed great until we checked into our 3br unit at Kissimmee Star Island Resort. There were 2 br and one sitting room with a sleepsofa. I called the desk at 11pm(late arrival) and was told that I.I. considers that to be a legitimate 3br. "your mistake was booking through I.I." was exactly what the night auditor said on March 6th. It turns out this place doesn't have 3br at all. Every unit is the same with the only option being to rent a unit A & B and separate unit A if you really want "3 br". My mother (retired grandma) booked the getaway and didn't look closely at the confirmation that arrives via email NEXT DAY AFTER you confirm payment. Why would she need to inspect page 3 to see for sure if there is a BED in the 3rd BEDROOM. We called I.I. and explained that we had 6 people on this weeklong stay and paid for and expected 3 BEDS to sleep on. Not a pull-out couch for a week. Their position was that "technically" we have 3 bedrooms. They said the confirmation "explained" there was a pull-out couch and therefore we were "told" When I asked for a supervisor, he said" all getaways are final and I have Supervisory authority, you were told that there was a couch in the bedroom and technically you got what asked for." he refused to connect me to a Supervisor and stated nobody could do anything. When I asked if there was another resort nearby, he said "we're all sold out everywhere" without even a pause to check. I believe that was a direct lie. He then continued to throw it back in my face that I should have read the confirmation and seen that this wasn't an actual 3 bedroom unit. This phone conversation took place in the lobby of the Star Island Resort. I continually refused to accept the type of fraud tactic that was used and repeatedly stated that a pull-out couch does not make a room a bedroom. As I raised my voice in protest, other guests heard what our problem was. The Generall manager was called to the front desk and she approached me in the lobby. Her name was Blair. She unapologetically repeated what the I.I. person kept throwing in my face. "The confirmation said it was a pull-out couch and therefore that makes it a bedroom. doesn't matter what you expected the bedroom to be. Doesn't matter how many people you're traveling with or what your sleeping needs are. This is what you get when you stay here. Your problem is with I.I. for not telling you more clearly what our rooms are like and for not booking you in a resort with 3 actual bedrooms". I stated that I.I. is committing fraud and she said that since the rooms have a door, a closet and a pull-out couch, "legally" I.I. considers it a bedroom. She then stated that if I didn't leave the lobby, she would call security and have me removed from the property because she can't "build me a building with 3 bedrooms". I asked if she could at least have a bed put in place of the pull-out couch for the week. Immediately refused. Star Island and I.I. would rather deceive people and take their money, kick them off their property and force them into uncomfortable stays. It pretty much ruined my vacation and left the rest of my family feeling like we have to make due. We would never book a 3 bedroom 7night stay knowing that someone will be on a sleep-sofa. We could have saved money and booked 2br instead since most already have sleeper in the living room. We feel we were deceived and then told TOO BAD by I.I. and we never would have gone to Star Island if I.I. didn't sell it as a 3br. There are plenty of 3br resorts that I.I. has to choose from in and around Orlando and they shouldn't be deceiving people the way they did. Jay

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service, facilities, rooms absolutely no complaints”
Reviews.Author: mmyers18
Reviews.Content: Found this gem on eBay as a vacation rental. When we arrived we found that the location couldn't have been better with restaurants all over the place(TGI Fridays right by the entrance). The staff was very welcoming and easy check in. When we got to our condo we couldn't believe how much space we had. There were so many activities on the premises such as driving range, jet skis, pool, hot tub, and our favorite was karaoke ever single night at the pool side bar!! We had an absolute blast and have already talked about the group buying a timeshare here. Amazing time at an amazing place!

Reviews.Title: “Looks good on the web but feels shabby”
Reviews.Author: Gordo65
Reviews.Content: We are Marriott Vacation Club owners and like that level of quality. This resort has the same "Premier" rating as Marriott, so we thought it would be fine. It is definitely several steps below. We checked out as soon as we checked in. Decoration is garish, hallways and entryway to the unit smelled of disinfectant, mirrors on the wall of the bedroom (what's that about?), just felt kind of tacky. We left and went to a Marriott!

Reviews.Title: “As advertised. Met my expectations.”
Reviews.Author: Mel04330
Reviews.Content: The location was really great. The room itself was very nice. I saw 1 bug, which I thought was a cockroach, but was just a beetle. The suite was clean. The jacuzzi worked. All appliances were in good working order. The room looked very accurate to the pictures on the website. The pool was also nice but we did not spend much time there, or at the condo. There was a very friendly squirrel that followed us around the parking area and climbed my leg to get the nut I was offering out of my hand. Unfortunately it was unseasonably cold so we did not spend much time exploring around the condo. What we saw, we liked.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: acdc_10
Reviews.Content: We are owners at Star Island and love the place! There may be 'slightly' better time-share places admittedly (especially some of the Marriott venues), but this resort has everything we need and more. Villas are excellently appointed and the entire resort is very family friendly with fab pools. Location for Disney, Universal, Sea World etc.. is fantastic - nothing is too far away and there are no end of shopping malls in Orlando to choose from....

Reviews.Title: “Star Island Kissimmee”
Reviews.Author: bparker3937
Reviews.Content: We travel with 4 children ranging in age from 4 to 17. We stayed in a large master suite with an add on connected 2 bed room suite. Rooms were big and clean but decor and furnishings were outdated and worn. Deffiniately in need of new furnishings. W/D was nice to have for staying there 10 days though, cut down on packing. Grounds were also in need of additional up-keep but were clean. Childrens pool was closed due to maintenance issue for several days which caused the main pool to be heavily overcrowded. Staff was nice and accomidating though which helped improve the experiance. I think next time we will stay in a Disney resort though. Expense saved was not enough to off-set parking and additional travel headaches and costs.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great, but Definately Good Enough”
Reviews.Author: Eskot
Reviews.Content: We traded our timeshare through Interval International to stay here for a Dinseyworld Trip. While it isn't five star, it is definately a very good place. The suites we got were HUGE, with plenty of room for a family of four, and granted the decor was a little 'dated' but - again - it was all good enough. It is about a 5 minute drive straight into the parks - easy enough access - and in Orlando since we're out the door by 8 and not back until the parks close we didn't need much more than easy access and a great room. This might not be a "great resort", but it has a good pool for relaxing a day, friendly staff, enough 'little' things to make you comfortable, and again easy parks access.

Reviews.Title: “Definition of Cheap”
Reviews.Author: young_prof_tx
Reviews.Content: My parents are wyndham property owners and have raved of all the resorts they have stayed at around the country so when my husband needed to make a quick continuing education trip to Orlando we thought we would stay a few extra days. Upon arrival looked kinda like a cool property but we were skeptical b/c the area looked a little rundown. The front desk staff was nice but that was the last bit of service we received. As a busy professional I need to have access to email and the office. The Free wifi was free b/c it did not work except for a few minutes at a time! Disney is about a 10 - 15 minutes drive away which was nice but overall; the location, the last of service quality and the overall 'cheapness' of the resort - Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Activities for family, but cost extra and NOT DISABLE FRIENDY. Also poor texting / internet reception.”
Reviews.Author: Prims4Trees
Reviews.Content: This review is being written mostly to advise people that the resort does not have elevators. My mom is older and we were never told or read on the website that the resort is not very accomodating to those with physical disabilities. Even when we checked in, they could clearly see her needs, but still assigned us a room on the second floor. They also do not provide a service to help with luggage. If you use a wheel chair, getting around will be very difficult. I also could not recieve or send text messages, depending on the time of day and where I stood in the hotel room. So if you have to work on your trip, you may want to check if there is a designated area with cell and internet reception. Oh, and if you want extra towels on any days other than Tuesday or Thursdays, you must pay $9.00 per towel. I gave the hotel a poor rating becasue for the cost, it just does not add up to a resort or upper class place to stay. To me, it appeared to be an average family hotel without many frills. No elevators, no luggage service, no video game in rooms for kids, no activities for toddlers, the water pond at the entrace was a dark sickly green, and I was concered over the cleanliness of the pools.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent trip and service”
Reviews.Author: erica1231
Reviews.Content: This is my second time satying at Star Island and I have received nothing but excellent service from the staff. IMy only complaint is that the room we received did smell to it but we cleaned the room and used some Febreeze to get through that. Besides that we had an excellent trip.

Reviews.Title: “Special rate made this a good choice”
Reviews.Author: noahchild
Reviews.Content: PROS: Low Special Rate was well worth the accomodations. Stayed here before, and have always found the villas very clean. Convenient location to restaurants, Disney and other attractions. I would stay here again, and I have recommended to friends. CONS: PARKING!! Always a problem when you get back in the evening, Especially, handicap accessible!!...even though there was a notable improvement from the last stay. WIFI charge of $10 a day in the villas!! I think this is outrageous! I was told when I called there was WiFi availability in all villas, but no mention of charge...so I brought my laptop to check my email, etc, which I would not have done! I HATE being "nickeled and dimed", and want straight answers when asking these type of questions. I would have found it helpful to have a small convenience store on the premises (they obviously have the room for it).

Reviews.Title: “Are We All Writing About The Same Resort ? This Place Was Fine”
Reviews.Author: sattnan
Reviews.Content: Arrived Sarurday 10/3 for a quick 4 night get away. We booked a 1 bedroom (B side) the true one bedroom at Star island for 55.00 a night at condo direct. We were placed in Bldg 16, on the second floor. We must have gotten a remodeled room...it looked EXACTLY like the photos on Star Islands website...and we all know that never happens :) Full kitchen, washer dryer, dining table for 6, living room, balcony, free internet access, king size bed and jacuzzi tub. It was also bug free. Check in and out was quick. Some folks mentioned harrassing calls requesting that you book a timeshare tour.....we never received a one. The only thing preventing me from giving this 5 stars is the fact from our kitchen (not the bedroom or living room) we could hear EVERY word our neighrbors said thru the adjoining door. Lucky for us I didn't travel to Florida to stay in my room so it wasn't that big a deal. All in all....we will go back. I think that says a lot condsidering the number of choices one has in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the points!”
Reviews.Author: migamy
Reviews.Content: This place needs updated badly. Does not live up to the description in the Club Wyndham catalog.

Reviews.Title: “was not given the room that we had booked through a package deal”
Reviews.Author: blt77
Reviews.Content: was offered a package deal for 3 night stay and 3 day disney world tickets. Was suppose to be in a new unit, but when we arrived all the newer units were booked, so they put us in an older model that smelled like smoke and the airconditioning didn't work - well lets say it did work..to well. We FROZE! The staff was very helpful and that is why we are trying this one more time at the end of December 09. Again we booked the newer unit, 3 bedroom.....will post a review again after our stay. If we do get booted into an older model, then I will be reporting them to the Better Business Bureau. With so many options out there and with the economy being down, you would think places like these would go the extra mile for customer satisfaction.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but not great”
Reviews.Author: rainbowbrite3333
Reviews.Content: My inlaws own a time share here so we all went for a vacation. My husband and I checked in for hte fa mily and the front staff was rude and not very helpful at all. We finally got checked in and the condo was a bit outdated. It really needed an up date and a handy man to come in and fix a few broken things. But we had the two room condo, A and B. The water tasted and s melled horrible. It was better after you boiled it for drinking but you could still smell it after you ran the shower. There was mold in the bathtub. They did not supply you with much washing powders so we had to either go buy a 1 load thing for $2 or go to walmart and buy some inexpensive detergent that would have to be thrown away because we flew out and could not take it with us. The grounds were pretty and the pool was nice, until the staff kicked you out of hte hot tub about 10 m ins before it was closing time. Very rude people there. It wasn'ta horrible stay, jsut could use a little spruicing up and some friendlier staff.

Reviews.Title: “I was pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: chuchu42278
Reviews.Content: Ok. First, I must say that I was very skeptical of this resort because there were sa many mixed reviews on here. I have to say when I first entered the grounds it was pretty nice. It wasn't spectacular but it had a lot of character. The receptionists were very friendly and helpful and when i fist got there I actually a mini 1 bedroom with a small kitchen and no whirlpool. But JP, which I believe was a manager helped me to get an upgraded room. It was very booked that day but a room happened to be available. I really appreciated that from him. Once we entered the room, it was very nice, clean, nice whirlpool jacuzzi, the showers were nice and clean and I was pretty much happy about the room overall. I didn't really stay in the room too much though because we was out and about. However, on the last day of our trip we decided to relax at the resort and go to the pool there. It was really nice with the little waterfall in the middle. The grounds have free laundry or in your unit but we didn't have one inside of our unit. It was pretty quiet as well. The only thing was that the cable tv was a little staticy for some reason, not really clear. The decoration of the unit was a little old fashion or island type vibe but it was still clean and not rundown or anything. The tv was not updated like some of the other resorts but it wasn't really a problem. If you wanted to cook a full meal, you could do so since they provide you with everything you need other than the groceries. Overall I was pretty satisfied with my stay, had no problems at all, and there are a lot of activities and watersports on grounds but we were out painting the town :). Would I stay there again? Yes, I would. They also had free hi speed internet if you brought your own laptop. I'm not sure if they charge if you don't bring your own.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Enough Place, Probably won't stay again.”
Reviews.Author: countrymusicgirl
Reviews.Content: Location was great, units were everything they were supposed to be, very clean inside. Grounds could have been better maintained. Pool could definitely have been cleaner. All the other guests were extremely friendly when we visited the pools. DJ does a pretty good job, very entertaining. Probably will not stay here again, there are too many other, better choices. We are Wyndham owners and so even though my MIL said we were spoiled, I am used to the service and immaculate upkeep of the typical Wyndham property. (This one is not owned or managed by Wyndham, which the manager let me know real quick when I questioned the check-in procedures.) The saleswoman was so pushy I finally agreed to do a tour just to get our "parking" passes. Then she harassed us for two days because we didn't follow through. We were continually called even after we told them to take us off their list. I know, I should have unplugged the phone. We stayed at another Orlando location in April and simply told them upon check-in we didn't want to be bothered and they never called once. Just not necessary to be so rude and I will not deal with it on vacation again. We spend too much many to feel like we have to hide from Sales people.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: FortErie
Reviews.Content: We were actually at Star Island twice this year...around easter and in early June. First off the security is top notch compared to other timeshares I've stayed at. Only Diz World better. I did not see any loud parties or music. In fact it was quite serene at night. Pool area during the day was busy, but not overly crowded. Wife loved the decor of the rooms, I didn't. Rooms were clean and spacious. No bugs found. Gym seemed underused...of course why be in the gym during a beautiful Florida day? Staff was pleasant. A Diz resort it's not, however, it's much much less cost for the size.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation destination”
Reviews.Author: 1340jas
Reviews.Content: We took our main vacation in May, and nearly three weeks at Star Island. On arrival we were allocated an appartment on the top floor in one of the newer blocks. When we found that it had no washer and dryer, I asked to be moved to a unit which had them. The staff spent a few moments checking availablity and found us a newly refurbished appartment. There was no arguing they did it straight away. We had the A and B side in a block near to the main reception. The furnishings were of a really good quality with flat screen TV's in each room. We could hear the music from the bar at night ,if we were sat outside. Some of the singers should have been shot, but it was quite entertaining that they thought they could sing. This does not detract from our rating as we could shut the doors and windows and not hear them anymore. Overall Star Island is a very nice resort. When we visited in May the pools were never full during the day and the kids enjoyed the DJ and his music. The staff were always polite and would help in anyway they could. Being located just off the 192 meant we could walk to a number of restaraunts in the area, which include TGI Fridays, The Olive Garden, Chillis and Texas Longhorn. These were all within a miles walk. This meant Dad could have a few beers rather than drive. We were never pressurized into a time share talk, only asked once on arrival if we would be interested and said no. We would stay again on the condition we got the same appartment, we liked it so much.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: amykath07
Reviews.Content: This is not what I would consider to be a resort of the caliber that we?d expect for what we've paid as owners. Just some of the things that we were unsatisfied with were: The couch in the living room was so dirty I felt the need to take the extra set of sheets to cover it up before I felt comfortable sitting on it. Whirlpool tub in the room was not functional. My husband and I search specifically for resorts with rooms with jetted tubs. The jets we had barely had any pressure coming out if at all, and the motor sounded like it was going to die. Staff phone calls. I understand the need to do timeshare updates, but I don't think it's fair to call our room every 15 minutes beginning at 7AM to schedule one. (I'm not exaggerating either) Then, when we agreed to do one at Star Island, we got up early to do it, only to be called 15 minutes before our schedule time because the staff needed to reschedule. To stop the phone calls after that, we had to unplug the phone from the wall. The hot water took 15 minutes to get warm. Water pressure in one of the bathroom sinks was terrible, barely dripping out of the sink. The resort information booklet left on the coffee table had inappropriate sexual language written all over the inside of it. The comforters were extremely dirty to the point where I had to remove it completely from the bed. Our room was too far away for the "free" wireless internet access. We got a booster from the front desk and it still wouldn't give us a signal The staff was less than helpful in this situation as well, just saying "well it should work now." Our laptop picked up wireless signals at all other "hot spots" during the trip except for when we tried to connect at the resort We have been to several Wyndham resorts over our time as owners that we have enjoyed including Grand Desert, the newer resort in Myrtle Beach, Palm Aire in Ft. Lauderdale, as well as one in Williamsburg. I have NEVER been so disappointed in myself for buying timeshare as I was during this past visit to Star Island. I will say the pool area was nicely cared for, but it was very obvious that was the only area that was being maintained well. Again, I am not trying to say Wyndham is terrible. I just am very disappointed that for my 1 vacation a year I got much less than what I would have expected. We did pay a lot of money for this ownership and I would like to think it gets me something a little better than what we received. Honestly, I would have rather stayed at a Holiday Inn Express. I did send my concerns to the resort staff and they replied, denying the problems with the water and the hot tub and even placed blame on us that we started the jets before the water reached the top. Believe me, we did NOT do this, we have friends who own a bed and breakfast with these same style tubs and we have always been instructed NEVER to do that, why would we start now? They sent us a complimentary 2-night stay only valied for a few months and only when there was free space available. I will say, the pool area is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Again- No Way”
Reviews.Author: texas3131
Reviews.Content: Star Island- let me put it this way: the vast majority of the people that Star Island seemed to attract were not people that I would spend time with socializing. Many of us wished that a family member had not booked us at Star Island, because we were all pleased with the resort we had been staying at prior to moving to Star Island. As it pertains to the facilities: 1. We had two condos side-by-side, "A" and "B". A had a bedroom with 2 beds, kitchenette, and a TV room with a sofa bed. B had a full kitchen, sofa bed in the living room, dining room table, master bedroom with jacuzzi tub, separate bathroom with shower, toilet and sink. Neither bathroom had towel hooks on the bathroom doors to hang a towel or bathrobe. A washer/dryer combination was available to both in the main entryway. 2. It was decorated such that the first thing I thought of was, "Wow, this is probably what the Sopranos first apartment looked like." It had "cheezy" 80s/early 90s Italian motif furniture and there was pink and maroon everywhere. It was soooooo ugly. The only thing modern were the appliances in the kitchen. 3. There were 2 elevators in our building. One was broken the entire week of our stay. 4. Much of the gym equipment was waiting for repair. 5. The pool had too many people in it for the size of it much of the time. 6. In general the facilities need an upgrade. 7. Annoying marketing and event messages EVERYDAY on the telephone. 8. The outside bar that is part of the main building wouldn't stop serving the drunk people who were loud and obnoxious. 9. The sofa beds both had broken springs/attachments. One person had to take their mattress and put it on the floor for the entire week as they were concerned about falling through the bed. 10. Due to the heat and humidity, we appreciated having the washer and dryer because we were having to change clothes 2-3 times a day. 11. The people working at Star Island were friendly. 12. It was close to decent restaurants, shopping including Wal-Mart and Publix, and an easy commute to Disney and to/from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience. Highly Recommend.”
Reviews.Author: STLTravelDave
Reviews.Content: I just completed a trip to Orlando, FL where I stayed in 3 places - Star Island Resort, Westgate Blue Tree Resort and Lake Eve Resort. Will post reviews on all 3. Star Island is located south of Disney just off 192. It is owned by Wyndham and was formerly a Fairfield property. Checkin experience was fine. I got a great deal for this stay from a timshare owner on eBay. Complex is large with 20+ buildings. Everything seemed to be in great shape. There was a significant storm one night and a landscaping company arrived first thing in the morning to clean up the downed branches. Room was unbelievable. Stayed in a 1 BR 1 BA unit. Note that at most Wyndham Resorts the A side is the better side. Star Island is the oppositie in that our B side unit had a huge living area, fully equipped kitchen, W/D, huge king size bed, jacuzzi tub in bedroom, separate shower, 2 sinks. Small balcony. Everything was in like new condition. Pool was great. Fitness room was disappointing as much of the equipment was out of service -- which seemed odd for such a nice place. Daily kids activities were great as well. Free internet access. Timeshare sales people called but weren't overly pushy. Of the three places I stayed in Orlando, this is tied with Lake Eve Resort as the best. Lake Eve has a better location on International Drive and this resort is further south. But if you can get a good deal on this resort, I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “4 star resort , 1 star entertainment”
Reviews.Author: PhoenixsunPhoenix
Reviews.Content: Possibly the very worst karaoke show that I have ever been to! The karaoke dj came strolling in late. Evidently the resort allows outsiders and employees to use their amenities. If I pay my good money to stay there on vacation, I shouldn't have to wait for the locals and/or employees to finish singing so I can have my turn. The dj sings more songs than the guests do. He also eats and drinks at the bar throughout the show. Leaves the stage unattended, when a singer has a problem with a song or microphone, he's not anywhere in sight. Some of the employees that congregated their after their work shift were having a conversation using the F word, something I shouldn't have to listen to with their profanity. The dj has no separated monifor, you have to share his laptop screen to sing. When someone wants to sign up, they have to wait for the singer to finish their song to key you in, and that's only if he happens to see your hand raised to sing up... he doesnt' use sign up sheets. Small song selection. The book lists artists by first name and last name, which means you have to look in both places. He has no wireless microphones and one time there was a duet singing and the dj was standing on both of the microphone cords. One woman thought it was her turn to sing and when she went up to the stage, the dj told her it wasn't her turn and then he selected his next song for the dj to sing!!! To top it off his brother who set up his equipment was wearing those hiphop style pants where half of his boxer shorts a** was hanging out everytime he bent over in front of us. It was really strange to sit in a bar at a four star resort and feel insecure with my surroundings. We deinitely will not return here. We check out the entertainment at quite a few resorts and this one rates at the bottom of the heap. What a shame that the management must be totally oblivious to what it going on in their own resort. Oh, but what a sweet deal it must be for the dj. Buyer beware!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: HollyGNewJersey
Reviews.Content: We had a relaxing and wonderful stay at the Star Island Resort. Our timeshare was spacious, clean and comfortable. The workout room was fantastic, as was the pool, hot tub and tennis courts. The timeshare was near Target, Walmart and TGIFridays. Best yet, there was a Krispy Kreme just down the road. It was a little farther from Disney that we had bargained, but we allowed a good 20 minutes to get to the parks. I would definitely recommend Star Island Resort!

Reviews.Title: “Don't need to leave the resort”
Reviews.Author: IndianaLoveVacations
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Star Island for the first time during Spring Break. If you are looking for a family oriented place with plenty of activities to keep everyone entertained, this is your place. There were activities going on all day and into the evening (most of them free, too). We had a blast. The condos are very nice. If you request the one bedroom (which is what we had), there is a full kitchen and washer/dryer. If you request the two bedroom, you will not have the washer/dryer or "full" kitchen but mini kitchen. So be careful. However, if you get the three-bedroom, you'll have it all. The hotel service was superb. They were very accomodating. I would definitely return again to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: traceymarie81
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Star island last year for a week,and it was execllant the service was great the people were very friendly and all of the staff with whom i encountered,as far as an elevator as someone had menchioned in another review ,They do have an elevator,so i have no idea what thats about,theres one that goes up to the floors all of the rooms from the ground,so obviously this person eaiher missed that or stayed elsewhere..? The grounds there are beautiful and they layout is great..its very safe and secure there and very comfortable,,the rooms were great, i did not need a flat panel tv as someone else had said,to complete my stay,i dont think i would want to be spending alot of time watching tv staying at beautiul resort like this, the master bedroom is wonderful i loved how the whirlpool is right by the bed,we had the most wonderful time there,we loved it so much we are going back this june,,as well as every other year. It is a wonderful beautiful place to stay, i would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “NOT PERFECT, BUT BEAUTIFUL, CLEAN AND SAFE”
Reviews.Author: orrielynn
Reviews.Content: the top important things to me: cleanliness, safety, non smoking, discounted price. this resort met all these requirements. the room(s)-they call them villas-are immaculate. we had a two, or three BR villa, depending how you look at it. they called it three. we essentially had two villas, with a door between them what they call a lock off. you could rent either side or both. we were four people (DH, DD, DD's best friend, and i). and my father had considered coming, so we opted for the 3 BR. he didnt come though my dad. if he had, it would have worked, but it would have been a little tight. the side where DH and i stayed, was absolutely beautiful. a large bedroom with a king size bed. a lovely, large bathtub, with a jacuzzi. i used the jacuzzi only once, i am not really into a jacuzzis. the controls to it were not reachable from the tub. it was on a timer, but i would have liked to have stoppd the jacuzzi sooner, but without getting out of the tub. the sink , mirror and stall shower, were in the bedroom, which was fine. but that left the bathroom alone, and it was tiny, with just the toilet. it was not the pleasantest place. if you were clautrophobic, you would stay away. there was another bathroom in this side of the villa, a larger one with a stall shower. this one was also small. we had a big living room and a full kitchen, including a dishwasher and cabinets. and they include just about everything you need to cook: dishes, pots pans, etc. the living room had a convertible couch. if it were just DH and daughter and i, we would have taken thIs part of the lockoff. more than enough room for us. i cant recall what they called the other side. one bedroom? also not a place for the claustrophobic. a small bedroom with two full size beds, TV and closet. next to it is a room with a convertible couch. this room also had a sink, mini fridge, microwave, cooking and eating utensils. i guess this serves as the kitchen and living room. (last year we stayed at westgate in a studio. it was wonderful. we didnt have a full kitchen, but we had lots more room than this side of the lockoff. let me say that i am not complaining, since we had both sides at star island. just dispensing information, so you could see if you like the place.) not sure how the cost compares between the two lock offs. (also at westgate, our villa was a lockoff, and we didnt have the other side. when you first entered the villa, there was a huge hallway, and the people next door-and i think their visitors-made a lot of noise in this shared area. at star island, you walk right into your villa-there is no hallway.) this side had the largest bathroom, cause it included the tub. as bathrooms can go, its still small. all villas are nonsmoking (important criteria for me-i have asthma.) smoking is allowed 20 or more feet from the villas.) having two 12 yo girls wth me, i was especially concerned about this. i wanted to be somewhere i could feel comfortable with their walking in the resort alone. and i did. now for the problems. i made my reservations online. i got a discounted price in return for sitting through a timeshare presentation. i am not sure how the price compares without the timeshare. we paid $100 a night. ok this is not a problem, however it may have lead to problems. i called ahead to confirm my reservation. i spoke to two employees and neither could find my reservation. (can you imagine my panic? plus, it wasnt just my family, we had my daughters friend. if we had to, my family and i could hang our hats any old place for just one night. however i wouldnt feel right doing that with someone elses child.) then i called the friends dad, he accessed my email and confirmed my reservation with star island. i called the resort again, and this time they found it. what relief. except, when i physically arrived at the resort, again they couldnt find it. and they had no idea who the person was who had. and they didnt recognize the confirmation number she had given me. (i felt like i was in the twilight zone.) they offered us the 3 bedroom villa i said we were reserved for. and suggested that we wait till the morning to straighten out the reservation. i was a little concerned about this, but remembered the person to who had confirmed my reservation. so i figured i belonged there and wasnt going to be charged the regular nighly rate. as i said above the rooms were beautiful. i quickly accessed my email, and saw what created the problem. they had mispelled our surname, using an "M" instead of an "N".i called the front desk and told them that, and lo and behold, they found our reservation. altho i was speaking to the same person i had checked in with, i received no apology. if not actually rude, the front desk employees werent the most pleasant. perhaps i was a bit remiss in not bringing a copy of the confirmation, or at least noticing the misspelling of my name. but am i wrong in thinking they should have looked it up under a different letter. and i believe the only ways to search for a reservation, was through its number or the first name. not by address or telephone number or company you made the reservation with.

Reviews.Title: “Best Retreat of the Year!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SOCCERJEWLS2006
Reviews.Content: This is our families 10th year vacationing at star island, we are so lucky to have found this vacation spot. It is the most relaxing && refreshing enviornment. It's like be on a cruise but on land. Our most high points are listening to the DJ Scott in the afternoon by the pool listening to him sing and play his trumpet && keyboard. In the nightlife at star island we enjoy going to karaoke with DJ Dustin. There are activites all throughout the day for all ages. The landscaping is always nice && they are always working on it. Everyone from room service to the front desk to the bartenders && the DJ's are very personable and great to around. I HIGHLY RECCOMEND THIS RESORT TO EVERYONE ESPECIALLY FAMILIES. :) :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway!!!”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaParent
Reviews.Content: My family and I visited this Resort during Spring Break. We were very surprised to see how beautifully the landscape and resort were when we arrived. The staff were very friendly and check-in was problem free. We stayed in a one bedroom condo and found that it suited our needs for our length of stay. The kitchen was stocked with the utensils, dish detergent & other things that we needed. The stacked washer & dryer had complimentary detergent for our laundry and worked properly. Our balcony was situated right by a relaxing pond and was very relaxing. This resort was surrounded by restaurants and a grocery store and we found this to be very convenient. We also discovered that the resort was only about 10 minutes away from Disney World. The only drawback I found was that the resort didn't offer complimentary shuttle to the theme parks. Transportation to and from the theme parks would have put the "icing on the cake" for this resort. However, it still met our overall needs. I would definitely want to stay at this resort again upon my arrival in Kissimee. It was truly our home away from home! Georgia Parent

Reviews.Title: “Great location for area attractions”
Reviews.Author: rjandmj
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and our 2 daughters ages 11 and 13 spent Spring Break at this condo resort. The usual sales pitch was given upon check in but no pressure after that. We stayed in a 3 bedroom unit which consisted of a Master Suite with a 2 bedroom lock off which was actually a one bedroom with 2 full beds and a kitchenette/den with a sleeper sofa. Every sleeping room had a flat screen TV as did the living room so no arguments there. The unit's "contemporary design" with accompaning furnishings were somewhat dated and tired. However it was quite functional. We did Sea World this trip which this resort is only 15 miles from. The resort is on Hwy 192 and with the renovations this makes for a great daytime stroll and has numerous restaurants as well as grocers. The pools were adequate with the usual DJ and steamed hot dogs. Lots of space for sunbathing and the daily activities were predictable but well organized.

Reviews.Title: “just fine”
Reviews.Author: deannamort
Reviews.Content: my family and i stayed at this property for a week in late march. I can honestly say our room was clean and well kept. Although there were a few issues the housekeeping crew assisted rapidly. the activities at the pool were enjoyable for our 8 year old. we did not attend any of the evening parties

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful resort with great front end staff”
Reviews.Author: Pounette166
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Star Island Resort from March 1-8, 2009. The resort is very well maintained and as you drive in, you are welcomed by fountain and flowers bed all around the drop off area. Very pretty. Lobby is spacious and check in was quick. We had a small issue with the unit assigned to us and Matt, the front desk rep along with PJ the manager on duty were quick to assist us and provided us a unit that truly made us happy. We were in building 18, which is not located by the pool - but this is what we wanted, as it is a very quiet area. We had unit AB, which is the largest one available, comprising of 2 full bedroom (one with king size bed and double jacuzzin and walk-in shower). Full kitchen with lots of space all the ustensile, cookware and pots that you might need. Appliances are full size and include washer-dryer (stack type) and worked perfectly. I made many many margaritas with the blender supplied. The unit also had another full bathroom and another smaller room like a den and had a total of 3 TV and a balcony. Very very beautiful and extremely quiet. The only bad thing, not a resort fault, but the last 2 nights we had very very noisy neighbors who played loud music at 1:00pm. But we called security and the matter was very quickly addressed and resolved. The resort is a 'gated' community which add to the security of the guests. The pool is wonderful and there is a lot of space to sit and there is a DJ to entertain. The gym is beautiful, with TV and excellent machine, although the ventilation was very poor and it became very hot very fast as you workout. The main change room has a dry sauna and a steam sauna et also include a big hot tub. It is very beautiful and spacious, with lots of towels and space to keep your stuff. Check out was great, although I was a bit surprise that we were not given a final statement at check out to show that we owed nothing. In retrospect, I think that I would probably insist next time that something be given to me, to ensure that no amount will be charged without my consent. But I would highly recommend this resort and again a big thank you to Matt and JP (I sure hope I got their name right) for all their help at check-in time. That personal service was truly appreciated. We are definitely planning to return.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience with manager (Doug)”
Reviews.Author: lovely101
Reviews.Content: I have traveled all over the world to various hotels and never once have I had such a bad experience. I have been to several Marriott's which I love, as well as various Sheraton and Wyndam properties. This property is a decent property but fairly old looking. The only thing that I enjoyed was the karaoke. Very amusing as well as entertaining. Loved it, Loved it!! However, after I returned from my trip I recieved several charges on my credit card that were not authorized by me. I contacted the manager Doug and he informed me that there was a cleaning expense. (Well why am I paying maintenance fees?) I think that they just wanted to steel money! Buyers be aware. I am filing a law suit because it is the principle of the matter. Hopefully they will learn there lesson not to do this to anyone else. I would not recommend this resort to my dog. Although I had an unfortunate situation the rooms were pretty roomy. But that didn't matter once I recieved that surprising bill.

Reviews.Title: “Large Units ,close to all activities”
Reviews.Author: Robynsok
Reviews.Content: Place was nice decor was typical Florida, florals and pinks etc. We had a 3 bedroom unit which I think was a lockoff unit. Tv in every room plenty of privacy not bad at all. Kitchen lacked storage space and the a/c was a little touchy but otherwise it wass nice. Resort itself had plenty of activities , a spa , food, etc.

Reviews.Title: “If not for the room...”
Reviews.Author: MGtravelALOT
Reviews.Content: This appeared to be a very, very nice place to stay. We had time to kill between checkout from previous lodgings to check-in at Star Island Resort, so they allowed us access to the pool facilities. In the few hours we were there, we were quite impressed. Lovely pool area, helpful staff, even the guests were friendly!! They announced activities and events numerous times for children while we were there, so it appears to be a very family oriented resort. We booked through a travel membership club and had requested a full kitchen. When we arrived, our room only had a miniature microwave and mini-fridge. Because it was race week the resort was booked so we couldn't switch to a unit with a kitchen. Although the room was not suitable for our needs, it appeared to be clean and in good shape. Any complaints we had concerning our reservations were not with Star Island Resort, but with the travel membership club through whom we booked!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Star Island”
Reviews.Author: freebyrd9
Reviews.Content: We traded our timeshare to stay at Star Island. I too was a little worried as I read some bad reviews after I booked the vacation. We were volunteering in Tampa at Super Bowl week, so we had to drive to Tampa everyday, it was well worth the drive staying at Star Island. Sure the accomadation look a little out dated but they were fine.(most time shares furnishings look outdated to me anyway). The resort was beautiful, lots to do, we were pleasantly surprised. We had no problems all the staff was very freindly. We had a small pond outside our room off the back deck, it was great, the ducks came up to see us everytime we were out there. We will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Would visit the Star again!”
Reviews.Author: ptmb
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Resort. Star Island is like a little world onto its own. A private road in off a busy corridor and you come to a resort on an island away from the hussle and bustle. We liked the guarded entrance which makes you feel safe and secure in your own little world. Check in was fast and smooth. The villas are three stories so if you are not on the main floor you may have to carry your luggage up a flight or two (be prepared, or request main floor if you can) . Villas are very quiet, soundproofing is great, you can't tell anyone is in the same building as yourself. Our one bedroom villa is very large and spacious. Balcony with walkout from living room and bedroom. Very large jacuzzi partially surrounded by mirrors, shower stall on it's own, double sink area and then the toilet in a small room for privacy. Otherwise, the bath, shower, sink area are all in the bedroom. Bed is partially surrounded by mirrors, lots of drawer and closet space for two people for a one weeks holiday. Kitchen is well stocked for cooking and large dining room with space for six people. I liked the fact that we had a dishwasher, washer and dryer which cuts down on work. Spacious living room has comfortable furniture and with the walkout balcony that also has table and chairs helps to expand your living space. The pools are beautiful and they have a great area for children to play and swim, even sandy playground with umberellas for parents to sit under. Lots of programs during the day including making your own stuffed toy for a keepsake. Every night there is something such as a barbeque, pizza night, Italian food night, etc and they have karokee for people who love to sing or just listen, and of course they have happy hour. Something for everyone. There would be no reason you would not feel comfortable and safe in this well organized resort. Would recommend this place in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “elegant and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: pegiot
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Star Island because they offered unbeatable rates if we listened to a Time Share presentation. I was interested because you actually get to stay in the resort you are touring. We stayed in a 1 bedroom unit. It was HUGE. There was a 2-person whirlpool in the master bedroom with marble floors and Roman columns. Everything was tastefully decorated (although they are in the process of remodeling all of the rooms) and the unit included a full kitchen and washer/dryer combo. We had a private 8x16 balcony with French doors from both the living room and the bedroom. Everything was very clean and they even folded the towels up like on cruise ships. We kept the doors open all night to listen to the fountains in the pool outside our building. There were 2 big heated pools, lots of tennis courts, and a spa where you could get a massage, waxing, etc. The timeshare presentation wasn't pushy and we didn't purchase a unit, but we really enjoyed our stay and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort and Even Getting Better!”
Reviews.Author: SDSDMS
Reviews.Content: My Family of 3 stayed in a 1 Bedroom unit during the week of Thanksgiving. The unit was huge, very well kept and clean. We walked right up at 4pm on our check-in day and were in the unit within minutes. The resort staff was very nice whenever we interacted with them (which wasn't much since we didn't have any problems at all during our stay). The pools were both heated so despite the somewhat cool weather during the week we were able to swim without any trouble at all of being cold. The resort is starting to under go a MAJOR renovation. It appears Wynham has purchased most if not all of the buildings at this time and have really taken over the managment of the property. All buildings and units are going to be renovated over the next two years. We walked through a model unit and it was just beautiful with granite counter tops, all new flooring, couches, beds, fixtures, linens, a brand new kitchen and flat screen tv's thorughout the unit (3 flat screens in the 3 bedroom units!). There are also plans in the future to build a lazy river as well. Once the resort is fully renovated it will be even more amazing. I would absolutely recommend Star Island and Resort and can't wait to come back with the famly once the renovations are completed.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy!”
Reviews.Author: familyof6Lansdale_PA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week with our four young children. Our place was HUGE! 4 tv's, 2 bathrooms, a jacuzzi in the master bedroom, free wireless internet etc. Everything was very clean and the kitchen was well stocked. Towel exchange with housekeeping was a pleasant surprise midweek. I have nothing bad to say about this place. We saved so much money by eating breakfast in our room and packing lunches to bring to the parks each day. I would highly recommend this place to any family looking for a place to stay in Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable experience!”
Reviews.Author: michelleluvsmax
Reviews.Content: My family owns a timeshare with Wyndham. We stayed at Star Island for 6 nights and seven days during the Thanksgiving holidays. We rented two -two bedroom suites. We were very pleased. It was very comfortable. We were a little uneasy after some of the reviews on this website, but we didn't experience any of the problems others did. As a matter of fact we didn't experience any problems what-so-ever. We would definately stay here again. It is the perfect location!

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: lovindisney4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Star Island through an exchange with Interval. We had a 1 bedroom suite (for 2 adults and 2 kids) which was great except the sofa bed. The mattress was maybe 4 inches thick and very uncomfortable - especially if sleeping on it for a week. the water pressure in the shower was PATHETIC! It would take 15 minutes just to rinse your hair... We needed 1 extra night, so they moved us to a minisuite in building 22. The smell of smoke was AWFUL!!!! As a person with allergies, it was hard to make it through the night - you could hardly breathe as the smoke smell was SO bad! The noise level in that building was terrible as well - we hardly got any sleep. The sofa bed had springs that were coming out of the top!!! My kids loved the pool area. They do have a lot of "fun nights" with inexpensive food from TGI Friday's that we enjoyed. We probably would stay there again, but never in a minisuite!

Reviews.Title: “Service needs a helping hand”
Reviews.Author: yank2441
Reviews.Content: I am currently on vacation at Wyndham Resort's Star Island. I am the son of a time share owner at Wyndham resorts. I don't expect a whole lot out of a trip when it does not cost me anything but I do expect reasonable living quarters. So far our room has flooded (due to the condo's maintenance), we were refused a switch of rooms, when we asked for a shop vac and fan to dry the floor they did not get them to us, wet carpet, wet bed clothes, wet clothes, wet feet, and pretty much wet everything with an inch of water standing in one of the bed rooms at the on set of the flood. The fridge is now leaking water on our food. We have not reported this yet but I don't see this as a priority as my carpet is still wet. We were called by the resort via telephone to do a survey on the room and resort in exchange for some disney dollars but because they messed up we ended up wasting an hour of our precious vacation for nothing. Our vacation has still been wonderful but I would not pay or ask my parents to waste their time share here in the future. I am very disappointed with the service that they provide for owners or the guests of owners. I give this resort two thumbs down!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Alyssasmom
Reviews.Content: We purchased a "sample" timeshare from Fairfield Resorts (originally we had seen a timeshare presentation in Atlantic City and we were basically forced/convinced/suckered whatever you want to call it, into buying this sampler) Anyway we used a portion of our points for there (ended up losing the rest of them b/c we couldn't use them w/ in the year) anyway stayed at Star Island. Nice resort! Clean they, staff was friendly at the resort. Since it was sampler points we had to listen to another speal....it was very hard for them to accept that we were not interested in buying a timeshare! Finally they did and we enjoyed lots of time at Universal Studios and Adventure Isand. The friendlys within walking distance from the resort was very nice! The pool at the resort was wonderful and clean!

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic place!”
Reviews.Author: Vickers43
Reviews.Content: Returned two weeks ago from a two week holiday at the Star Island Resort. We are actually owners at this resort and this was our first stay there. We were a party of 6 and booked the whole suite. I was a bit apprehensive before arriving after reading so many negative reviews about the resort, all I can say is ignore them the place is great, My 13 yr old son loved it and even though he is mad about the theme parks, somedays he didn't want to leave the resort and just wanted to go to the pool or hang around the lakes feeding the wildlife - which is everywhere and absolutely lovely! The suites are very spacious and comfortable, I read on one review some stated furniture very hard, well sorry they must have been sat on the table and the not the chairs, as everything was very comfortable, my mother-in-law stated that she had never slept so well and we had put her in the sofa-bed! I would highly recommend this resort and enjoyed myself that much we are booking to go back next year.

Reviews.Title: “BUYER BEWARE”
Reviews.Author: travelingdva
Reviews.Content: After spending 2 hours with the sales person I purchased one of their loving timeshares. I asked many questions during the process and was given quick answers. One question was why am I being given a week versus selecting the week I want to vacation. I was told that the week given was just for deed purposes and I can travel anytime. When I questioned further I was always given an answer that sounded good. Well the deed is in and I have questions and no one will return a phone call. I was given the 49th week of the year. Two weeks before Christmas, I would never travel at that time of the year. And while I'm told I can come anytime there is little doubt that I will ever stay in the room 18 of building 22 I will always be in a different room. I was told also at time of purchase should I ever wish to sale they could provide me with a list of agents who could assist. Owner services denies there being a list. And Mr. Hughes from sales has still not returned my call after leaving 3 messages. So while the place is lovely beware often you are told things that don't pan out later. I loved my stay at Star Island however will attempt to sale my investment due to the lack of concern by owner services and the sale team. Don't sign on the bottom line unless you ask all your questions and have a clear understanding of the fast talk you are given. They don't want you to leave the room and think about things they want you to sign right then and there. So after 4 months I will sell my timeshare for what I still owe on it not making a profit. I just want out. I should have stuck with my first instinct and gone to Disney to preview their timeshare package.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: BlessedV
Reviews.Content: My spouse & I visited Wyndham Star Island for a time share presentation & it wasn't bad at all. We signed up for a 18 month trial period, which is just OK. The resort is beautiful & although we only slept there, there is a lot to do on the resort. You need a car to get to Disney & Universal, but its not a far drive. Stayed in a 1bdrm, which wasn't that big, but very comfortable for 2. There are several restaurants nearby, TGIF & Olive Garden are very close.

Reviews.Title: “Star Island is like staying with the Golden Girls”
Reviews.Author: L0ngIslandFamily
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 just spent a week at Star Island. It was clean, but definitely dated. We had a 2 bedroom lockout, which was huge. 2 baths, 4 tvs, and a bed for everyone.Windam just bought it over, and will begin updates soon. Do not stay in any buildng near the pool. The music, although fun at 2pm, is very loud at 10pm.! Request building 19. It has elevators,(not all do) and is away from the pool. The staff is very nice. We called for some extra pots, and they arrived within 10 minutes. Realize if you call for supplies after hours, you will have to wait. I see a lot of complaints about this matter, but be resonable. If you call for extra pillows at 11pm, you will wait. The pool area was very nice. 2 big pools. Ample chairs, not much shade. This is not a destination resort, but very nice housing for all the Disneyworld visitors. By 9am the place is empty, everyone is at the parks. We stayed behind and had the pool to ourselves, plus the DJ, bartender, and two ladies from Califronia, who just baked in the sun everyday. It is a timeshare. No housekeeping. Make your own beds, do your own laundry. Well stocked kitchen. We saved $$$ by eating breakfast and dinners in the room. Grocery store around the block. You do need to rent a car.

Reviews.Title: “Will not visit again”
Reviews.Author: traveller62897
Reviews.Content: While the photos available on line are exceptional, we found the accommodations to be anything but exceptional. We were staying there on a time share exchange and requested adjoining units. We were told that we would be accommodated but found the opposite upon arrival. We were told that they could not make arrangements for us since they had overbooked. On top of the initial failure, we did not have access to many of the amenities offered by larger rooms since we were given two smaller rooms in separate buildings. The walk past the overflowing garbage dumpsters in a narrow walkway were not enticing each evening as we tried to return to our "suite". In addition to the garbage, the linens were soiled and the bathrooms less than cleaned with hair and dirt behind doors and in the shower. While the staff was very responsive and helpful, you hate to have to deal with these issues shortly after checking in. They also only provide one free towel exchange if you stay for seven days or more. Anything more frequent can cost you $7 or more. This is not the worst place I have ever stayed but it certainly warranted a comparison. By the way, if I hear Soulja Boy one more time, I am going to scream. The DJ played it incessantly every night from somewhere near the pool-side that our room overlooked while we were there...6 nights!

Reviews.Title: “Pink, pink and more pink”
Reviews.Author: Wordbabe
Reviews.Content: This early-'90s-era condo resort has fabulous curbside appeal at check-in, but once inside, the Star's brightness fades. The pink-on-pink-on-pink decor (walls, carpet, furnishings), rundown pool area and unkempt grounds are just begging to be updated. The resort has a lot going on -- pools, bars, tennis courts, activities, etc., -- but none of it is done well. The place felt dirty. If you're being lured by the discount deal in exchange for listening to a 90-minute timeshare presentation, re-think that plan. 90 minutes became 3 hours and still no end in sight. Additionally, they weren't selling the resort itself as much as they were selling the ability to exchange your time for other resorts. The room itself was spacious with a nice balcony, but again, needed just a little extra to make it work. The shower had only a soap dish, so all shampoos, etc., had to be put on the floor. No hooks for towels. Window blinds were broken, lamps didn't work. The fitness facility was for "16 and over," but we saw 10 and 12-year-olds on the equipment, unsupervised. There was no attendant in sight. Overall, a 2 star experience. Would we go back? No.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in this Resort”
Reviews.Author: digita1world
Reviews.Content: This Resort was a big disappointment. It looks beautiful and looks great inside however the furniture was as hard as a rock. The rooms can be connected so they are labeled A and B and are side by side so you share the walkway up to your door. After one night of uncomfortable sleep and drunk neighbors who were out on their front porch from 12:00 till 2:00 am in the morning talking loud and laughing. I called Management but it took them two hours to come up and tell them to quiet it down. I had enough and had to go stay at an Extended Stay Hotel which was much more comfortable where I could sit on the couch without being in pain. At Star Island the sofa bed mattress had springs coming through it. Everything inside the room was hard as a rock to sit on including the bed. We had a very small refrigerator and sink when we requested a full kitchen. The pool was located on the other end of the resort. I have Lupus and let them know that and requested to be close to the pool so I could keep an eye on my kids. I was told no problem but when I got there was located as far away from the pool that someone could be. I don't expect much from a resort but at least have comfortable furniture to sit on.

Reviews.Title: “Okay stay at the Star Island”
Reviews.Author: NearPerfect9
Reviews.Content: Fiance and I went to meet his parents there, who were staying in a time share. The rooms are decorated in a brightly colored island motif... a la the Golden Girls. The bathrooms were nice. I wasn't impressed with the hallways/walkways of the resort. They're just spraypainted concrete, and they need touched up at that. The pool is average. A bit overcrowded while we were there - rows and rows of lawnchairs - but, the pools were clean. We got deep tissue sports massages at the spa - they did a good job. The womens' locker room is nice. The gym is decent, but not adjacent to the locker rooms. Overall, the guest rooms are decent, and I would stay here again if I had the opportunity. Not quite sure why it's considered a "resort" - other than the above-average pool, they don't have too much of anything that a hotel doesn't have.

Reviews.Title: “Many Stars for Star Island”
Reviews.Author: pattijIllinois
Reviews.Content: Star Island was a friendly place to visit. We had a three bedroom deluxe in building 25 and were very happy with the accommodations. The Beds were comfortable, with nice linens. The rooms clean, a little outdated in the decor, but very liveable. They were experiencing computer problems when we checked in but handled it very quickly. A problem with our refrige was handled within minutes with a call to the front desk. The balcony overlooked a courtyard and tennis court, a ceiling fan was a plus. Our balcony was right next to the other units which could have been a pain, but the unit was only occupied the last night we were there. They had a nice pool area that was meticuously maintained throughout the day. We never had a problem with finding a chair. Towels were available at the pool and worked on the honor system, you sign them out you bring them back. A good deal.They policed the pool area and never saw evidence of pool phantoms. People who place towels on all the prime spots and vanish. (Not so with Wyndhym in Ocean Walk : ( Daytona) Great Bar service with 2 for 1 drafts and $3 well drinks most of the afternoons. They also ran a happy hour in the upstairs bar in the evening. They had a great DJ, Fred, in the afternoons, who was also the live entertainment one night. We almost avoided the sales pitch, but were then asked if we would fill out a survey for $25. The survey came with a salesman who didn't want t o sell us Star Island but their other property in Lake Buena Vista. We were not interested and he didn't pressure us. That would be my only complaint. Wyndhym doesn't seem to care about the property and could make some decorating changes that people would find more pleasing to the eye. The reort is managed by a diferent time share company.The grounds were beautiful, and a pleasure to walk. The lake is not a selling point for this resort as it is not swimable but may be fine for fishing. My husband and children enjoyed the driving range in the late morning. $2 for a bucket of balls that mostly landed in the lake. The Biggest plus bout this resort, other than location is the friendliness of the staff. Everyday the same people doing a great job making us feel relaxed and welcome!

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints Here”
Reviews.Author: MAMCS
Reviews.Content: We exchanged through Interval for a week at Star Island from 6/21/08 - 6/28/08. After reading some of the reviews, I was a bit apprehensive - wondering if I had made a bad choice. I can now safely say that I had not. Our entire experience with Star Island was very enjoyable. We had a 3 bedroom suite with a balcony overlooking the tennis courts and playground. Everything was extremely clean and in good working order and we had absolutely no complaints with the facilities on hand. Our suite was located in Building #25 and we found it to be very quiet and had plenty of room for our 2 kids (2 and 5) to run around and play in. Yes, this is a time share condo and if you go in expecting daily maid service or someone to carry your bags you will be disappointed - so don't expect it!!. Some people have complained about the parking - we were there during a very busy time of the year and never had to park more than 75 -100 feet away from the elevator, even when we spent the whole day away and didn't get back until 11:30 or 12:00 at night. The location is very convenient as you can literally be driving through the gates to Disney or pulling in at Sea World in maybe 10 minutes. We did agree to sit through their time share presentation and it did take up some time. The representative made us a tempting offer which we ended up declining but received a nice Disney discount for our time. We did have one instance where our 2 year old managed to lock the doors between the main section of our suite and the lockout portion. We told the clerk at the front desk and within 20 minutes someone from the maintenance dept. had us back in working order. Altogether, as pleasant an exchange experience as we have had.

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly and Fun”
Reviews.Author: joyscape
Reviews.Content: Excellent resort. Staff is friendly, accomadations excellent for an older resort. We had a great time every night with the live dj, karoke, and live music. My children ages 5 and 8 enjoyed themselves thorougly. We participated in the limbo contest as well as the hula hoop (we lost).

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time”
Reviews.Author: ajflolo
Reviews.Content: We went to Star Island on a timeshare exchange. We had a spacious 1-bedroom "deluxe." The room was clean with a nice kitchen. The bathroom had a large jacuzzi tub with a very large, separate shower. Our son loved the pool area. There was also a game room and bar/grill that we never visited. Property is on a small lake and Star Island offered jet ski rentals (pricy), paddle boots, and fishing. Very close to Disney. Overall we had an enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: debb0
Reviews.Content: I always check Trip Advisor before booking anywhere. Well, this vacation was a bit different, as we were offered a week's stay at Star Island.. So, we knew we were going, and just had to keep fingers crossed that everything would work out. It truly did. Altho it is a timeshare and the opportunity to partake of the "presentation" is offered, it is not required. The resort grounds are amazing. And the pool area was a blast!! We enjoyed the waterfall- it was like a nice massage on your shoulders and neck-fun! Our room was exactly as pictured, and having a full kitchen, dining and living area, incredible master bedroom with large shower and whirlpool tub was great. The issue with having no maid service (unless paying extra) did not bother us, as we kept things neat and clean all week, and because there was also a washer/dryer, we just tossed in towels a couple times during the week with some other things.. Great proximity to Disney and attractions.. Things that people complain about just amaze me sometimes.. I mean, the only thing my husband had thought of doing that he didn't was fish in the lake.. this was because it wa a bit too weedy.. oh well!! Overall, certainly not enough of a problem to worry about.. Would I go there again?? ABSOLUTELY!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Place! (06/07 - 06/14/2008 VISIT)”
Reviews.Author: da1i1princess
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure why someone would rate this resort terrible - we had an EXCELLENT stay!!! (for those of you visiting for the 1st time - "Don't believe everything you read!") I was impressed from the minute we drove into the resort. The grounds were beautifully landscaped and groomed. The staff is very helpful, even the time share solicitors were nice when we declined the 'free tour." We stayed in Bldg 19 a 3BR. Our rooms were VERY CLEAN, sheets CLEAN, all appliances worked. Nothing to complain about. And the view from our balcony was nice. The location is excellent to the theme parks, restaurants and grocery stores. Having spent most of our days at the theme parks - Star Island was a nice place to come home to. We will be visiting again!

Reviews.Title: “Hated it!”
Reviews.Author: suzihatch
Reviews.Content: We did a timeshare exchange through IntervalWorld (first time) and was told that it had a king size bed in the master and showed these wonderful pictures. Not so. We arrived at midnight and were riding in the elevator to our room, my husband said "if it doesn't get any better when we get off the elevator, we are out of here". Unfortunately with 3 of us it would have been a nightmare. We didn't even bother checking talking to the front desk in the morning because it was a timeshare exchange and so we ended up calling American Express Platinum and getting a room at Loews Portofino Orlando which was stunning. Overall our trip was fabulous (because we didn't stay at Star Island). It turns out we could have requested a bigger and better suite if they had availability, but their standard room is pretty disgusting. Oh, and the blanket on the bed had holes in it and I was afraid to get it near my face. In the end, IntervalWorld redeposited my weeks, thankfully and now I know how to check into these places.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: bonjoe
Reviews.Content: Just got back (May 10-17) and have to say we had a great experience at this resort. We arrived at about 10:30AM so our room was not ready yet but were offered a penthouse suite that was available immediately. WIth a family of 5 (3 kids aged 11, 14 and 16) this worked out great. We had alot of room including full kitchen, 3 baths, living/dining area, 2 bedrooms and a sitting room with pullout couch. Everything was in good working order and very clean. (after reading some previous reviews I was a bit worried!) The pools are great and were warm when we were there-the only drawback was that there is not much shade around the deeper pool and since it was sunny and around 90 degrees it would have been nice. The drinks at the pool bar are a bit pricey but we expected that. Have to agree with the review about the loud kareoke. We stayed in the building across the water way from the pool bar and still heard the music clearly.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: Lvsdsny
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Star Island over Mother's Day weekend on the advice of a friend. We are frequent weekend Disney visitors. We reserved the mini-suite. We were very impressed! The suite was extremely clean and smelled great. It was well equipped, nicely decorated and very comfortable. The kids slept on the pull out couch while hubby and I took up the one bedroom. The pools were lots of fun for the kids. There is plenty to do at the hotel - but the location is so good that you are close to 535 for easy access to Disney, in addition to all the restaurants, stores on I92. Upon check in they do ask if you would like to sit through the time-share presentation. We agreed. It was nothing high pressure, was informative, and we walked away with goodies. We will certainly return to Star Island in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with Star Island”
Reviews.Author: mborofix
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Star Island from May 9th through May 13th and were very happy both with the resort itself and it's convenient location. We had a one bedroom mini suite (full kitchen, living room) on the 2nd floor of Building 21 in the back part of the resort. There was an elevator for our building and our balcony looked out over a small man made lake with fountain in the middle. We never had a problem with noise from any source, but our room was set back from the main hallway and a distance away from the main building and all of it's activities. It was great to have the stacked washer/dryer to be able to do some laundry as needed. Because we were only there for 4 nights we didn't have any maid service or towel replenishment but that was no problem.
