There are two free form pools and for some reason they are side by side, versus at two different locations on the property. There were plenty of lounge chairs, you could get towels from the activity counter, and the pools are open until 11pm, which is nice after spending all day at theme parks. On a deck overlooking the pools there is a bar open all day and into the evening, and all evening activities are up there. You can also get a drink during the day and bring it down to the pool area. We sat up there a couple of evenings and watched the sun set with a drink in our hand and listening to DJ music. There are plenty of restaurants nearby and it's a straight shot down to Disney World, so it's very convenient. We didn't do any of the resort activities but there were plenty to pick from, but most did involve an extra fee. Overall we were very pleased with the resort and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: gijersey
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from a 2 week break at Star Island and we LOVED it.Our suite was very clean and comfortable.The kitchen area was immaculate,lovely pool,pleasant helpful staff.I.ve read some of the other reviews and they don't sound like the same place we stayed, all I can think is that Americans are tough to please!! We would love to stay there again.(we're from Jersey uk --not New Jersey)

Reviews.Title: “Star Island Resort was great!!”
Reviews.Author: sbren57
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Star Island!! The mini-suite we booked was just the right size for 3 adults and 1 child! Very clean! It was very close to the Magic Kingdom, Epcot, & Hollywood Studios, We were there within minutes! The pool area was awesome! 2 pools, whirlpool, and a large deck all around...plenty of room. They had daily activities for kids around the pool. We rented a jet ski at the lake, very friendly and helpful service over there. All in all, we really had a great time at Star Island Resort in Kissimmee, Florida!! It had every thing we needed! I would recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time”
Reviews.Author: rjcMi
Reviews.Content: This was our first family vacation, we used a friends time share and we had a great time. The rooms were spacious and clean. It was nice having our own kitchen. We absolutely loved the view from our balcony,we could watch the fireworks at Disney from it every night. The only thing we'd change is the water in the pool was always cold and the deck was very slippery. My son slipped and hit his head and my cousins mother in law also fell. We'd definitely go back again,overall it was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Not again...”
Reviews.Author: bye-crikey
Reviews.Content: Wife's parents have a timeshare and this was the only place we could use. Checkin was ok, guy was nice... we then had to talk to someone who tried to have us listen to time share speech... we HAD TO go to this person to get our parking pass, no choice here. We politely declined to listen to it. When we first go to the room, which was at the very back of the resort (ROOM 2118A) neither of our keys worked. Fortunately I had my cell phone and called the front desk and they brought us new keys within 10 minutes. First walked in the room and it smelled musty/mildew-ish... toilet continued run after flushing {if you remember as a kid your father telling you to go giggle the handle on the toilet...that is the same thing :) } Coffee pot was broke and they brought us another fairly quiclky... But it also was broke. Fridge made a terrible noise, every once in a while. My biggest issue... Ran out of Toilet paper, called at about 11am and waited around for about 1 hour. We left as we had somewhere to be. I expected to come back and it be there 5 hours later. My wife called and asked them to bring it again as I had to... well, I had to go :)... Waited for them for about 15 minutes and had to use tissue for blowing your nose. Took them about 40 minutes to bring the TP. We were in a "lockout room" and had neighbors and could hear them most of the time while in the sleeping area. Seems that our room connected to the living area for them. Not sure of that though. Basically it was free for us so that is why we just stayed. I would never pay to stay here. Also, we spent enough time in this room to sleep and do what young married couples do... :)

Reviews.Title: “Star Island was perfect for the short time I was there.”
Reviews.Author: Felicia184
Reviews.Content: Check-in was quick and informative, I checked in later in the day, around 4 or so. Parking is good, unless you come in later at night. If you come in later at night, you may have to park 2 or 3 rows back from the entrance of your building(not very far at all). The building I stayed in was different on the outside. Each room was at the end of a little balcony, overlooking plants below(like an atrium). I had a 1 Bedroom Deluxe, with nice quiet patio, overlooking a hotel lawn and tennis courts off to the side. The room was spotlessly clean. I noticed they had even taken out a toaster(that still looked good to me) and put in a brand new one, the other one was by the door when I got there but, cleaning crews quickly got it I guess. Kitchen area was clean and orderly and had a box of "goodies" to use in the room-detergent, etc. Livingroom was fine but, I didn't try to see if the couch pulled out into a bed..I didn't need it. The toilet area of the bathroom was small but, had a door you could open or close. No washer/dryer in my room but, I was only staying a few days. Jacuzzi was clean, although it did have a panel that looked broken but, tackily repaired. It was on the outside, so, nothing wrong in the jacuzzi itself. The bed was awesomely comfortable and smelled clean. Plus, the bed was backed up in a corner and the headboard was like a corner shelf with mirrors. Sure, it looked like older 80's style but, I thought it was romantic and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: disneytraveller
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many timeshares during our many trips to Florida over the years. Some of the places we have stayed at were not overly fancy, but they were always clean and pleasant. This was by far the worst place that I have ever rented. The decor is grossly outdated and our room was very musty and smelly. The two bedroom unit (called a lockout) is aptly named because if you're not careful, you will get locked out! We had to try to figure out a way to keep the heavy steel door opened so that our kids wouldn't get locked in the part of the unit where their bedroom was. Eventually, we all slept in the kingsize bed (4 people) because I was too afarid to leave my kids to sleep in what seemed to be a completely separate apartment, rather than just a second bedroom! The sofabed was so delapitated and dirty that it was not an option when it came to sleeping. Then there was the lovely cockroach we found in the kitchen sink! That was a pleasant treat! Don't be fooled by the photos of the grounds. The pool area, the lobby and the grounds are beautiful, but when you get to the buildings and see the dark, dirty corridors you are in for a completely different experience. As a person who has stayed at many condo resorts in the Disney area, take my advice and spend your money elsewhere. There are many beautiful resorts with 1,2, and 3 bedroom units and full kitchens which are far superior to Star Island. Wyndham's Cypress Palms, Summer Bay Resort, Polynesian Isles Resort and Wyndham's Bonnet Creek are far better places to spend your valuable vacation time.

Reviews.Title: “NO way!”
Reviews.Author: kpandtpinpa
Reviews.Content: We planned a quick weekend getaway and were so excited to find a place that had loads to do for kids since we have a 6yo and 16 month old. I called the day before to confirm our reservation and to ensure that we would have a crib in our room. Our flight was delayed so we did not arrive to the hotel until 2 AM...Finding the hotel was easy, a short drive from the airport. Check in went smooth and I thought this was too easy! Off we went to our room... NO parking.....had to park pretty far away from the entrance to the building which houses a lot of rooms considering it is 6 or 7 floors. 5th floor was our destination...we got off the elavator and immediately entered the concrete coves! Everything is concrete, there is no view of anything! We found our room down the concrete hall. Entering the room was interesting, we entered into the hallway where to the right was a room with two double beds and to the left was a small room with a couch like piece of furniture, more like an outdoor piece of furniture with cushions, a small table for two and a very small sink and frige. It is now 3:15 in the morning and we are exhusted...there was no crib so we had to call to the front desk and ask again for it. 20 minutes later it arrived. We got settled at about 3:30 and we just closed our eyes when our "neighbor" came home. We suspected that our room was a "lockout" due to the extra door in the hallway, but never could we have imagined the noise that would radiate into the bedroom. The walls were paper thin and we heard every word that was being said. I think we finally just passed out from pure exhaustion...the last I looked at the clock it was 4:30...6:00am rise and shine!!!!!!! seems everyone was up at this time and because there is concrete EVERYWHERE it echos like crazy. The window int he bedroom looks out to the concrete stairs and hallways so you heard people up and down the steps and halls, the window in the couch room sits along the hallway so your head is sleeping inches from people walking by with a paperthin wall between. we were up and off to breakfast....At 9:00 we were back, packed and checked out we were not going to be in a prison for four days!!!! THE BEST PART!!!!! I went to check out and cancel the rest of our reservation and not one person asked why I was checking out, how things were, could they try to move us, NOTHING! Never EVER again will we stay here!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just Right!”
Reviews.Author: webmom2
Reviews.Content: At first we were nervous. Had to carry our heavy bags up to the 3rd floor of our wing. The moment we opened the door we knew it was worth it. Lots and lots of space! Our two girls (ages 13 and 15) had their own room with a privacy door and their own shower. We had a full kitchen and living room. My husband loved our big bedroom and the fact that we had our own bathroom. We also had a small balcony to sit, have a quiet drink and watch the people across the pond while listening to the nightly music. It was a great way to end our day! Yes, the decor could use some major upgrading, but the place was clean and very spacious. We would love to return now that we know we can get away from the kids!

Reviews.Title: “Hated it here...Will never go stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: travelerfamily226
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed in this resort. First of all, it is very old looking and really needs a complete refurbishment. The decor is hideous...70ish decor. The wallpaper was peeling off and in the bathroom it looks very mildew. Our mini suite had this smoking smell and then I realized that I guess it was a smoking room (we didn't want a smoking room) because there were two ashtrays in the living area. The walls are "paper thin" because we could hear everything in the room next door to us. For two nights, we had we were awake b/c of the noise level! The mini suite is very small. Thank god we only stayed for 3 nights. I felt like we were in a cheap motel 6 or something instead of a resort. The area it is located is very motel 6ish feeling too. There are red roof inns and other lower accomadations in the highway where this is located. I will not be staying here ever again!!! Definitely would not recommend this to any.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here a few times”
Reviews.Author: AlabamaRainbow1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Star Island a few times in the past couple of years. I basically go down a couple times each winter/early Spring for Cheerleading competitions at the Wide World of Sports, and this resort has been perfect for us. We get the small A side since it has always just been me with one of my children. I agree that the decor is outdated, but I sort of expect a little cheesiness in Florida! Last month I stayed for four nights with my 6 yr old son and he had a blast. He loved the pool and the arcade and just liked walking around the property. We weren't there much between going to Disney parks and competitions but it was really great for us. One night we were so tired that we just went back to the resort and ordered pizzas and salads delivered. We didn't get to do any of the activities at the pool, etc although I would love to sometime. We have never had any troubles with our rooms at all. I do wish there was maid service, but we just try to keep it as neat as we can, so it's no big deal. I am going in two weeks with my teenage daughter and we are planning to spend all non-compeititon time by the pool, and also to make use of the spa. So I guess the next trip will be the real test. The only thing I hate is the sales calls and pressure. I hate it. But I just tell them I will be busy with competitions and do not have time for any of their meetings. This last time they put on the pressure but I just ignored them

Reviews.Title: “Star quakity”
Reviews.Author: phukdesign
Reviews.Content: I stayed here quite a long time ago but i think it was worth me reiewing it as i thought it was great. It is a well designed masterplan. looking back at images now though, i do feel it is in need of a refurb. The atmosphere was lovely and it is a lovely base to explore orlando from. we stayed in a 2 bed unit which could be split into two separate apartments. They are pretty big and compare to the Hiltons grand vacation 2 beds. personally I prefer the Hilton, but this was still lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Star Island......very very NICE”
Reviews.Author: sharkyb
Reviews.Content: After reading a few reviews we were a little scrared. We traded our timeshare from Las Vegas to Star Island this year and when we arrived it was a pleasant surprise. Interval International has it as a 5 star resort and thats who we usually go by. As soon as you enter the property and go down the driveway across the lake, you know it is a very nice place. Once inside the lobby to register it was very clean and looking like a 5 star resort! Once in the room , there was plenty of room for the 4 of us, and again very clean and everything was in working order. The heated pools were clean and plenty of activites offered by the resort, including the upstairs bar at night! Star island is in a great area plenty of things to do and see, shopping, eating......and Disney is only maybe 8 minutes away ....and easy to get around. I would recommend this resort for adults and kids.

Reviews.Title: “Not Woth the Money”
Reviews.Author: quietstorm986
Reviews.Content: I visited the Star Island Resort and I was not pleased. I have visited many resorts in Florida and I have to say this was the worst one I stayed in. The furniture is old and outdated, and personally I would not want to purchase a timeshare there. We stayed in a minisuite and the bathroom looked mildewed and it had a rusted smell. Needless to say the next morning we had a call early in the AM telling us they wanted to turn off the water. After we had just got in 2am they wanted us to go ahead and take our baths,etc so they could turn water off. I said ok, but the water was dirty and rusted coming out of the shower head and faucet. I immediately asked to be relocated to another room. The water was fine but again I say the rooms are outdated and their water has an old rust smell. If you didn't have any deodorant soap and smell goods your body would be smelling like old rusted water and pipes. The only thing I enjoyed was the spa, and they have a nice workout room, and pool.

Reviews.Title: “Good spot around Orlando”
Reviews.Author: racoon009
Reviews.Content: We own a timeshare, so we went down for the every few years Orlando trip with the extended family. We booked the double rooms, and that ended up being plenty of room for the 7 of us, with 3 queen or full size beds and 2 sleep sofas. It's important to keep in mind this is a timeshare, not a traditional hotel, so no maid service. The service at the hotel is very good, from check-in to check-out. We had a minor problem with our fridge when we checked in and they repaired it within a couple hours. They have a great pool area and a very nice fitness center. The staff also has something going on every day and night that is normally family friendly. Also, if you enjoy tennis this is a great place to be, lots of really nice tennis facilities for use. Star Island is about 20 minutes away from Disney and Universal so you'll need a car. There is great food and shopping right around the resort, so the only big traveling away from the resort you'll probably be doing is the theme parks. Overall, it's a great place to stay in the area and because of the timeshare you can normally get it at a great price.

Reviews.Title: “A Dump!”
Reviews.Author: cgoldburg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Star Island through the Discovery program with Fairfield. Hard to believe others call this a beautiful resort. The 80's called they want their cheap decor back. I wouldn't have even called this beautiful in the 80's. The decor is this grecian beach theme and it's just awful. I saw the pics online and thought yuck! Fairfield assured me this was one of their best properties. (The other property we wanted was booked), Well if that's the case, that sealed the deal we weren't buying Fairfield. I'm of the frame of mind that when I go on vacation the resort I stay in needs to be nicer than where I live. I would equate this with a weak 3 star. If you think of your resort as a place just to sleep and don't care about amenities or decor, than this is the place for you. One final note, the staff is very nice, there are no service issues. Finally, this is not close to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Here's the Real Deal!”
Reviews.Author: AliciaBen8
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a small one bedroom with my 11 year old son for 7 days and nights. Know going in that there is no daily maid service. Don't be a pig! We picked up after ourselves and had a most enjoyable time! We were "green" in that we didn't unnecessarily go through towels and linens. The rooms aren't outdated...I thought that they were rather campy with their Florida styling. The beds were plenty comfy and I NEVER saw a single BUG! The pool was pristine! We avoided the time share creeps by telling them that I was too tired to attend the first meeting but to call and I would set up a time to come listen to their speel. I simply never took their call. I left my car lights on one night and the staff was quick as a wink to jump start my rental car. DOWNSIDES: Thin walls and late night noisy neighbors the first night. ALSO, the whirlpool tub is raised high off the floor. IF you are unable to ambulate very well, you may not be able to get in the tub period. There is at least a 3 foot step up with no assistance. Close by is a WalMart, Target, upscale Mall and more restaurants than you could need. The hotel has a small convenience store inside. I will make it a point to stay again. I give this resort 3 1/2 of 5 stars- (4is they had daily maid service.)

Reviews.Title: “I don't know what you guys are talking about!”
Reviews.Author: dega09
Reviews.Content: When we found out we would be staying here through a time share tour we had taken a few months back I checked this site to see what everyone thought. I wasn't really looking forward to it after all the reviews...but it was GREAT! Not only is the property beautiful and the pool awesome...not to mention CLEAN...but they have great activites to do on the grounds and our 1 bedroom unit was HUGE compaired to a holtel room! It was also clean and way more space then my husband and I really needed...The only thing that didn't thrill me was the spa. The people that worked there were pretty rude at first, and not exactly jumping to accomadate me. I asked for a manicure and a pedicure and they said they didn't have time for them both (I'm not sure why because each time I was there the place seemed desserted)...and when they finally did fit me in for a manicure she just gave me a polish change and then tried to charge me for a manicure....but it was worked out in the end and really other then that we both were very impressed. Now that we are Whyndom owners I lookforward to going back!

Reviews.Title: “Just above average”
Reviews.Author: GracieC00
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Star Island five years ago on our honeymoon. We were hoping to see some renovations and/or new activities. Needless to say, not much has changed in the past five years. We requested one of their newest units, which we received; however, our room still looked outdated with pink walls, carpet, and furnishings. We booked a three bedroom/ 3 bathroom deluxe villa. We were expecting a pretty large unit, but discovered a series of lock-offs that were extremely small. The villa included a king bed with its own bathroom, an adjoining room with 2 double bed and a separate bathroom, and a lock-off that had an efficiency room with a pullout small sleeper sofa, and another small queen bedroom that shared a bathroom. This floor plan was not viewable on their website, so we did not realize how small the set up was going to be. Luckily, we had our own washer/dryer because we had the entire villa, sides A and B. If you only have one side, you must share with the other unit. Fortunately, all the rooms were clean. We did have to have housekeeping vacuum all the floors when we first arrived, but they were quick to correct the problem. There were a few hairs in the shower, but I just made my husband get rid of them. Our room smelled like smoke, so I am assuming the last guests did not heed the nonsmoking room policy. The linens and towels were worn, but at least they were clean. The kitchen was nicely stocked, but we only used the kitchen a few times. Aside from issues with the villa, the staff was great. Whenever we needed something, they were very accommodating and friendly. We received no sales calls and were never pressured to attend a time share presentation. We did not use the pool, but it looked clean and well maintained. The location is extremely convenient to Disney, shopping, and restaurants. Overall, our stay at the Star Island was fine. We usually stay at Marriott properties, so my standards are a little high. If the unit was bigger and the villas were updated I would have rated this resort higher. If you have read other horrible reviews and are hesitant about staying at this resort, I would recommend giving Star Island a shot. I am extremely picky, so if you are not traveling with a lot of people and don't need the space, or if you are not concerned with outdated decor, Star Island is not as bad as others have said! I hope this helps!!

Reviews.Title: “Very large room!!”
Reviews.Author: maryellen57
Reviews.Content: This is probably the most comfortable hotel I've ever been! I went with my husband and my three teenagers and we stayed in a 3-bedroom 2 bathroom villa. It is just amazing. Every time I went to Orlando I slept at a Days Inn or something similar so I appreciate a lot the huge size. The main room has a king-size bed, a big t.v., a large jacuzzi, and an enormous shower. The living room has an even larger T.V. with a DVD, a stereo and a couch-bed in which two adults can comfortably sleep. The kitchen is completely equiped. It has a dishwasher, large fridge, oven, microwave oven, etc. The 2nd room has two beds and a T.V.,and the 3rd room has a double couch-bed, a mini-fridge, a coffemaker and a small sink. I loved both swimming pools and sometimes they were completely empty. The resort has a lot of activities during the week which we really enjoyed. I liked the location (just about 4 miles from Disney). My family and I recommend this resort to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay As Usual”
Reviews.Author: Monkees
Reviews.Content: As usual, we had a great 1 bedroom suite. Love this place. No more harrassing phone calls regarding sales tours. Voicemails everyday telling your what events are going on. Checked in early with no problem. Check out late with ease. Plenty of parking. Stayed in Building 22. I requested a 1 bedroom suite with 2 bathrooms, because my parents were staying one night. Got what I asked for. Had no problem using the washer & dryer in the public laundry room one night. The public laundry is free. If you get a 1 bedroom suite with 1 bath, you will have a washer & dryer in the condo. Will be staying there again. Might change the time of year we go due to the crowds & the heat. We will miss the Food & Wine Fesitval & Halloween Horror Nights, but less crowds & heat sounds better to me. I would recommend this resort to anyone. Even my parents who own a timeshare were very impressed with the room. They complimented the mattress on the pull out couch & the shower stall in the second bathroom. I think they were impressed, which is hard to do.

Reviews.Title: “loved star island”
Reviews.Author: RosemountChick
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed a weekend at the Star Island Resort and loved it. Our room over looked one of their lakes- it was so quiet and peaceful. Our room was decorated beautifully- It had a big jacuzzi tub in our bedroom. We had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Don't even think about it!!”
Reviews.Author: CillaMd
Reviews.Content: We were extremely disappointed in what we were told would be 5-star facility. Weunderstand that the Star Island Resort was recently taken over by a new company and is in the process of having a “facelift”. We also realize that many of the services and amenities we are accustomed to in Mexico are not standard practice here in the U.S. (i.e. once we arrive in Mexico and locate our shuttle to the resort, we do not touch our luggage again until it is brought to us at our room – the same applies when we leave). What surprised and disappointed us at Fairfield was the fact that towels were only exchanged one time in the middle of the week. The villa was equipped with an apartment size washer and dryer, but the maximum amount of towels it would hold was four (and the dryer initially did not work until we placed a service call). With a family of seven, we would be spending most of our vacation doing laundry, which to me is not a vacation at all. Daily fresh towels were offered but at a cost of $7.00 per exchange. Even the most inexpensive hotel/motel offers fresh towels on a daily basis. Maid service was also offered, but at a cost of $25.00 per visit! We find this to be unusual and exorbitant. Again, this type of service is included in almost every hotel/motel I’ve ever encountered. Also, complimentary coffee and tea are typically available in the lobbies of any facility I’ve ever stayed at. Fairfield Star Island was charging $1.50 per cup in their lobby. Maintenance and upkeep of the facility was mediocre at best. Plus the staff strongly pushed us to go to a presentation to attempt to "sell" us more time at a new facility near Epcot with the understanding that if we went for 30 minutes, we would get discount tickets to Disney World. We had to stay two hours before we were given our discount coupons. Needless to say, we were not happy. Again, I say I realize that we’ve become somewhat accustomed to the type of service and accommodations we have in Cancun. But the examples I’ve listed above are not outside the normal level of expectations, even at a three or four star facility. At best, Fairfield Star Island Resort should be rated as a 3 star resort. I now understand why the other owners at the Royal Resorts very rarely exchange their weeks. They can find very little else which equals their high standard of service and outstanding maintenance of their facilities. We will never return to this facility again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: mizzm2001
Reviews.Content: This resort was worth the 90 minute tour. I made my reservations 2 weeks prior. Called two days before to confirm room and requested early checkin. Got to the resort around 1pm and check in is at 4. They checked us in and gave us our keys. No problem... While there requested a late check out, No problem. 11 am worked just fine for us... Got to our 1 bedroom deluxe suite and No problems. The suite was clean spacious and we were ready to have a good time... The room is a little outdated but hey, we are in Orlando, Fl. unless it was just built it will be a little outdated. The linens and floors were clean the bathroom and kitchen were good. The jacuzzi tub is great after a long day. We got a great rate of $150 for 3/2 and we had to listen to the 90 minute timeshare deal... Our guy was straight to the point and stayed with his promise of 12 noon. At 12:30 we were parking our car at Universal Studios thanks to the free tickets we just got. All in all it was great... We enjoyed TGI Fridays which is right in front of the resort and its location is perfect to get to everything food, shoppping and entertainment. I would recommend the Capone dinner show as well... Its buffett quality dinner and all you can drink is worth the $23 ticket and the show is interactive so you make the best of it. Star Island gave us no problem and we had a nice weekend.

Reviews.Title: “What a Dive....”
Reviews.Author: bodioni
Reviews.Content: We traded our time share in Cancun for a week at Star Island...what a mistake - the room is 1970s decor complete with mirrors all over the master bedroom. The pool is too filthy to swim in, it was loud and generally made us feel unsafe, especially at night. The resort obviously needs a huge renovation, as stairwells were rusty and dirty, and the rooms were needing repair. We went out the first day and came home from a long day at Disney only to find our room door was ajar. Nothing appeared to be missing (thank god for room safes). We complained about it but all we were told is that the maid must have left it open. We didn't have the maids in the entire time we were there. We said that, but they didn't care. Front desk staff rude and snarky,and they were very pushy about trying to sell us a timeshare. We will be complaining to Interval about it for sure...lesson learned - be careful about what you think you are trading into when doing an exchange. Never ever will we return there.

Reviews.Title: “Worst resort ever!”
Reviews.Author: FloridaSurfGirl
Reviews.Content: We exchanged thru Interval for our timeshare in Key West. Worst mistake ever. I don't have enough room here to get into all of the details, but I have filed a complaint with the health department for numerous problems that the resort did not address. From the gross pool to the FILTHY DISGUSTING bounce house, to the guy pouring drinks at the cabana WHILE smoking a cigarette, and finally, to the black curly hair extensions sitting poolside that were complained about but never cleaned up the entire six days we were there. We actually left two days early from our vacation, and probably would have left earlier had we not been spending alot of time at Sea World. The final straw came when the police used our room as a staging area to arrest a fugitive from another county and a drug dealer staying in the unit ATTACHED to ours (we have 2 children, a 3 year old and a one year old). I then found out that the person remaining in that unit was a person out on bond for drug trafficking, and the resort management made me feel like the criminal for asking to move and for wanting to be upgraded to a larger unit. The guy actually said, "We are not FORCING you to move, you are ASKING to be moved." You'd think that they would be falling all over themselves to see to it that we were - oh, I don't know - SAFE on their property. Whatever. We just left before my kids started eating crack cocaine for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Falling Star”
Reviews.Author: Bobcat66J
Reviews.Content: We (myselft, wife and two children ages 8 and 6) stayed at the Star Island Resort from June 30 - July 7th. We got our room via a timeshare point trade, and we were promised a nice one-bedroom condo for the week. We technically got a one bedroom condo, but it was more like the size of a broom closet. Thankfully, we spend our days away from Star Island at the Theme Parks, but after a long day at Disney, it was not the most fun place to return to. The night we arrived, I took my kids to the pool and it was gross, so we never returned or even considered it an option. The service staff was not friendly, and we were asked to "take a survey, since we are timeshare owners already" and we would get $75 in Disney Dollars. I told them I did not want to go to a timeshare presentation, but that is exactly what it was...atleast we got $75 in Disney Dollars for a wasted hour. Not impressed, would never recommend!! This Star needs to be sucked into a Black Hole!!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: NJDebW
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at Star Island through our Fairfield/Wynham Timeshare and were thoroughly pleased with our experience. The only glitch was in the towel exchange, which was ironed out quickly. There were eight of us- 4 adults 4 children staying in a 3 bedroom 2 bath unit and it was wonderfully spacious and suited our needs to a T. The children especially enjoyed the pool, playground, paddle boats and the jetskis. We were given a great rate (maybe because our 27 yr. old daughter was there in her bathing suit?) on the jetskis and hubby and daughter took the 4 kids for great rides. The resort is close to all the parks, grocery stores, and other shopping. There was plenty of parking- we had two rented vehicles and never had a problem finding a spot to park. The resort was clean and well tended and everyone was pleasant, especially the "Disney" lady in the lobby. She was a treasure trove of information. I am very surprised by the previous poster's review- maybe he should have looked more closely in the daytime! I would recommend this resort to anyone needing space and comfortable surroundings on their vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Somewhere Else!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: unhappycamperTexas
Reviews.Content: I'm so disapointed in the star island I'm writing this from our room at the star island. The pools are disgustingly dirty, the grounds are unkept and the night time atmosphere something I would not allow my children to be around. Not a 5 star, not a 4 star, a 3 maybe. We were only there at night since we were in the theme parks all day, thank goodness. If part of your trip includes staying at the hotel to swim go somewhere else. I wish I had spent the extra money and stayed some where else. Yes this is a family resort if your from the getto. Don't let the photos you see fool you.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at Star Island - Do not be Affraid”
Reviews.Author: MOfamily
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful week long stay at Star island! We had a 3 bedroom condo with 7 adults & 3 children in it and had plenty of room. Everyone at the resort was kind & helpful. We went on the timeshare tour and it was VERY low pressure. The condo had wonderful murals on the walls, huge jacuzzi tub in the Master Suite and the kids loved the pool. It is also a very short, easy drive to Disney World. We spent very little time at the resort but the kids were begging to leave the theme parks so they could have time to swim at the resort in the evenings. The spa looked very nice (although we did not use it) and there was a very nice gift shop onsite. Lots of restaurants in the area - we will definately return. No one in our group (ranging in age from 6 to 76) was disappointed with Star Island!

Reviews.Title: “Family Reunion Resort”
Reviews.Author: Rockdale
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a family vacation/family reunion. My family and I really enjoyed our stay at Star Island Resort. We had a two bedroom deluxe unit that was HUGE!! The master bedroom had an in-room Jacuzzi and a huge stand-up shower. This unit can sleep 10 people comfortably. We were not too thrilled about the tropical color scheme. The only problem we saw is that none of the units in our building had washer and dryer. However there was a free laundry facility on the first floor that had several machines to use. So some buildings are different that others. I'm not sure how hold the building was but the outside area in the hallways were dirty at the entrance and could use a facelift/paint job. The pool area was a lot of fun. After reading some of the reviews we thought that it was going to be extra crowded with tourist from timeshare but it was pretty calm. They even have a nice lake where you can rent Jet Ski, paddle boats, etc. I would recommend this resort to all families. Ms. Ebony in Reservations was very courteous and helpful along with CRS representative Rochell Koren.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay at Star Island”
Reviews.Author: brenmich1
Reviews.Content: Bought A package off Ebay (bigdogvacations) $199 plus tax =$260 or so for a 8 day 7 night one bedroom condo.This procedure was a little nerve racking but ended up being a great experience.The room was great,a liitle dated but who really cares if the bed is green and gold.As long as its clean.Big Jacuzzi in room,separate stand up shower,deck,full kitchen,full size refrigirator,dining table area,washer-dryer,sofa bed for two kids ages 8 and 10.You must pay for daily room service cleaning I think. My wife does not like anyone in her room anyway so we straightened up our own mess.After a couple of days it almost seems like a little home because of the huge size of rooms and all the amenities in the room.Nice pools,security gate up front,.Went on a 90 minute tour for the deal.Got there on Sunday,went on tour monday morning.We were not going to any parks monday anyway.No pressure, kids sat on the back of the golf cart riding around the place.Then we told them no thanks.Not difficult. Would recommend this place to anyone but you must take the 90 minute tour to get the great deal.I mean $250 Total for a 8 day 7 night family vacation in florida.Whats there to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “really liked the Star Island Resort and Club”
Reviews.Author: davalisinc
Reviews.Content: Our trip was so short and spent very little time at the resort. We spent most of our time at Seaworld. Would of loved to of enjoyed the resort if we had more time to do so. Although the room was nice not a very nice view we had a window facing the parking lot where the employees have there carts and a garbage dumpster. Lots of early morning noise with garbage truck etc. The room was nice and clean housekeeping very friendly and the midnight front desk clerk was also very nice. The pool looked very nice would of loved to of enjoyed it if we had more time.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug325
Reviews.Content: We are owners at Star Island and are very happy with it. This year my husband and I went alone for the first time and we have both the A & B units. We usually bring family with us, grandchildren or other adults to enjoy with us. Disney is very close, 4 miles down the road. The employees are all very nice and helpful. Anything that needs attention all you do is call and they will replace or fix whatever it is. Our coffeepot wan't working and in ten minutes we had a brand new one. We have a washer and dryer in our unit and it makes it very nice. Don't need to pack a lot. Every year we look forward to our trip to Star Island, this time we only did Disney one day and the rest of the trip was spent relaxing and enjoying the resort. Its great for couples with children, plenty of space, full kitchen so you can save money on eating out. We always have breakfast there, make bacon and eggs, or cereal,or whatever, we have a full kitchen. When we have the grandchildren we stock the fridge with lunch and breakfast foods and snacks. I asked my grandson what was the best thing he liked about his trip last year and we went to all the parks, and he said swimming at Star Island, so kids are happy to do the simple things. I think my only complaint was that our neighbors were smokers and that is unpleasant when your sitting out on the balcony of your villa and smell the smoke. At night they have different things going on each night, this time they had Italian Night, they had a family barbecue, TGIF night, etc. There is a small charge and this is great for families with children, you can have dinner and not pay a fortune. So go, enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Better than a hotel, but not as nice as other resorts”
Reviews.Author: tecarroll
Reviews.Content: Star Island is an OK place to stay for families. The location is convenient to all of the parks and many restaurants. Although it is located in a busy area on 192, it is set back from the road at a distance from the traffic. Unfortunately, the rear of Star Island backs up to a trailer park with barking dogs; so avoid any buildings along the back side of the resort if possible. The interior areas (pools, tennis courts) are nicely landscaped, but not ritzy. The room was clean, but also nothing special. The tub/shower was awkward to get in and out of (a 2-foot edge to step over). It is definitely family oriented with many children surrounding the pool. A separate adult pool area would have been nice. There were a few activities for the children, but not at the level I've seen at other resorts such as Marriott and Sheraton. On the whole, Star Island was a better stay than a three-star hotel, but it was not at the level of other Orlando resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Warning: Do Not Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: tmschell
Reviews.Content: Thanks to this resort I am out $250. I am not able to get my money back because the "promotion" package is non-refundable. I spoke to a sales representive and they couldn't help me. Then I asked to speak to the manager and she couldn't do anything for me either. All she could do was re-explain the package to me. I choose not to stay here because of the awful reviews I read about the resort. Be smart and do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to be bothered”
Reviews.Author: raney
Reviews.Content: The staff of Fairfield and staff of Star Island competed for tours. We were called at 8:04 a.m. the first morning we were there. Terrible. Woken up by the Star Island Staff. They booked a tour with us and never showed up. They did that twice. If you go, let them know not to call you ever.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely loved Star Island!”
Reviews.Author: starisland_lover
Reviews.Content: This resort is amazing. They have two amazing pools with lots of things to do. They have activities for the kids at least every hour and even for the adults who are feeling childish! They have great music playing while you are at the pool along with many amazing stuff in the pool area. They have airbrushed tatooes you can get for the kids even adults! They also have tennis courts, golf course, basketball, and my favorite beach volleyball! They have so many fun stuff to keep you busy all day long. They have a beautiful spa with a steamer and a sauna along with hot tubs and jacuzzis. They have an arcade as well with lots of fun games. They have playgrounds for children along with tons of water sports activities that you can do. They also have fun entertainment at night where you can meet a lot of new people. If you want to stay at the hotel for the day they have a pool bar and hotdogs that are very good. Outside of this amazing resort they have many restraunts near by and along with Disney World very close by. Star Island is by far my favorite resort that I have ever been to in my life and i have already gone here two years in a row. I am looking forward to seeing you next year!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Star Island”
Reviews.Author: hbyoungermom
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at MANY Fairfield resorts and One being Bonnet Creek opening year. Star Island was the best so far. We are in the process of booking another 2 weeks this year. The staff made my daughter feel like a queen when we had to ask for more linens becuase she had gotten sick. We had some noisey wild highschool graduates who were party happy. But it was resolved within a matter of minutes thanks to the staff of star island. Anyone who didn't like this hotel is just a grumpy person because it was amazing. I recommend it more for families though. Not your typical Romantic get-a-way. Unless you like tennis. Happy travels all.. This one is a must see

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: indsguise
Reviews.Content: I was really apprehensive about our vacation to Star Island Resorts after reading some of the posts here. I have to say that all the negitive comments must be from people who are just having a bad day (or year) from the sounds of it. The resort was all 5 of the 5 stars. We had excellent service, from check in to check out. We stayed in the 3 bedroom, which was beautifully decorated and good sized. The only thing that would have been better would have been some easy chairs, the rooms all had couches. But they were very comfortable. We had 8 people and everyone was very pleased. The weather was a bit cold while we where there but the kids still got into the pool once. The resort is very close to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time - Loved it...but”
Reviews.Author: FunnybonesHampton
Reviews.Content: Very nice resort, beautifully landscaped grounds, fountain displays in all the lakes and ponds, activities almost every hour for the kids and family, Vic Braden Tennis clinic onsite, golf driving range onsite, ski-doo rentals on lake, huge health club facility, game room arcade (with fun non-violent games), 2 large free form pools one with kiddie splash area, kid's playground next to pools, just to name a few of the amenities. The resort is located off of route 192 which is a honky tonk strip of crazy gift shops and chain restaurants. Actually this was kinda fun since there was lots to see (and laugh at) as we drove up and down the strip. Not to worry though....the resport is far enough removed from this honky tonk. It is very quiet, little to no highway sounds. You feel like you are in a "resort" community. Our room was huge. It was a 3 bedroom suite. If we brought 2 families it would have been perfect since there were lockout doors for 2 bedrooms and 2nd bath. The room was very clean and well decorated but it had a strange design which left a lot of open spaces here and there. We were told by other guests that there is a new section with even larger rooms. I can't believe anyone would want anything larger. The kids thought it funny to have 4 televisions (like we go to Orlando to watch TV?). Every night there is a dinner served at the bar/pool area. Most were buffet style. Italian night hosted by Olive Garden was served to our table. Not bad for $6 each. One complaint would be the front desk check-in girl when we first checked in on Sunday. There were no lines we just walked up and she acted like we were not even there. I was standing 2 feet in front of her and she just did not care about us. Bad first impression but it did not ruin our day. To their credit the front desk was very helpful later on in the week taking care of our needs and questions. The guys in the pool cabana (where you get towels, rent tennis, etc) were the best ! They acted so happy to be able to serve us. They are the ones that we tipped the most. My only real complaint is that they schedule all the family activities i.e. clowns, balloons, jugglers, kareoke, bingo etc at the bar. The bar environment is not bad but I would not want my 10 year old to attend some of the activities due to drinking, VERY LOUD music and the yelling and screaming of some of the bar patrons. I understand they want to sell alcohol but not everyone drinks. Some daytime kids games were down by the pool but everything else is at the bar. Interestingly, the resort called my home one week prior to our arrival leaving a message that there was something wrong with out reservation. So of course, with some alarm, we called and come to find out it was the timeshare staff trying to get us to set up a tour. I was very upset and asked what was supposesdly wrong with our reservation. She put me on hold and then told me that they did not have the name of our host resort that we traded from (through Interval International). A likely story. I told her as forcefully as I could that we did not want to go on the tour and we did not want to be contacted while at the resort. I added that is she contacted us (for tour or promotion) that we would consider it harassment. According to our wishes...they did not. By the way the tour gift is $75 Star Island Dollars. Sorry, don't want to be too negative. We had a wonderful time and the resort was very comfortable. I would go back again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mr_True_review
Reviews.Content: The room was huge and the place was brilliant, we had a T.V in every room (although the kitchen was a little bit cramped) 2 fridges and 2 cookers the balcony wasnt very big but the weather made it nice. A pizza place, a resteraunt, a store and a electrical store were all just a stones throw away and so was disney and universal. The pool was nice although a little bit chilly but the jaccuzzi was very hot. we had 2 jaccuzzis in our rooms and one was HUGE! the place to stay if you go to orlando is STAR ISLAND

Reviews.Title: “It was well worth it!”
Reviews.Author: hisbabyqiirl
Reviews.Content: We had booked our stay with Fairfield Resorts & were so excited to finally get here after waiting a few months. Being a young couple, the main point of this vacation was to enjoy the parks & just relax. Pros: Early check-in. Check-in is usually 4pm & we got to check in around 1:30pm, it was also very quickly. They invited us to a timeshare meeting (lasted 30 minutes for us) which saves you a lot of money on the parks, & dinner shows. You choose which savings options out of many. The rooms were very Florida welcoming, which was nice since our vacation spot was Florida. Basically the whole resort was very nice. We stayed in a 1 bedroom "B" lock-off suite. An amazing jacuzzi with columns next to the bed, that was great to relax & watch tv in. The main street (highway) was close by with countless amounts of restaurants. The shuttles to the parks were very fair in prices. $10 per person round trip to Disney & $14 p/p r/t to Universal. Also, there are great savings in the front Concierge desk. Cons: The suite was for up to 4 people. There was only one toliet, which was in the bedroom. The jacuzzi obviously wasn't closed off, but the shower was glass doors so it was see-through. This we didn't mind, but if we had other people with us, that would have been a problem. Now i'm not too sure about the food topic, but when I asked earlier today if there was anything besides hot dogs, the lady said no, that's all for tonight. It was only 6:00 & the hot-dog stand next to the pool was closed for the night (when the pool stays open til 11pm.) There should always be food on site for people to eat when they get hungry. Even the hot dog price was ridiculous, from being born & raised in New York I don't expect to pay any more then $1.50 for a hot dog from a cart & they charge $3.50 (that's bananas). The prices for everything is ridiculous. I guess that's what you get for staying at a "FiVE STAR HOTEL". The game room for kids is pretty boring with no more then 7, 8 different games, nothing special AT ALL. The pool is nothing special either, it's pretty small in size & doesn't go past 5 feet. There isn't a shuttle from your villa to the main part of the resort. We had a good 10-15 minute walk each way, which was not enjoyable. I hope I helped with your decision about staying at this resort. The basic outlook was pretty good, as it was somewhere to rest our heads when we weren't at the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!!”
Reviews.Author: kjmvacation
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here repeatedly, gotten GREAT RATES. The facility, service, and amenities are incredible. We've now stayed there in an efficiency unit, a 2 bed room, and a three bedroom... 8 weeks altogether over 3 different years, and we'll be back. We are not "owners" here, but love it, and the spa, fitness area, pools, kids activities, rooms, big tv's... we love it all!

Reviews.Title: “Not what it used to be”
Reviews.Author: rhonmom
Reviews.Content: I am an owner at Star Island, we usually go every year and have a wonderful time. However, we did not go last year, 2005, and this year was a far cry from previous years. First of all our reservation was messed up from the beginning. Which is scary to begin with, because we own our week, we do not have to make reservations, we have to deposit our week with interval intenational if we do not go to the resort. We did not get our unit, they put us in a room on the other side of the resort than where we own. I was unhappy with this room and had them move us back to our building, it is at this time they tell me that our unit is being refurbished. We had their staff move our luggage etc., so we could go to dinner. Well, the next after noon we find out that we have missed multiple calls because the front desk does not know that we have changed units. Tell me how this can be since they moved us? we later called down to the desk to ask for more towels, there was a total of six sets of towels, in the past there has always been between 10-12 sets. I have been an owner for 10 years and have never had a problem of not enough towels until this year. They tell us we can not get anymore towels, unless we want to pay a charge. I am furious. I pay 800.00 a year for tax and maitenance fees and cannot get towels for the week. Then we go to the pool, where you have to sign out pool towels. I could not believe how cheezy this place has become. I could see if I was just a renter. But I own here and why would I steal from the place, I do not want my fees going up any more. I do have to say that we attended the yearly sales pitch and was not pressured and walked away with 75.00 in Disney dollars. My husband and I took advantage of the spa and enjoyed it very much. We both got a swedish massage and it was wonderful. We went on Monday and recieved 20 percent off. There are more activities for the family, but I am not that interested in that. I am more interested in comfort and class, which Star Island is beginning to lack.

Reviews.Title: “Definately not 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: Shyonne
Reviews.Content: Four Day Trip - Pros: Very close to both Disney and Universal. Located on the same road as Disney...lots of restaurants to choose from. Plenty of places to purchase discounted souveniers. Nightly poolside entertainment. Pools are great! Cons: Checked in: 9/15/06 - waited close to 30 minutes at counter before I was assisted in check-in (2 employees holding conversation in back, no one at front counter). 9/16/06 - Greeted by 2 roaches in bathroom in the morning. 9/17/06 - Awoken at 7:00am to "B" neighbors blasting music. Heard their entire conversations the night before. Walls between "A" and "B" units are paper thin. 9/18/06 - moved to another unit due to the roaches and noisy neighbors, only to find a room smelling of pure smoke! Went to take a shower, no hot water!! 9/19/06 - Awoken to a security call at 7:00am accusing me of having a dog in my unit. Completely untrue!! No free shuttles to parks. Units definately need to be refurbished.

Reviews.Title: “I had a wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: loves2travel770
Reviews.Content: This was not my first time staying here. I stayed here 3 years ago. I had a lock out room at that time. This time i had a one bedroom unit with the full kitchen and living room. The unit was very clean and spacious. I loved the garden jacuzzi tub next to the bed with the pillars! I used the pool quite often and it was always clean. I guess this is the best time of year to travel. There were not many people there. We were able to park in fromt of our unit everynight. We did not hear any noises. I am not sure if we had neighbors or not. The check-in went smooth and the guy at the front counter (Jay) was wonderful! My kids had a wonderful time in the game room. They loved the pool area and the kiddie area. I would definitly re-visit star Island!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort for kids”
Reviews.Author: Matdean
Reviews.Content: We just got home from our Orlando vacation and had to write something about this resort. We arrived at 1:30pm and were able to get right into our room. The check-in was smooth and was done professionally. We had the "A" mini-suite which was perfect for our family. To make things easier I will post my pros and cons. Pros: Pools were great. Kids programs were made fun. We took advantage of the driving range and tennis courts and they were very good. The support staff was great. We had a tv remote that did not work and rather than sluff it off, the maintenance person brought over a brand new tv! We called for fresh towels;no problem; even sheets and yellow pages;no problem. All reports were followed up by a call from a supervisor to see if everything was done right. The gym is good, for a resort. Nice to see some security. Cons: Rooms could use a little refurbishing, the couches and carpets seemed a little worn. No snack bar,unless you wanted chips. If you want food you had a hot-dog from the cart or called "Fridays" for service. The walls are pretty thin, so if you don't have both the "A" and "B" suites,you may hear your neighbour's conversations.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dusky111
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week at Star Island and had a great time from the very beginning. The resort was in a great location only 6 miles from the entrance to Disney World and on the same road (Highway 192) so there was no way to get lost getting in or out of the parks. Highway 192 was just filled with every type of restaurant you could imagine which made meal choices very easy and quick to get to. We arrived at the resort at 2pm and walked right up to the front desk and got our room keys without any delay at all. 4pm is the usual check-in time but that did not matter at all as we were right on our way to the unit. We had a second floor 2 Bedroom Deluxe Unit sides A&B which was located just two buildings from the clubhouse and on a pond. We were two families (4 Adults and 3 children) and the unit was HUGE! The Master bedroom was very large with a great Jacuzzi Tub in it. The second bedroom had two double beds in it and the bonus room (which is really a 3rd bedroom) had a pullout couch as well as did the main family room. The rooms all had large tv's (4 in all). The air conditioning worked great - which is a good thing in the 90 degree heat of the day. The kitchen was spacious and as well as was the 2nd full bathroom. Finally, the deck was also huge and was great to relax on in the evenings. The resort itself was beautifully landscaped and the clubhouse had the day spa, huge gym, arcade and behind it were two pools. The pools were warm and gorgeous. The kids loved the zeor entry pool which they could just run in and out of as often as they liked. It was also shallow (0 to about 5 ft.) so kids could easily navigate through. The other pool was a little deaper and tended to have more older kids and adults. There was dj at poolside each day and he really did a great job and also got the kids engaged in many poolside activities. The pool was also open from 7am to 11pm so we found ourselves spending an hour here and there throughout the day as we were inbetween park hopping. We would all highly recommend Star Island to all families. It is in a gated community with guard access only so you feel very safe. The facilities were wonderful, location was great and the rooms were spacious and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star - Are you kidding??”
Reviews.Author: Lhorn94
Reviews.Content: Where should I start. The room was huge - that was nice. The room was OLD - not five star. King size bed was very uncomfortable and was sitting on cement blocks - not five star. Fixtures and furniture were old and outdated - not five star. We ordered a crib for our baby and received a generic pack-n-play with a bottom that was too small for the crib and just slid around the bottom - not five star and dangerous. The location of the facility didn't have a five star RESORT like feeling - it was located between vacant strip centers and a permanent carnival . Early the second morning we were woken up by a sales agent's phone call confirming our appointment that we never scheduled!! - not five star. I woundn't call this place a resort at all and definitely not five star. Maybe this property was five star in the 80's but I think it needs some serious remodeling for it to be classified as a FIVE STAR RESORT - not Star Island. Lets do everyone a favor and call this TWO STAR ISLAND and leave off the resort/club part!!

Reviews.Title: “IT WAS WONDERFUL.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my family stayed at the resort and it was beautiful, I would reccommend everyone to stay there at least once in a life time. The staff was very polite and helpful, we felt very safe and nothing to worry about at all. Every thing was so close by you didnt have to drive a long time to get to places very conveince. I will go again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: blikkem
Reviews.Content: I thought the resort was very well run. The property was sort of a cozy, hide away without all the crowds of a larger resort. Only a 10 min ride to the gates of Disney. I felt secure and safe. Lots of things to do but I spent most of my time at Disney, but I was able to take in the entire resort in my explorations. I had a great time and the people were very polite and attentative. I hope they don't become one of those huge impersonal super resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: Bethlib
Reviews.Content: My family and I have just returned from vacationing in Florida. One of our weeks was at the Star Island Resort in Kissimmee. We booked this property because we had some "timeshare time" left to use from the purchase of a sampler package through Interval International. My husband, daughter and I stayed in one of the minisuites which connected to a larger one bedroom deluxe accomodation. Star Island's website said that a minisuite could sleep six people although I wouldn't recommend any more than three people stay in a minisuite. The bedroom had two double beds which was fine for my husband and I. My 10 year old daughter was comfortable on the sofa bed. The furnishings were comfortable and we had good air conditioning and television. The small refrigerator and microwave were adequate for our needs. There were minor items that needed some repair, but nothing that would detract from staying there. Our unit was on the fifth floor of one buildings further back in the complex so it was quiet for the most part. We had a short walk to the swimming pools and concierge. All of the staff were friendly and helpful. I can't say enough good things about them! We always found a close parking place as well. I can understand why larger groups wouldn't want to stay in the minisuite, but we were comfortable and enjoyed our stay at the Star Island Resort. I would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: fun for adults and kids come for 7 days to see all you need

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room”
Reviews.Author: janece58
Reviews.Content: One bedroom suite was very clean, beautiful and smartly arranged. For the money was a real deal. Ramada was charging $94 night and was really sub standard. Wished we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “star island was a star for us”
Reviews.Author: weberus3
Reviews.Content: Me and my family just returned from a week in Orlando. Our first time there, was a pleasent one. Star Island was good for us we are a famliy of 5 including a 13 month old, 7 year old and 13 year old. The only downsides were so much to do in Orlando we didn't get to use the resort as much as we liked to. We didn't enjoy having to go through the sales pitch. Three problems with the room 1. stove didn't work 2. toliet wasn't mounted to the floor 3. next door was on a party vacation not a family vacation. these aren't complaints all were fixed rapidly with the attention needed ( stove replaced, toliet fixed, security call for the neighors at 2am and a return wake-up at 7 am for them from us--thank you not required whoever you were) We really enjoyed the pool and the spa made my wife melt back into the room for a pleasent ride back to Tennessee. The staff at the resort was great and helpful. Tips for the resort for you to try: 1 request a room with a washer and dryer in the unit it made all the difference. 2. Pack what you will need for the stay in the way of kitchen stuff "FOOD" so not to spend so much when you get there. Attached is a few photos of the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the room”
Reviews.Author: Yahaira
Reviews.Content: My husband, son, sister, brother in law and my niece and nephew all arrived in Kissimmee on Sunday, May 14 and stayed untill the 20th. Check in was a breeze and we were amazed to read all the activities the resort provided. When we got to our 3 bedroom condo, I was a little dissapointed to see that the room was not as big as I thought it was going to be, but it was a pretty good size. I loved the pool area and kiddie beach setting for children, my son and nephew had a blast. I really was not able to attend to any of the resort activities because we were so busy attending two of Disney's Themeparks and their Water Park. My dissapointment arose from the fact, that I was not told about the fee to have the rooms cleaned. My husband and I own timeshare and have had the opportunity to travel to different resorts and we have never been to a resort where housekeeping is not part of the resort fee. The fees to have a person clean your room thouroughly is $50 a day. To have someone tidy up your room was $25, which was outrageous. In summary, we had the best time in Florida because there was so much to do, but as for the resort it was really not that bad.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Star Island over Mother's Day weekend and found our room to be beautiful and clean and very much like brand new. The carpet looked like it had never been stepped on and the ceramic tile also looked brand new. The bedspreads seem to be new as well. We had a mini suite and loved it because it had a fridge, microwave, sink and dishes & silverware which were all very important for eating in, etc. You can not find the things in this room at other hotels! The 2 double beds were in a seperate room which was perfect for watching t.v. in the other room while the kids slept. There were doors to each room which was great for privacy! I loved the central air and all the wonderful extra's these rooms had! I never saw even one little bug anywhere near the room which I thought was amazing for Florida! There were cookouts at the pool side bar with tons of activites for the kids, etc. I would not ever want to stay anywhere else when traveling to Disney!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our daughter, son-in-law and two grandchildren ages 3 & 4 to the resort. We had the three bedroom and yes it was a THREE bedroom. The units were clean and everything was tip top. I am very picky and I have to say we were thrilled. The grounds are great and this is a kid friendly resort. The pools were clean and there were really neat water falls and different water areas to play as well as relax if so desired. There was a terrific singer who played at the pool area from 11AM to 4PM and he was super. There was a bounce house and a sand area for all to enjoy as well as a playground. Everything was kept up tp perfection. There was only one dissapointment and that was the cookout one night. All in all we will go back to STAR ISLAND again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Better be an Early Riser!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Before making our reservations, I checked this place out on-line - very impressed with the photos, but concerned somewhat because of some of the comments. My husband and I just needed a weekend getaway to relax from an extremely busy first 3 1/2 months of the year - the opportunity to sleep in, relax, etc. Check-in was very smooth, and our room was absolutely beautiful. The one bedroom was spacious for the most part (kitchen a little cramped, but we didn't need a big kitchen here) and was very clean. The spa tub was the best, once we got it to work. My husband is very handy and mechanically inclined and was able to get it working without having to call the front desk - but, it should have been working to begin with. Also, the sound system had some wires disconnected so that the only speakers that were working were in the dining area - the speakers in the living room and the bedroom did not work. My husband fixed those as well - we should have charged Star Island for the maintenance repairs my husband did in our room. Saturday morning there was no sleeping in, as we had to be at a presentation at 8:00 in the morning - ouch! No sleeping in that morning! But it worked out okay, this way at least we got a decent start on the day and Universal. Easter Sunday morning - finally a day we can sleep in, even though we were checking out that day. WRONG!!!!!!!!!!!! 7:00 in the morning someone was outside our patio doors with an extremely loud leaf blower! Who in their right mind does landscaping, or leaf blowing, that time of day at a "resort" where people are PAYING for comfort and relaxation; did I mention it was 7:00 in the morning on Sunday - Easter Sunday???? Needless to say, there was no going back to sleep at that point - so we're up. Check out time is not for 3 hours yet, so we can relax for a while; right? NO!! 9:00 a.m. a guy is literally pounding on the front door, ringing the door bell, and pounding some more - only to ask when we would be leaving!! Duh........checkout is 10:00 - we'll be leaving then. Not 15 minutes later, there's another knock on the door, this time a female, with the same question. 15 minutes after that, my husband is carrying the first item to the car, and the guy that had pounded on the door at 9:00 was right there, asking if we were out now. Of course not - we told you 10:00, it's only 9:30!! One last thing.............you know the coupon you get in the brochure they give you when you check in - "buy one drink get one free"???? You better like something other than beer or wine............the coupon is only good for the "expensive" drinks!! What's up with that??? Oh, and I almost forgot - does the Mariott or Gaylord expect you to strip your own beds before leaving? I've never heard of such a thing!! Gather all the linens and towels, place them in the tub, load the dishwasher and start it before leaving - come on!! Where's the service? It's bad enough they don't automatically come in and clean every day - I could have done without fresh towels every day - but having the bed made for us would have been nice - what were we paying for again? Oh yeah, a place to sleep, but not sleep in, where you still have to do the work - may as well have stayed at home!! Next time it's the Mariott for us - where we KNOW we'll have wonderful service, without having to ask, or pay extra!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read many reviews before vacationing and I have to admit I was a bit nervous. I have to tell you I was wrong to be nervous at all. We had a 2 bedroom deluxe for two families of 4 each and couldn't have asked for anything more. It was like we each had our own apartments but we were still close. We typically stayed up later than the other family and I would ask each morning about the noise level and they claim to have never heard anything. (hot tub, laundry, microwave, etc) The unit was meticulously cleaned, every single thing in our unit worked, had hot water everytime we needed it, a beautiful balcony overlooking a pond and fountain, the grounds were beautiful and extremely clean, and the pools were refreshing. We actually looked forward to ending our days at Disney so we could come back to the hotel and hang out at the pool. I honestly couldn't think of one bad thing to say about Star Island Resort and Club. Oh wait - it's not in Wisconsin.

Reviews.Title: “Get a top unit!”
Reviews.Author: elrooko
Reviews.Content: This is supposed to be a 5 star resort. It is nice...BUT...I was in a 3 bedroom lockout on the second floor. The serious lack of sound insulation forced me to have to hear every footstep and chair movement from the unit above me. I had to speak to the people in the unit above me to advise them how loud their every movement was. It was not their fault and they were gracious about trying to keep the noise down at night. DON'T ACCEPT ANYTHING THAT IS NOT ON THE TOP FLOOR! YOU WILL BE VERY UNHAPPY WITH THE NOISE FROM ABOVE. The place itself is nice. Don't go for the Luau unless you like chinese food which is what they served for $20.00...oh yeah and mac n cheese.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Star Island Resort”
Reviews.Author: LuvsLaJolla
Reviews.Content: Through a series of events too long to go into here, I ended up with reservations for a one bedroom in one building, and an efficiency in another. I called two days before our arrival, and the front desk had moved us to one huge unit - a one bedroom and a lockout that had two separate rooms that made a great 3 bedroom place. I found the front desk to be most helpful every time I asked for something. The unit was well furnished, but not exactly luxe. Requests for a DVD player had someone installing one within 30 minutes. The kitchen was sparsely utensiled, not unusual for a time share, but there was the coffee maker and the microwave and a toaster and a blender and an oven, stovetop and full refrigerator. Having a washer and dryer there was great. The balcony was a pleasant place to sit and watch the fountain and the ducks and just enjoy life. We did not spend a lot of time at the resort, but one day with the only child along - an 11 month old - was spent around the pool - great facilities for a toddler, and lots of other children to watch. This is NOT a place for a couple looking for alone time. My husband and I took tennis lessons - at $40 an hour for two of us a real bargain, and the instruction was terrific. I have a new grip and can actually hit backhand most of the time. Major step forward. The water sports were largely unavailable - lake is clogged with some sort of plant, so not much can go on there. If this is important, call ahead to see if it is fixed. We also hit a bucket of balls one day - clubs are available, bucket is $2, it was not a bad way to spend a warm spring afternoon. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Upon our arrival, we were disappointed in the facility and area. It was rated a 5-Star facility and in my opinion, far from it! We had no Internet service unless we hiked to the lobby and paid for service. Our unit ran out of hot water and the sheets in the 2nd and 3rd bedrooms had rips and tears in them. The facility claims of having water sports with jet ski’s and boats, something we were looking forward to, but when we arrived, we were disappointed that they closed the water sports to treat the lake, during one of the busiest seasons of the year! We had traveled from San Diego and still on San Diego time when we were awakened at 8:15 one morning asking us to attend a presentation (That's 5:15 AM San Diego time). We did have a nice living area, but could not open the doors to the patio because the sales office was 3 steps away and agents were outside smoking their cigarettes. Speaking of cigarettes, the unit smelled horrible of cigarette smoke. When we checked out, the first thing we did was to drive to the JW Marriott Resort in Orlando and have lunch. We would have been much happier in a closet there than the 3-bedroom facility at Star Island.

Reviews.Title: “plesantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: gsaoj
Reviews.Content: After reading the Feb. 2006 reviews, I was concerned about our trip to Star Island Resort. The service that I received was the opposite that I had read about. Everyone from check-in to the managers were polite and helpful. The room was great and from the balcony we had a great view of the pond and water fountains. Our bedroom was very well decorated and had a large jacuzzi tub. The first night we ate at the lounge. The food was OK but the singer was very good. We did not spend a lot of time at the resort but tennis seemed to be the main focus. The exercise room was one of the best that I have found at a resort. Their spa seemed to be very good too but I did not get a chance to use it. On the negative side; The reviews on the pull-out couch were true. It is one of the worst that I have seen. I aksed for extra blankets and it supplied more comfort. My teenage daughter survived it but I would not recommend it for an older back. Because there were no double-pane windows, almost any outside noise was audible. The entertainment could always be heard but did stop at 11:00pm. Our A/C quit. I called in for service and a maintenance worker showed up in 20 minutes, even though I waited until late to call. He had it fixed in about 30 minutes. I have stayed at time-share and other resorts all over the world. This one is not the best but it is nice enough to stay without worries.

Reviews.Title: “Star Island Resort reserved with Interval International - Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: ejm231
Reviews.Content: I researched the Star Island Resort on-line with ---- and its room descriptions before reserving on-line. I thought I had reserved the 1 bedroom with spa and balcony since it indicated 1=4+4. Additionally, the room Interval International reserved for us as room number 2433A was a handicapped unit although not noted as such on the Confirmation Certificate. We did not request a handicapped room. Our trip through Interval International and Star Island was not an enjoyable vacation accommodation, did not meet my expectations and created a great deal of anxiety for us as detailed below. We went to check-in at 7:00 p.m. Saturday February 11, 2006, no mention of the handicapped facilities were mentioned as we checked in. We went to the room, discovered it was a handicapped room. We returned to the front desk and requested a non-handicapped room. I specifically asked if this new room had a spa and balcony was told yes to the spa and no to the balcony. At this point I called Interval International and spoke with a representative regarding the room that was reserved for us. She understood but told us this was the only type of room she had available for us at this resort and asked if I had reviewed my confirmation certificate.
