I explained I had research on-line and had thought we reserved another type of unit. We went to the second room 2453 given to us and found no spa, and it was a lock-off room. The neighboring room occupants opened the lockoff door to peer in at us and then quickly closed the door. Additionally this resort only suggested non-smoking and this second room given to us was so filled with cigaratte smoke from the adjoining lockoff 2-bdrm unit that we could not stay in this unit either. I called the front desk explained the circumstances and asked if another room was available and they said they would check and give me a call back. I received no call after waiting 30 minutes and returned with luggage in tow for a second time to the front desk. At this point the front desk staff checked to see if another room was available. I was told that this type of unit was only in building 24 and one last room was available room 2413 on the first floor. This room finally checked out for us and we finally had a room at 10:30 p.m. One other occurrence I’d like to note is that we returned to our room late Monday evening to find that our keycards did not work. We returned to the front desk, explained the situation and they were surprised to find that we were in room 2413. However, they rekeyed our cards and we returned to the room to find it had been cleaned and our starter supplies for the unit removed. I called maintenance during hours and new starter supplies were promptly delivered. So this although we received a free room-cleaning, it was another inconvenience for us and a note to us that the Resort had poor record keeping. While the room itself was good as a lockoff room, I felt like we were in a hole without a view. The two windows in the unit faced the back parking lot. The kitchen viewed a walkway and wall. The bedroom window viewed the parking lot. We stayed out of the room away from the resort as much as we could. This is not our norm; we usually like to enjoy the resort as well as the area attractions. This is our second trip to the area with Interval International and I will not be reserving a 1 bedroom on-line in the future since not enough information is included; it is misleading and deceiving. Lock-off rooms need to be noted as well as smoking policies, handicapped room facilities and Interval International resort descriptions of rooms need to more closely reflect the Resort descriptions, e.g. 1 bedroom suite sleeps 4 privately vs Resort description of Mini Suite. This has definitely been a learning experience the hard way for us. We cannot recommend and will not be staying at Star Island through Interval International in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Ouch!”
Reviews.Author: TUGhil
Reviews.Content: The title is exactly how I feel about this place, OUCH! The timeshare owners ought to reconsider who they are using for management. There is obviously a problem! This place is a classic example of initial looks being deceiving. I agree with other people who have stayed and feel from their experiences that this place is a SCAM. Did anybody else feel SCAMMED, when they figured out that a 3 bedroom is not really a 3 bedroom? Did anybody else feel scammed when they learned that free phone service just means 15 minutes at check out time? Did anybody else realize that paying extra for cleaning fees, means a dusting over only? Did anybody else realize that bedspreads, sheets, and the beds are worn out? How about those comfy pull out sleeper sofas? NOT! Sleeping in the barn on straw would be more comfy that those! Hey Interval International, you guys are responsible too. Start by removing the 5 star rating. Next time, I am staying at the Marriott Royal Palms! Much much nicer, and dependable Marriott service - thank you very much.

Reviews.Title: “Great time by all”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the overall experience at Star Island. The rooms were clean, decorative and comfortable. The pool is lovely with live entertainment (which was excellent) and activities all day. The deck bar is also very nice with live entertainment. The drinks were good and not overpriced and the bartenders were friendly and eager to please. The grounds are well groomed. It was a very pleasant experience. On another note, the lake was not appealing for swimming at all; however, it was nice to sit on the dock and enjoy the view. We had not planned on any water sports so it didn't matter. The location is convenient to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you are coming to the Orlando area be smart and stay away from this facility. The rooms are dirty and the Hotel staff can't be bothered with repairs. I was recenty on a working vacation and they dont explain it anywhere but they charge .10 a minute for Internet connectivity. If you call the front desk they say local calls are free and all the lititure in the room says the same thing however they fail to tell you that only applies to the first 15 minutes. Dirty rooms and rip-off phone scams all while saying they are a 5 star resort and one of the best Spa's in Orlando. When I called and spoke to the Mgr I was told that Fairfield doesnt manage this resort that I should of booked a stay at thier other resort in town. Be smart and dont fall for their scams like I did.

Reviews.Title: “More like a one and a half star resort”
Reviews.Author: JoliePapillon
Reviews.Content: I decided to do some research on this resort before our trip and even though I read some good and bad reports, I was hoping we would experience the good...not a chance. If you have not booked a stay with this resort, then count your blessings. If you have, cancel it. If you feel as if you can not cancel, then by all means, make sure you keep a very close eye on your valuables. My mom's very expensive digital camera was lost during our transition from the car to the hotel. A guest leaving from their stay, found the camera, left a note on our van (since that's where they found the camera next to the van -- smart detective work) and turned it in to one of the employees on property (name withheld). Long story short, we showed the Front Desk personnel and the Manager the note and explained how to get in touch with the person who wrote the note stating the facts about the camera. Front Desk gave us the runaround. Example: #1) The person who received the camera did not work there. #2) They know who the employee is but they couldn't locate him. #3) The employee says he didn't receive the camera and on and on. We were the ones who had to constantly, for our entire week's stay at the "resort" contact the Front Desk personnel and Manager about this unfortunate incident, since they weren't going to keep up with their part of the bargain of calling us with any type of news. Just please, please, do not patron this establishment. If you do, you may seriously regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to Stay - we loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: madambaseball
Reviews.Content: We were there w/ our 16 year old baseball team for a tournament from Dec 26 - Jan 1. The team stayed in a combination of two 3-bedroom suites/condos (which sleeps 10 comfortably) and four 2-bedroom suites. We had a total (inc. players) of 35 people staying at Star Island resort and everyone thought it was a marvelous place. It is super clean and has a terrific staff that accomodated us when we requested more towels, blankets and sheets. They let us check in 3 hours early and let us checkout an hour late. They have daily activities which we couldnt participate in b/c of our baseball itinerary but would have if we had the chance. They offer dinner specials from area restaurants which are very good and affordable - not to mention convenient. The suites are beautiful and are huge. At times, we had most of the team in our unit for meetings and there was plenty of room. There's also a private balcony outside the units w/ a table and chairs. I really can't say enough good things about this resort. Our experience truly could not have been better. As far as it being a 5 star resort - I would give it 10 stars!!! We are definitely going back there next year b/c I think if we'd go anywhere else we'd be disappointed. Our entire team highly recommends this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Super place to stay”
Reviews.Author: linpom
Reviews.Content: We booked a one week stay at the Star Island resort through an Interval International Getaway. We were very impressed. We stayed in a ground floor unit overlooking a waterway with fountains. The apartment was beautifully furnished and spotlessly clean. It was a one bedroomed unit with a fully equipped kitchen including a washing machine and tumble drier, a walk in shower, a jucuzzi etc. There were lots of activities and evening entertainment on the resort. it is just off the 192 so there are loads of restaurants nearby. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Star Isalnd is great with us!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Mother, Sister and I all have 3 bedroom units here. For years and years we have had the best times here. The resort is off 192 and has great tennis, pools, and rooms. OK the decor is a little dated. It would be nice if they had washer/dryer in each unit. The newer units have them in the rooms (B-side). We have to shlep down the elevator and use the free ones on the first floor. One incident happened one year and it was not the fault of the resort, a kid didn't have a swim diaper on and we had to leave the pool for 3 hours. Bummer. Parking can be a problem now with the new units, but this means you might have to WALK (oh no). The grounds, pools and courts are always in great working order. The rooms were always very clean and huge. Never a problem that wasn't fixed in an hour or less. Complete kitchen with all you would need. I brought an orange juicer, and didn't need it; there was one in the room. TV in every room, with CD player and speakers the whirlpool jet bath is a great way to relax after the all day walking at the near by parks. And talk about things to do, there is Disney 10 min. from your front door. 20 min. away is one the top 10 BASS fishing lakes in the U.S. And there is plenty of shopping, everything from Flea markets to fine stores less than 30 min away. There are activities for adults and kids EVERYDAY. If you like tennis, there are plenty of courts, and the best part NO COURT FEES! Any other resort with this many courts would charge at least $10/hr.

Reviews.Title: “Very uneven experience 11-19-05 to 11-26-05”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a long post, please forgive the length but I think it's all important. Star Island makes a great first impression, with beautiful grounds and buildings, but the experience doesn't live up to the appearance. My family owns a timeshare, has for years, and because of the cost of plane tickets to St. Maarten we swapped our week there for Thanksgiving week at Star Island. It was not a comparable experience. First, the "villa" we were given was really just the A and B sides of a lock-out. It was billed as a three-bedroom; this was not really the case. The "A" side contains one bedroom with two full-size beds, and one bedroom with a queen-sized pull-out couch, plus a decent-sized bath with a 1-person jacuzzi tub. The tub was so deep I couldn't imagine anyone with limited mobility getting in and out of there! The pull-out was well-used, to say the least, and not very comfortable. The "B" side had one bedroom with a king-sized bed, the double jacuzzi tub in the bedroom, a full kitchen, living room and patio. The decorations were a few years old, or at least looked that way, but things were reasonably clean and well-kept. The problems began almost immediately. That night when we tried to give my 10-month-old son a bath, we got no hot water in the bathroom on the "B" side. We called maintenance immediately, and it took over 2 hours to call us back -- and say that they would take a look the next morning. OK, now we have a grimy baby and 6 people taking a shower in one bathroom! To their credit they did come by the next morning (10 a.m.) and corrected the problem, but that put a crimp in our plans for the day. The next problem was a malfunctioning window -- no screen (essential in Florida!) and wouldn't stay open. Two guys worked on it for an hour and then told me, sorry, you can't open the window. The longer we were there, the more we noticed details that didn't make sense. First, the lovely marble tile in the bathrooms was horribly slippery when it was wet! Since the tub and shower both were surrounded by this marble tile, it made getting in and out of the bath delicate. Also, there are marble tile stairs into the jacuzzi that have very sharp edges. This caused us a lot of nervous moments with my son, toddler that he is, would go near them (remember, there is no wall between the bedroom and the jacuzzi)! The mid-week cleaning that we expected didn't happen. They will come and exchange your towels, might make a few passes with a vacuum in the living room, but that's it. Considering the number of people showing two bathrooms, they were getting disgusting, and the floor was littered with cookie and chip pieces mostly courtesy of my son. In desperation, I went down to housekeeping and paid $55 cash to have the room "thoroughly cleaned". I guess "thoroughly" means different things to me than to housekeeping. Only one toilet got wiped down, they didn't touch the sinks or tubs; the kitchen cleaning consisted of the vacuum being run three sweeps through it (I was standing there making dinner for my son); the living room cleaning was another half dozen stabs into the center of the room with the vacuum; and only the linens in one room got changed. While I was feeding my son housekeeping called to ask if the maids had been there to clean -- I said yes, and then she thanked me and hung up. After the baby went down for a nap I walked around and realized all that hadn't been done, and had to make the decision not to waste any more of my vacation twisting the arm of someone to do their job properly. Writing this review and not visiting their resort again would have to do. As for the rest of the resort, it was lovely to look at but the details were sloppy. Only half the fountains worked properly; the "adult" pool was closed for repairs the whole visit (and surrounded by more of that treacherous marble tile, a warning sign was even up); the spa looked lovely but the services were overpriced so I can't comment on them. The exercise room looked OK, I never had a minute to visit. If you are one who has a room facing the clubhouse and bar, plan on keeping your windows shut in the evenings -- the every-night karaoke is noisy and painfully talent-free. On the plus side there was plenty of parking, my son really enjoyed the "beach" and splash pool, and it looked like they had some nice programs for kids. The staff was very pleasant, but weirdly powerless to correct problems like bad housekeeping and nonfunctioning windows. The icing on the cake was when we checked out - they tried to charge us AGAIN for the cleaning I had already paid for, and had a reciept to prove it! After a shouting match they "cancelled" the charge, with an attitude, but we were all steaming when we left there. This resort is very much caveat emptor. If you have minimal needs and don't spend much time in the rooms, it's quite adequate. If you have to spend a lot of time there, as we did with the baby, it gets annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Worst stay at a resort in my life!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Where to begin! Tacky decor, smelly rooms, no non-smoking rooms, windows that had to be kept open with a pot, old sheets, have to pay for housecleaning, not enough towels, loud bar (worse because we had to have the windows open - karaoke night), blowing leaves and cutting grass at 5 a.m., have to pay .75 cents everytime you pick up the phone, service was awful. No washer/dryer in room but on main floor of building (very old, tore my clothes). I would not recommend this resort to my worst enemy. We did the timeshare tour (very tacky) and we were paid $50 or discount at an event (I read on someone else's review they were paid $75!) We were told it would only take one hour and it took two! BIG BIG waste of our precious vacation time. We did find out during the tour a whole bunch of stuff that the front desk never informed us of! Need to upgrade, change management, and pay more attention to detail and service.

Reviews.Title: “Love it !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: EagleOne865
Reviews.Content: 2nd time and everytime I love it. Great service,rooms clean. Close to all atractions, supermarkets and Lynx public transportation marker 11. Great for a person who don't want to drive in their vacation. They have shuttle to all atractions for $10 p/p roundtrip. You can't beat that since car parking in the park is $9.00. Recommend. No pushy salesperson

Reviews.Title: “Very Average!”
Reviews.Author: chilltill
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came to Star Island with great expectations, especially after doing our homework on the internet. We are not owners but were interested in possibly joining after our visit. We found the resort to be under average. At check-in we asked for an upgrade to a one bedroom suite being that our original reservations were not made correctly, but we were met with a big "can't do" due to the fact that other owners have reserved those rooms. That was understandable and a good enough reason but we found out later that more than half of the units were vacant throughout our entire visit. The mini-suite was very tiny, but we made the best of it. There were other issues but since were not going to join at Star Island why bash. All in all the location is fairly close to all the parks and the resort is very neat and clean. Lots of bugs, frogs, and lizards on the outside but not inside. Hey thats Florida......

Reviews.Title: “Nice & relaxing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Louisiana relatives were staying here when I was stuck at a crazy relatives apartment in 98. So when I had my chance to come in 03, I jumped at it! Luckily my husband and I were not disappointed and only wish we had booked our honeymoon here rather than another place down the road this past July..... Easy check in, clean room, friendly not-to-pushy sales guy (we were out in less than a half hour), cleaning crew doesn't come in, unless you request--I like not having people around my stuff and I wasn't gonna pay for it so I knew they would stay away. Nice size tv in the living room for basketball playoffs. Close to Publix, Walmart, and my favorite chicken place, Hooters. Liked the pool and work out room. Look forward to going again.

Reviews.Title: “loved star island”
Reviews.Author: garthene
Reviews.Content: we loved this resort!! i traveled with my husband and two kids ages 9 and 4. we had a great time. lots of activities for the kids at the pool everyday. my husband even got to go on a golf outing with other guests. unfortuntely i didnt get to use the spa so i cant comment on that. our room on the other hand was great! so much room and we only had the "B" side of the suite. which has the full kitchen and washer/dryer. **note if you dont research your accomadations you might get mixed up the "A" side of the suite is really small double beds and a sitting area. the "B" side is the larger with full kitchen. i write this because we only got the "B" side when we stayed because that was room enough for us, but the family that stayed in the "A" side during the last half of our vacation said they booked thinking that "A" meant it was the larger room. parking was never a problem. for shoppers there are stores everywhere within a mile or two. i have to say i did have to call for room service when we got there upon checking everything out i noticed there were no pillows on bed, and no extra blankets for the kids on pull out couch. they had them to our room within 30 minutes. then the most impressive thing was that they called after i had just answered door and made sure that the maid brought them to us and did i have any other concerns. the staff was great never had a problem. when we got there we were early and they said they would call us when room was ready and within 45 minutes and us checking out the grounds they called and we got to go to our room early. we stayed 2 weeks at this resort and the whole first week it rained but it didnt get us down. went to disney anyway. and they had pizza party and other get togethers at the upstairs bar. we had a great view from our own balcony. we watched the sun rise and set. i do agree with some of the people on here that the decorations and carpet etc do need to be brought up to date but it didnt bother me (burgandys and pinks just arent my style). about the timeshare spill well we already own fairfield timeshare thats why we stayed here and so close to disney. we did go to it and they just updated us on our current timeshare and asked if we wanted to add to our current and we said no and there were no hard feelings and the saleslady didnt get snotty like one person said on here but maybe depends on person. plus we got $75.00 for our time in disney gift certificates and that really came in handy. i loved this resort and would recommend this resort to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “NOT A FIVE STAR RESORT”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from this resort. I was not impressed with the mini suite. We could hear every thing from next door, mold on the ceiling,tastless decor. sheets with holes, towels with holes,two very cramped rooms with very small tv sets, A/C unit very loud. I could not relax or sleep in this place. the rooms where not well lit. I felt itchy when I entered the room. The main grounds very well kept. pool was very nice. They charge .75 for local calls. The mini suite does not sleep 6 the sofa bed had no cushion what so ever you can see the coils. my daughter had to sleep on it unopened. I have seen better rooms in three star hotels/motels than this. I don't know why anyone would by a timeshare with this type of room. We will try other timeshares base on recommendations from friends and family never again from site ads.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: BettinaR
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our stay at Star Island Resort. I was a bit worried after reading some of the reviews, but I can honestly say that this Hotel was really quite nice. Our check-in was no problem and we were able to get into our room right away (it was about 2:30 in the afternoon). We had suites A and B and there was ample room. The master bedroom was beautiful and we took advantage of our private jacuzzi...felt great after those long park days! The kitchen was fully equipped with everything that you would need. The washer and dryer came in handy as well. Although the decor is abit outdated, the room was very very clean. Loved the artistic way they would display the towels. Nice touch!! There was the odd bug but hey, it was pretty hot and humid so the odd insect is expected. Nothing to worry about! The grounds around the Hotel were equally clean. The gym was great. The pool was wonderful and there were alot of activities to take part in. The kids loved it!!! The staff at the spa were very gracious as well....had the best pedicure..thanks Lorena!! And it is nice and close to Walt Disney World....All and all we had a lovely stay at the Star Island Resort and I would recommend it to anyone!!!! Thanks Star Island!!!

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading multiple negative reviews about this resort, I did not know what to expect. I had traded my timeshare week for a week at Star Island. Check in was easy, we got there at 11am and check in is 4pm. I registered and they said they would call on my cell as soon as the room was ready. As promised, they called at 1pm. The room was a A & B suite. It was clean, bright and very large. It had everything we needed. Daily messages were left on the phone with the activities of the day. The pool area was great. Never a problem with parking. The staff was polite and helpful. It was close to everything. Disney was just 4 miles away. It was a great place to stay. I wonder if the people who write these negative reviews expectations are unrealistic.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was the best trip of our lives! I was a little worried when reading some of the reviews. This is our first big trip with the kids, and I wanted it to be perfect. I was relieved when we got into our room. The room was very clean and spacious. My children loved the pool, it wasn't too deep for them, and very warm. Check in was very easy, they were very pleasant. The only thing I would have changed, there is only one bathroom in the "B" unit, and it is in the master bedroon. So for those staying on the sleep sofa, you have to walk through the bedroom. Other than that, the room was great! I would definatly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time! Attentive staff, great room!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was really nervous about our upcoming trip (after reading these reviews!), but I was quickly put at ease. We arrived at the resort on a Friday evening and check in was a breeze. When we arrived in our room, I saw that we did not have a washer/dryer, and in place of the main tub, we had a large handicap accessible shower stall. I called the office and told them that I needed a washer/dryer and a tub (I wasn't going to fill the huge jacuzzi in the master bedroom to bathe my kids!). They moved us right away and then called to make sure we were satisfied with our new room. We had a 2 bedroom deluxe suite, which essentially means the A and B units *like ajoining hotel rooms. This was perfect for us. We propped the doors open and made one huge suite. My 7 year old LOVED having his own room with TV and refrigerator, my mom and 5 year old shared a room with the 2 double beds, while my husband, baby and I made ourself feel like royalty in the huge master suite with king bed, double jacuzzi and huge shower. Everything was very clean and in repair, and when I called to ask for a port-a-crib it was delivered immediately. The pools were wonderful, warm and clean. The activites at the pool were fun! My 5 year old won a limbo contest and my husband won a splash contest! The playground and moon bounce were great too! The time that we were there was not crowded and we found the staff to be attentive and kind. We were not hassled to view the property at all. They sent out daily voice mail messages to let guests know of what is going on, on site. One day they even offered 50% off massage services at the spa! Ordering from TGI Friday's was quick and easy - food was great and delivery was fast. We ordered from the local pizza shop and had it delivered to the pool - that was great too! They offered a cleaning service midweek as well as a towel exchange midweek. There was an extra charge for these services. We had a wonderful time, we felt taken care of, and we would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience - long but worth reading”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My father passed away last Easter 4-11-04 so for the 4th of July I deceided to take the family on a little "getaway" to ease the pain. We stayed at Star Island in Kissimmee, Fl and from the moment we arrived, there was nothing but trouble. Our room was supposed to be ready at 1:00pm but the clerk at the front desk said "unfortunately the people in your room didnt check out yet." He told us we could leave our luggage at the front desk and when the room is available, they will put the luggage in the room for us. Being a New Yorker, I asked how safe it was to leave the luggage in the lobby. The clerk replied "we have security camaras as well as we do not allow people near the luggage." Sounded good at the time. We left the luggage and went to Disney World for a little bit. When we arrived back at the hotel, the luggage was still in the lobby with all the zippers openned. I looked in my bag first to notice someone went through everything and stole some clothes as well as other items from my bag. My mother and sister then checked their bags and sure enough, items were stolen from their bags as well. I immediately blew up at the manager (the clerk that originally helped us left for the day) and told him I needed a police officer immediately. He told me it is not smart to have the police involved, the hotel will handle everything. Again, being from NY, I called B.S. and said get the police here now. He gave me an attitude and the phone number and told me to call myself if I wanted them there. We filled out a police report and called it an evening. The next morning I went down to the lobby to find the original clerk but was told he was off and will be in tomorrow. Tomorrow never came because our entire 7 day stay he did not show up once. I as well as the police officer that helped us out think it was the clerk that went through the bags. The stay became worse each day we were there but I will not go into that because this should be enough to make you not want to stay there. Anyway, it is now 5-13-05 and we still havent recieved a dollar from Star Islands Insurance company. As a matter of fact, I call twice a week only to realize my phone calls are still being ignored by the Insurance company as well as Star Island. I also found out Star Island is only insured for a maximum of $1000.00 per theft and being my family and I filled out 1 police report for all our items stolen, it counts for one incident so we only get the max $1000.00 payment if and when they send it to us. We had between $2000.00 and $3000.00 stolen. The insurance company Star Island uses is Wausau Insurance Companies. I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS RESORT TO ANYONE!!!! YOU WILL GET 2ND CLASS TREATMENT AT BEST!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Better than the reviews”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would have to agree with that this is not a five star.However some of the reviews I read before going to star Island really had me nerveous about staying there and we were pleasantly surprised. I was looking for things to be bad. We had 4 adults and one 18 mo. old in our group and we satyed in a 3 bedroom 2 bath for a 7 night stay Mar.19th-26th.(Bld.19 4th floor)Plenty of room. There was an elevator.The decor is outdated,early 80's style.Clean though.One thing that would have been nice would be a mid-week cleaning service.There is a trash shute in the hall that you have to bring your trash too. The washer/dryer (with detergent )was nice.The staff was helpful in our opinion.We had a broken A/C and it was looked at right away and fixed the next a.m.We asked for a DVD player and they brought one to us no problem.There is a charge for wireless in the lobby.The fitness center was nice but the Spa was just Ok. I have been to a few 5 star spas and this wasn't.The pools were both nice,very warm and the Jacuzzi was hot.It was crowded around the pool but being spring break what wasn't.The little area with the water spouts coming up from the ground was a great thing to keep my 18mo.old busy.The play ground and Jumpy house were nice too.We did have to go for the sales presentation as we were on an owner referal special rate($995.00) for the week.( A lot cheaper than most 3bd.condo's in Kissimme in March)They were not too pushy with us.I would say that overall Star Island was a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Canceled reservation Poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Star Island Resort canceled our confirmed reservation less than one week from our arrivial date without providing alt. accomadations. Ruined my twin 5 year olds trip to Disney World since all other hotels in the area were booked solid. When we finally got in touch with the manager, she never returned our calls, She acted like there was nothing she could do. Guess they don't need customers. Seems like the time share owners have first pick even over confirmed reservatons. This is the worst Customer Service I have ever seen. I wouldn't make a reservation with them as it serves no purpose, you are not confirming anything.

Reviews.Title: “Thought It was Very Nice!!!”
Reviews.Author: hjs799
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Star Island resort was very nice. I do agree though, that they're claiming to be a five star resort is a tad off base. Perhaps it's not for those folks who can afford the higher end suites, but for us, it was a nice stay, but not five star. First off, the staff was wonderful to our every need. We had a small problem with the toilet on about our third day and they came and fixed it immediately as well as getting us fresh towels and making sure we had them by another phone call, which I thought was nice. There was just the two of us, so we didn't need a spacious suite...those of you with four or more in your familys, do NOT stay in one of the mini-suites. Yes, they are tiny, but were fine for the two of us. My only serious conplaints were with the bathroom. No shelf space to put anything. The tiny glass shelf under our mirror was barely hanging on by a thread, so we didn't dare put anything heavier than a toothbrush on it. And the controls for the whirlpool tub are clear across the room and I thought the tub was broken until I found them. The pools were great, especially since we had some real warm days in mid-February. We sat down by the pool and enjoyed it very much. I do wish it were a tad larger to accommodate all the people and the deck chairs. It go quite crowded and hard to move a chair around when it go busy. Other than that, I thought it was a wonderful place. Clean and no bugs. We were on the fourth floor of building #22. Parking was a pain on one or two nights, but for the most part we were able to park near the building and the elevator took us right to our room. No problem. The grounds were nicely done and were beautiful to walk through. I didn't take advantage of the spa or the exercise room...far too busy, but they looked nice. The staff was always willing to answer any questions we had. AND...we were NEVER bothered about going to any meetings to "buy" one of the condos are told to go to another desk when checking in. Not one person or phone regarding that. Probably because we were in one of the cheapest suites and they didn't feel we were worthy...who knows!

Reviews.Title: “not a five star !!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: our stay at star island was not the best. The room that they put us in was very tiny for a family of SIX. >It was not 5 stars at all. There was no maid service , had to pay for coffee (2.00) a cup!! no breakfast for the guest come on even Motels have breakfast. Whould not stay again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: KYandBD
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just got back from 3 nights at Star Island. Never again will we stay there. There were small pieces of glass on the edge of the bathtub. The bathroom fixtures looked like they were about to fall off. The furniture was from the 60s... Star Island is not a high quality resort by any means. Maid service was awful. The front desk staff was unaccomodating. One morning we woke up to banging and chatter at 7:15 am. The front desk staff was unapologetic, and we had to go outside oursevles to tell the workers to stop the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: kihei02
Reviews.Content: Our crew of seven- 4 adults, 2 children and an 18 month old, just got back from Orlando and stayed at Star Island from Jan. 15-29th, 2005. We booked it thru Interval, and the reason we chose Star Island was that it was listed as a 5 star and we could book it a year in advance. Well it wasn't a five star as far as I'm concerned. We stayed in the A & B unit with 2 bedrooms, a room with a pull out, and a pull out in the living room. The Cons My biggest beef was our third floor balcony. Our 18 month old couldn't even go out on it. The railings were spaced so far apart she could slip her head and body thru. So needless to say, none of us went out there much. An easy solution would be chicken wire around the balcony if requested. I wouldn't care how it looked if she were safe to wander freely. Our toilet kept overflowing, and even after maintence looked at it, the back end of the condo unit smelled like sewage for the entire time we were there. I went to have a soak in the smaller jacuzzi tub one night, and luckily I had to turn on the jets before I got in, cause one jet cover came off and blasted black gunk into the tub. It was pretty gross. The pools were freezing. The kids pool was uninhabitable so my 18 month old couldn't even walk around in it, nor my three year old. The big pool was slightly warmer but not much, and the hot tub was heated to about the temperature the big pool should have been. In two weeks we went swimming twice. We only saw one cockroach in our room, and one gecko who ran in when we opened the door. He was pretty cute. The gecko, not the cockroach. The Pros Any calls for maintenace and cleaning service were dealt with promptly, like high chairs, cribs, linen and fixing the bathroom appliances. They had great fun nights for the kids. One night it was all you can eat tacos followed by a juggler. Another, it was hot dogs and hamburgers with a magician. The people hired were great to include the kids from the audience. Star Island is 15 minutes from Walt Disney World parks. Close to shopping like Wal-Mart, Sam's Club and Target, plus all the big outlet malls. It wasn't all bad. Star Island would not be my first choice if we ever go to Orlando again, but you could do a lot worse. This was our first big family trip, and I'd been planning it for over a year and a half. I guess I was a little disappointed. I had read the reviews posted here and thought that people were being too picky, but I will definately take a bit more stock in peoples reviews from now on.

Reviews.Title: “0 stars never 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i have stayed at 5 star resorts and belive me star island is no 5 star resort the rooms are dirty and not well kept they don't provide any kind of service we stayed there for 4 nights and they never picked up the garbage that was outside my door we asked for clean towels and never got them we asked for extra pillows the first night and didn't get them until the second night we were on the third floor and there was no elevator. i would never stay at this place again nor would i ever recommend this place to anybody, they should be ashamed to call themself a 5 star resort,zero in my book. if anyone wants to buy a timeshare in this place you better think twice this place is a dump.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to hang your hat...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed there December 25 - January 1, 2005 in building 18 on the second floor. It was an Interval trade and we occupied both A and B units. The B unit was huge and nicely decorated with a full kitchen, washer and dryer, living room with pull-out couch and master suite with an in room jacuzzi and a walk-in shower. They supplied a some laundry detergent, dishwashing soap, sponges and dishwasher powder. There was also a terrace. The entertainment unit in the living room had a CD player and a VCR - nice touch! The A unit consisted of a bathroom with a small jacuzzi tub, bedroom with two double beds and a living room with a kitchenette, TV and pull-out couch. All the bedrooms had TVs as well. The "tech" staff was very helpful in assisting my son in setting up his Play Station and in helping us set up our laptop for internet access via the phone line. The charge for using the phone line was $.75 each time as it was a local call. Not a bad deal. They also have computers with internet access set up in the main building for a charge if you don't want to bring your own computer. Room service was provided by TGI Fridays. We ordered one night and they took about an hour and a half to deliver...then they forgot part of our order. We called to complain and they apologized and gave us our meal for free. The next time we ordered was much better! (I have to cut them a break..it was a crazy busy week in Orlando!) Grounds are nice, pools nice and if you like tennis you'll be happy here. Not much action at the lake, but it was a bit on the cool side. The gym is excellent - plenty of cardio machines to go around- elipticals, treadmills, steppers and bicycles. There are also weight machines and an area for stretching and sit-ups. My only complaint about the resort was the lack of knowledge and hours of the concierge. She often left as early as 3:00, leaving us to ask the front desk for suggestions on eateries. All in all I think this was a great place to stay and very convenient to all the parks.

Reviews.Title: “would go back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews from earlier in the year I was very leary to stay at star island.We had been there before when it was brand new about 7 years ago. We checked in on Christmas day and found the staff to be very courteous and friendly.Our unit the "A" side was small but very clean and no sign of "bed bugs". The bathroom floor needed some attention and with one phone call it was taken care of. We traded into this resort and got a studio-still wondering about that as we traded a 1 bedroom.Facilities were good pool beautiful with daily activities for the kids.Good security and nice amenities. Check out at 10 am but the staff very accomodating about letting you hang at the pool after check out until afternoon.
